        "author": "artgrafiken",
        "author_reputation": 152458409420146,
        "beneficiaries": [],
        "body": "![forrest_racist_race_ink_on_paper_2016_web_res.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/artgrafiken/23uRL6XVKNwXCGZvZgksPJNttoaX33tjQ4cfV6i1SHtFpDNFmZ5RTDnJr7ut4QQnKmZFd.jpg)\n\n**Racist Race**\n\nWe're all racists, and that means all races, creeds, colors, religions, in short the whole human race.\nMalcolm X, upon his return from Africa, it was noted he had changed, not so outspoken about the white devil, me thinks he found some black ones too.\n\nThere it was on a library shelf, a book, a history of slavery in Africa and on it's cover an African Chief. He was a hero to the slavers, the white slavers, whom he taught the ricks of the trade.\nThere were so many tribes enslaving each other over the millenniums, it goes back to the beginning and continues to this day.\n\nLike racism, it all comes down to this—I am better than you, I am over you, I can do things you cannot. You are inferior, you are below human, an animal, and you must be treated as such.\nAnd in every culture around the world there are examples of this.\nThere is nothing wrong with being happy or proud of your race, but remember you share this feeling with all races. \n\nRace is really the last thing it comes down to for equality, because we are not equal, but different, and we, all of us, make up the colossal experiment called civilization. We all have a unique potential that goes beyond our race and makes us unlike even our own.\n\nThose racial slurs, those words that have so much power, too much power, those that would remind us of them, keep them and hold them over us. We need to pull the plug on the power of those words and see it is just a game they make us play. The I'm better than you are game. \n\nThere is an equalizer in the world.  More powerful than the racist game. It is called family. And even someone of another color can become the son to another color, a brother or sister, father or mother. Feeling of paternal guardianship comes to us all and it matters not the race, because family is in all our blood streams flowing on and on, it becomes a mighty river, this family feeling, and it is stronger than the silly game they make us play.\n\nWe are family, a very big family that stretches around the world, that speaks many languages and wears many hats, that walks many roads and lives many lives and all, all, all of us are part of this huge racist race, we are all part of this game they trick us with. We must not be tricked anymore. \n ",

        "body": "HBDStats now has Hive stats!\nSince my last [update](https://peakd.com/hive-133987/@dalz/hbdstatscom-update) back in April I have added more elements to the web. Let’s take a look!\n\n\nLet’s take a look.\n\n \n\n\n![01.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tkjcwb5gpPPGzrTAAMprujbR71EVRCdqpNxDSZ4X8CjsJQzwA3yWCZrRLCE44SsWvBf.png)\n\n\nhttps://www.hbdstats.com/\n\n\nFirst and foremost, there is now a new tab on the top with the HBD and HIVE options:\n\n \n![Picture1.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tGTG7T3SbFU3WKphHB6Ui5CN3FyP5pHULD8nHCUKzAj2X8kx4p1LbjSvrGmfMaF3pfq.png)\n\n\n\n\nWhen you toggle on the HBD tab there are the options:\n- Debt\n- Savings\n- HBD Supply\n- DHF Supply\n- Cumulative\n- Interest\n\nMost of these were there before the update, except for the **interest** chart, that is now new.\n\n\n\n\n![InterestRate.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23swcKD6nVJMaHyw3vi7LnKBw8A1ZVMb9fpXtMRdXxPBMQFhZ5DKqQv2g1xARJLJmuWVE.png)\n\n\n\n\n \n\n\nHere we can see the historic move of the interest rate for HBD in savings. We can see that prior to 2021 there was no interest for HBD, then a series of few adjustments on the upside, up to 20% and then a drop to the current 15%.\n\nHaving historic HBD interest is a vital parameter that users holding HBD in savings should have in mind, and to note that this parameter is dynamic and has seen changes in the past, based on what then users can bring their conclusions about HBD allocation. \n\n\n## Hive Stats\n\n\nOn the totally new addition, the hive tab, currently we have this:\n- Hive Supply\n- Hive Power\n- Active Accounts\n- Transactions\n</br>\n\n\n The **Hive supply** is obviously a key parameter, as for any other blockchain. \n\n![HIveSupply.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23swbvyyvpefjMEB6MAhbcGjcQoBkYRTokvCQhLBwyCnrKoLoigxucTaXojaWx8P2ovLw.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nThe supply and the inflation rate are something that is closely monitored from the community, as it represents the debasement of the token holders, and when corelated to the staking rewards it gives users, info are they beating inflation with their earnings. On top of this there is info on the current supply data. As for the other chart, users can change the timeframe to 1Y and less. Additionally, as for the other charts, there is a download button for the token supply in CSV form, with daily data back from 2016 that anyone can use in their analysis. \n\nGoing forward I will add another chart with the inflation data represented in % units.\n\n**Next on the list is the Hive Power data:**\n\n\n \n\n![HivePower.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23swc1PT6dpsS2yxtCHUJ3KPPfUuRnZPdmmwMQcctwcDyKwjhz1T9EBUX6E3AHiKEGJhS.png)\n\n\n\n\nAnother key parameter is how much of the token supply is staked, or in this case powered up. Here we have an overview from the very beginning of the chain back in 2016. The option for choosing a different timeframe is here as well and the download button. \nAnother interesting parameter that can be added here is the share of the Hive Powered up, currently at 39%. A historic chart can be a good representation for this as well.\n\n#### Daily Active Accounts\nAnother key parameter, daily active accounts!\n \n\n![DAUs.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23swcKCogmCAcgey42wnhZCUNQJPXL7V9tqevXd82dGLJzigVhysRjP7X9nhmcXV9ULUu.png)\n\n\n\nHere as well we have a historical data going all the way back. Note that the number of active accounts is for all types of operations, and the massive spike back in 2021 is due to the explosion in the activity on Splinterlands. Going forward a breakdown of the active accounts by operation can be included, like account posting, voting, custom_json, transfers, etc. \n\n\n\n\n#### Number of Transactions per Day\nAnother key parameter, the activity on the chain, or the number of transactions per day. \n \n\n\n\n\n\n![Tx.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23swdzuaftB5zNiDmy2cgKYSuU8xHnEKRnsjoU7DGioRugh6BtHpjfehdZ9amGmz7ZTAt.png)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nThis chart as for the active accounts includes all types of operations made, the options for adding a further breakdown by type of operations can be implemented here as well. \n\n### Future Plans\nAs already pointed out, I do plan to add a few more charts, especially on the Hive side, including the inflation rate, share of Hive powered up, and breakdown of the activity and transactions by type of operation.\n\nOn the HBD side, there can be more aditions, like daily paid HBD interest, DHF payouts, top holders etc. \n\nAnother major addition I plan to add is data on the **Splinterlands** tokens, SPS and DEC. I do post now from time to time about the supply and inflation of these tokens, but getting data on the historical supply can be a challenge. There are APIs that Splinterlands provide for the current supply, from where I can make daily snapshots and create a timeseries. \n\n\n\n\n#### Support the Project\nThe web has a nice amount of data and charts now, from the early beginning, where there was only one chart. It is a full stack web, with a backend, its own database and APIs. While I do this for personal pleasure, growth and to upscale my skills, any appreciation is more than welcomed. It will for sure boost motivation and speed up the development :). I dont know exactly how many hours I have put in it till now, but it is a lot. For sure I do plan to put all the code on github, and the data is free to be downloaded even now, for every chart. \n\n\nI have integrated donation buttons in HBD, for anyone that finds the provided data useful. The transactions lead to keychain link with all the safety measures in place, first choose account, and then confirm the transaction. \n\n \n\n\n![Support.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23swaANVxztCrADgi1Z3jdxR8dSQtJHmJ74sQDy2Kj39qNWgU1KDUfMiYgkqgYqfrX8nv.png)\n\n\n\n\nhttps://hbdstats.com/\n\n\n**If you have any additional proposals, feedback and addition you want to see in the web, let me know in the comments!**\n\nAll the best\n@dalz\n",

        "body": "The DEC tokens have been going through a maturity phase in Splinterlands. It was the first token that the game introduced, effectively incorporating the play to earn system back in 2019. The initial design was to provide an in-game token with a semi stable value and use it for trade and price in the game. In the last months the price of the token was close to its peg due to the ongoing new card sale and the need for DEC to buy the new cards edition. Lets take a look!\n \n\n\n![01.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tkmuutV7ssVDrYxbQZJNUA2pPQEH9GRoEsWkqVuLYVd3wMdEDCu16ZSfQhibxTHtNZw.png)\n\n\n\n\nDEC was introduced in 2019 and it was a reward token that gamers received when playing and winning games. At the beginning the focus was on providing support for the token on the downside, because usually in game reward tokens tend to be sold from gamers. To achieve this Splinterlands uses a so called “product backed currency” where packs and otter assets are sold in fixed DEC price. \n\nLater, in 2021, the SPS token was introduced, that made the price of DEC surge on the upside. There were no efficient mechanics in place to limit the DEC price on the upside and DEC reached 10x the value it was designed to. There were some mechanics in place (printing more when the price is higher), but this was not effective enough to peg the price on the upside. This was back in 2021.\n\nSince then, more tweaks to the DEC tokenomics were introduced. DEC is now not a reward token in the game. It can be created at a fixed price when burning SPS for DEC. This gives it a lot more effective limit on the upper side. On the downside, more products and use cases are introduced where DEC is used or burned. Some of the most recent has been the Land 1.5 expansion that requires staked DEC in order for the land to produce. Another one that is just fresh is the DEC fee to unlock reward cards. Users receive reward cards as locked, soulbound, and after some period they can unlock the burning some DEC in the process. \n\n\n\n----\n\nWe will be looking at:\n-\tDaily and monthly DEC created/burned\n-\tDEC created VS burnt\n-\tDEC supply\n-\tStaked DEC on land\n-\tTop accounts staking DEC\n-\tDEC price and market cap\n\n\n## DEC Created VS Burnt\nHere is the chart for the daily amount of DEC created and burned starting from October 2020.\n\n \n\n\n![image001.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23swgJvcFfMm9TULYh6rRkpoAJtDyVEo4i4htSuhSLYafbioSvcdR1FSUwUQkgjyzPtcQ.png)\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA lot of volatility for the DEC token emissions. \n\nAt first, back in 2020 and 2021, the daily emission was low to around 1M and below. But then in August 2021, things changed, as the SPS token was introduced and an overall bull market for the Splinterlands assets begun. This triggered more DEC to be printed and for some time there was more than 10M DEC printed daily, that was x10 or even x20 from the previous emissions. These numbers dropped in 2022. Еmissions cuts were made in the following period, making the printing of new DEC tokens limited. Since then up to recently DEC was mostly deflationary with more DEC burned daily than printed. \n\nThe major way to create the DEC token now is with SPS burns. As the demand for the DEC token grows in game, we can see more SPS being burned for DEC. \nIn the last period we can see moves in the both directions, and a very volatile ones, although we can notice that there is more positive bars, meaning the DEC supply has increased. \n\n## Monthly DEC Created VS Burned\n\nFor a better representation here is the monthly chart for DEC created VS burned. \n\n \n\n\n![image015.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23t77B9ZrnWfT8HpdEoocGR2gb1jRGKoA3XsFzFZVuovkaX4M6N8RNwSQZwyhaoUwkxa8.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nThis is a much clearer representation for the cycles DEC has gone trough. At first small moves, then in the summer of 2021 printing DEC a lot up to September 2022 when the burning DEC started and lasted up to December 2023. A growth in the first half 2024 then a drop in the summer of 2024. \nIn the last months we can notice the spikes in April and especially in May 2025 when there was close to 1B DEC created in that month alone. This is due to the introduction of the new cards edition and the presale phase in the period. In June and July there is a small drop in the supply. \n\n\n\n## DEC Supply\nHere is the chart for the DEC supply.\n\n\n\n\n![image003.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/Eo1wMUT5P9wuDAszy4nv3smeJcdq171joKJwGMn66dsytu7r18uJT1BGXhwnmStthnR.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nThis chart probably shows the DEC supply in the best way. \nSteady moves back in 2020 with around 4.5B DEC in circulation. An uptrend in the summer of 2021 up to August 2022 when the ATH for the DEC supply happened around the 7B mark. A downtrend since then and a bottoming out in October – November 2023 around the 4.8B supply. An increase in the first half of 2024 almost to 6B, and a slow decrease afterwards again up until April 2025 when there is a spike in the supply to **6.4B**. Almost constant supply since then with a small drop.  \n\nWhen we plot this as a yearly inflation, this is the approximate data for the last three years. \n\n| Date      | Supply        | Yearly Inflation |\n|-----------|---------------|------------------|\n| 1.1.2020  | 4,173,764,521 | 9.77%            |\n| 1.1.2021  | 4,581,715,347 | 29.90%           |\n| 1.1.2022  | 5,951,779,514 | 5.17%            |\n| 1.1.2023  | 6,259,245,902 | -13.55%          |\n| 1.1.2024  | 5,411,095,406 | 1.57%            |\n| 1.1.2025 | 5,393,883,993 | -0.32%            |\n| 7.23.2025 | 6,384,752,000 | 18.37%           |\n\nWe can see that 2021 was the most inflationary for DEC, then a relatively small inflation in 2022 of 5%, 2023 negative -13.55%  inflation, and the last two years, 2024 and 2025 a growth again in the supply.\n\nWhat should be noted about the DEC supply, apart from the total numbers, is the structure and allocation. The DEC allocation is totally different now then what it was in 2021 for example. So although we are close to the ATH in terms of the supply, if we look under the hood we will see that around half of that is now locked or in the DAO, that holds 3B DEC now, while back in 2021 it was nonexistent. Another big chunk of tokens is now staked on land, close to 1.5B. Just these two position consist close to 3 quarter of the current DEC supply, while back in 2021 both of them were nonexistent. We will look closely at the DEC allocation breakdown further bellow. \n\n## Staking DEC on Land\nStaking DEC on land is relatively new, since November 28th, 2023. Here is the chart.\n\n \n\n\n![image005.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tGXZjjc9e1YqS4wHiRTHw6RwK7Yg16cZMkmSssMxUWfYoPXk4HoydCqnievkuvfu25w.png)\n\n\n\n\nAs we can see, most of the staking happened in the first month, reaching **1.5B** DEC on land and since then it has been almost flat, with very small changes in the amount of DEC staked on land. \n\n**The chart for the current DEC allocation looks like this:**\n\n\n\n\n![image017.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23t76y514w3GM3syM1GsuoHUZxNtAC5hiviW9c44KmMCWny97iKqoD26jhSEFnrcrWHWk.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nCourtesy of https://www.splintercards.com!\n\nThe DAO now holds half of the DEC supply. This means that a lot of the DEC is actually not freely available, and the freely available supply has been going down in the last period with a lot of it ending in the DAO. The DAO usually takes a share from various sales that happens in the game and with the recent sale of the new card set it has increased it position for almost a billion DEC going from around 2B six months ago to 3B now. That is 1M in USD value if DEC is at its peg value.\nThe share of staked on land is in the second spot with 24%, then the regular players with 17%. The company holds 4% now or around 225M DEC, that is not a lot having in mind the presale was a month ago and the regular card sale is ongoing. \n\n\n## Top Accounts Staking DEC\nHere are the top accounts that staked DEC.\n\n \n\n\n![image023.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/EoATRTWVPC4aTUe9tz1mJbqFtJJM5HLD3gtCm6523HSEW75zoj1Bjv41hMysxQQ1Njj.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nThe top account @vugtis has more than 220M DEC staked. On the second spot is @jarvie followed by @cryptomancer on the third spot. \n\n## Price\n\nSo, after all of this burning and use cases for DEC how is the price doing. Here is the chart. \n\n\n\n\n\n![image025.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23t77B9ZqetJMnMMEqkAdMQKAGGUeFMjkP6L6Cquf8vsaAiqUfPvcEkBgXb9NhrDgdzQn.png)\n\n\n \n\n\nAs mentioned previously, in the past DEC had inefficient mechanics to limit its price on the upside and because of this at the beginning of 2022 the token was trading above its peg of 0.001 USD. Then the SPS to DEC conversions were introduced and this is a lot more efficient design. On top of this, the overall market took a major downtrend in 2022, so the upper side of the token was no longer a problem. DEC broke its peg on the downside, trading at 0.0006 for a period of time, or at 40% discount, for a short period of time.\n\n**When we zoom in 2024-2025 we get this:**\n \n\n\n\n\n![image030.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23swgMwgfwQDgfuecwsB1JjUSv9cbhajXLdYocNR6VQ8EucjFvtUkkYY4wQA6yUSYVyHs.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nWe can see that in the period DEC has seen lows at 0.0006 back in September 2024 and on the upside it has not breached the 0.0010 limit due to the conversion mechanism. The upside for DEC is now transferred to SPS. \nAt the begging of 2024 DEC was at the peg and again now during the presale in May 2025. In the last weeks DEC is just slightly bellow the peg but very close to it, in the range of 0.0009 to 0.0010\n\nIn the last period DEC has been trading around the 0.0007 to 0.0008 mark with some ups and downs in between. The DAO is now in charge and a lot of things around DEC depends on it and the community decisions.\n\nIn terms of market cap, if we exclude the peaks back in 2021, the DEC market cap has been constantly been in the range of 4M to 6M USD. \n\nAll the best\n@dalz",

        "body": "\nHive offers multiple frontends for its social apps and users to interact with. This gives the users the freedom to choose their favorite one. Some of them filter out the content and focus just on specific content. \nHive is showing how constrained we are on traditional web2 apps like X/Twitter. I use multiple frontends on Hive for different purposes and really like the freedom to shift between them and select what I want. \n\nLet’s take a look at the posting on the top hive frontends and their individual share. \n\n\n \n\n\n![01.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23u5vxde7yc8ZdCBsnwDcKoWA56834ixTW1iG59fd68bLTQWEuyMFLZYYchUXkkEyF5fg.png)\n\n\n\nWe all know blogging dApps are not the only ones built on Hive. Games are taking advantage of the Hive blockchain and we are already seeing more of them built each day. Splinterlands opened the gate for games on Hive, and now we have many more.\n\nHere we will only be looking only into the blogging apps:\n-\tPeakd\n-\tEcency\n-\tHive.Blog\n-\tInleo\n-\tLiketu\n-\tActifit\n-\tdBuzz\n-\t3Speak\n-\tOthers\n**The period that will be analyzed is from April 2020 till now**.\nWe will be looking at both,  **posts and comments** activities. \n\nWe will also rank the top frontends by number of in the last 30 days.\n\n## Peakd\nAccording to the data the most used Hive frontend. \nHere is the chart. \n\n \n\n\n![image001.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23uFGsSD6SuUXKUjT8mQNzBLDtt1VXQFnzoD4RPgLk3ah5Shva2SP8M1UdWGpxSjhH644.png)\n\n\n\n\n*Note that the chart includes both posts and comments per day.*\n\nAn uptrend for Peakd up until May 2022 when there was 10k posts and comments per day, then a slow decline up until September 2025 to around 4k posts and comments, and a sharp increase afterwards, at the end of 2025 to 7k, and a drop again in 2024 to around **5k** posts and comments in the last period.\n\n## Ecency\nEcency has been around for a long time as well. They have a very good frontend as well. Some say it is the fastest ones. One of the best mobile apps included. \n\n\n\n\n![image005.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tkpRx7SayVPf1UsKGQSphgnPyvG3f8WAzuBf7u9E9Rx3wrdBZxjHrXTAhASMhtNDt5L.png)\n\n\nA strong growth after the initial transition to Hive back in the summer of 2020. A peak at the end of 2022, and a sideways action afterwards in 2023, followed by a sharp drop in the first half of 2024. At the end of 2024 there is a growth again with a peak around 6k posts and comments, a pull back in 2025, and interesting another growth in the last month, back to **6k**.\n\nEcency is showing more resilience towards a declining in the activity. \nSimilar as for Peakd a growth in the last months up to 6k posts and comments daily. \n\n# Hive.Blog\nThe generic Hive frontend. It’s open source as well. Here is the chart.\n\n \n\n\n![image003.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/EoEjAT3Hexyr1TZ94LshLMGLFZ9tQ96cb6C9MJBycXdywQcn2qQ7pJkaQ63Qbdu6Goe.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nWhile Peakd and Ecency have seen growth up until 2022, and again at the end of 2024, the Hive.Blog frontend has been in a downtrend overall with some stabilization in the last period. Obviously users are transitioning to the other frontends and are not using hive.blog as much. It still has a decent number for posts and comments with around **1.2k** per day holding steady. \n\n\n\n## InLeo/LeoFinance\nLeoFinance has been experimenting with new things like the short form threads. Here is the chart for the posts and comments. \n\n\n\n\n![image007.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23u5tRe8vpNDyARGryHMnhbdQtt1XvW8z8rjvaJvvmZYajs21WEYtvGbTQkaMFtT3DjZB.png)\n \n\n\n\nSome big spikes here from time to time.\nIn the past the activity on the Leo frontend has reached a high of 10k per month, but just for a short period of time. More often it is in the range of **5k to 6k** post and comments per day. Usually more of the activity is short form comments as it has transitioned more towards short form content. \n\n\n## Actifit\nActifit is one of the first Hive apps. It is a fitness app where users share their step counts per day. A move2earn. \nHere is the chart.\n\n\n\n\n![image011.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23w2cbpUMkLAeEFY41GAVnCgnsVektCQL1gGJbNFGgYfYGAoc16b76e7SKzE5zsb8XWHc.png)\n\n\n\n\nQuite a steady number of posts and comments from Actifit with numbers in the range of **400 to 500** per day. \n\n## 3Speak\nThe number of posts/videos from the Hive video platform. \n\n \n \n\n![image009.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23xVCV7JdQvHfbn2NFEDrf7CdX5xJgQvGcUxajbdKG1G1eUGCud6H94VkPpDHkCE2BqWK.png)\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSome ups and downs for 3Speak as well. The ATH was reached back in January 2022, when there were around 300 videos uploaded daily. \nThere has been a downtime at the end of 2024 of more than a week.  In 2025 overall the activity seems to be down, just bellow 100 per day. \n\n## Number of Posts and Comments from the Top Hive Frontends\n\nHere is the chart for all the Hive frontends posts per day combined. \n\n \n\n\n![image015.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/Eo8M1gJjBTDXQSsEcnyhUbxxE5aRz8S8t5oR7nRpvV2PhgsK9xaeDucBsQVYeyf57fp.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nPeakd, Ecency and InLeo are now on the top when it comes to posting and commenting with very similar number of posts and comments.\n \nAt first Hive.Blog was on the top but, now it has fallen behind these two, by a significant margin. InLeo/Leofinance with its threads app has made some waves and spiked on few days surpassing all the apps. It is still volatile a lot. HiveBlog is now behind the InLeo app and comes as fourth. \nAfter these four apps, the others are quite down with a few hundred comments and posts daily. \n\n\n##Peakd VS Ecency\n\nThe chart for the top two frontends looks like this:\n\n\n\n\n![image017.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tbLxZLoKr5PC6mibG8iLEcrfuWDy9v9R7kuakZeJziMwNyCzyL4h2vb5j8wgZDgxWYF.png)\n\n\n\n\nA very close number between these two. At first PeakD was in the lead, but Ecency caught up back in 2023 and since then these two are very close. In the very last month, the numbers from Ecency even surpassed Peakd for a short period of time. \n\n## Top Hive Frontends in the Last 30 Days\n\nHere is the chart for the overall number of posts from the top Hive frontends in the last 30 days.\n\n\n\n![image019.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tbK6zPUUdJVty7WwGASEkuFZ36PUK44m7khoKK5dKDBhNpwTT7Kgu5UTgZBx9EYzFD9.png)\n\n\n\n\nThe number of posts is market with white, while comments are with semitransparent color. When combined with comments Leothreads is on the top, followed by Ecency and Peakd. In terms of posts Peakd is on the top with a very slight margin before Ecency, but Ecency has more comments, and combined Ecency is in a small lead in front of Peakd. \nHiveBlog on the fourth position and then comes the rest of the apps. \n\n## Top Hive Frontends by Monthly Users\n\nThe above was in terms of activity. What about the number of users, or **MAUs**. Here is the chart. \n\n \n\n\n![image021.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tvAaEdSKaAaUDqgEfESp8M41giUVasLDB5E8ExoT4GzvzUFyNoEHdjwtDkEsBKJtBY4.png)\n\n\n\n\nPeakd is leading when it comes to number of users. There is 3.9k MAUs for Peakd in July 2025. Ecency is in the second spot with 3.2k, followed by HiveBlog with 1.4k and then Leothreads with 1.3k. Interesting even though Leothreads is on top in terms of activity it is on the fourth spot even behind HiveBlog when it comes to users. \nCumulative from all the frontends there is around **13k** MAUs that have made a post or comment for the last 30 days.\n\n\nAll the best \n@dalz",

        "body": "\nLet’s take a look at PeakD! The project is around for a long time now and has been developing a lot of things on Hive. Some of them DHF funded. [PEAKD](https://peakd.com/@peakd/posts) has established itself as the most used frontend on the Hive blockchain. The team around it has been involved in the ecosystem for a long time and they have continuously built and updating it. \nThe team is also working on a Peak Open project that is funded from the DHF and have more tools for the ecosystem. There is now also a short form app Snaps. \n\nLet’s take a look at some of the data.\n\n\n\n\n![01.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tbPKvT9QKeJzwR2vxiy43qTm4zcBwEsLq15YG6qMieQTtS9pcivzEpoJ6Bv5d95eHco.png)\n\n \n\n\nhttps://peakd.com\n\n\n\n\nHere we will take a look at the activity on the platform, the overall number of posts and comments, and the number of users. The top content creators for the last 30 days will be presented as well.\n\n\n**The period that we will be looking at is from April 2020 till now.**\n\n\n\n\n## Posts\n\nFirst let us see the number of posts coming from the PeakD.\n\nHere is the chart.\n\n\n \n\n\n\n![image001.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/Eo6DhDGW6WETvUXkSH9kRZomogsGa4rySwdSrb489eMUxYy5VgdhDcvJYgy8vsCaKyb.png)\n\n\n\nSome ups and downs here. At the beginning in 2020 there was around 1200 post per day, then this number increase to around 1600 in the bull market in 2021-2022, and a slow drop afterwards to a lows of 600 posts in 2024. \n\nThe lows were reached recently in 2024 when there was around 600 daily posts. At the end of 2024 there was an increase in the number of posts up to 800, and since then the data has been in the range of 600 to 800 posts per day in 2025. \n\n\n\nThis chart follows the price a lot, just with a smaller volatility. \n\n\n## Comments\n\n\nThe chart above was only about posts.\nWhat about comments? PeakD recently introduced Snaps, a short form so the activity here should be going up.\n\nHere is the number of comments made per day from PeakD.\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n\n![image003.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/EoCbmE2h5Go753N7hVbHQG7sSZuSycHCB234aaokhHxnbc9nMMQfR9sghVEWfYcXXXZ.png)\n\n\n\nWe can clearly see the pump at the end of 2024, from around 4k up to 6k comments daily. \nPreviously in the bull market of 2021 the ATH for comments was around 8k. Not that far away. In te last period this number is around 5k per day. \n\n\n\n\n## Posts and Comments\n\nWhen we combine the posts and comments on one chart we get this.\n\n\n\n\n \n\n\n![image005.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tbiXRnEzXYKaYLkqdZDLk8xfFdpLfM8a49aDVXYMvk7sJ9tiB6ShCPcSif7n9ujHXNQ.png)\n\n\n\n\nThe comments are dominatign the chart as there are more comments than posts. Post and comments has been in the range of 6k to 8k up to April 2024, but then they dropped and increased ahain in the last months to around 6k. In 2025 this number is around **5k** posts and comments daily.\n\n\n\n\nWhen we polot the numbers on a **monthly** timeframe we get this.\n\n\n\n \n![image007.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tkmusgFCN7doR7YNaaKdjr9Ltd7U7tVqGs7Vfo3EiETGzVKbYPxmmJYXM3HcdiQWf8t.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nWe can see the increase at the end of 2025 here as well. Especially for the comments. Cumulative close to 200k monthly posts and comments in January 2025. In the last months this number is around 150k. \n\n\n\n\n\n## Active Authors\n\nHow about the numbers of the authors on the PeakD. How many accounts are posting?\n\nHere is a chart for the **monthly** numbers of accounts posting. \n\n\n\n \n\n\n![image011.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23vsDrhZYXGibV7jRaQ8KQroKTWMYYQABsgsv5gPRkUULAqtuhomryedfzzs5JJfiMp3d.png)\n\n\n\nThe all-time high for MAUs on PeakD was back in April 2022, with 7.5k monthly active users that were making posts and comments. A drop since then to 4k in 2024 and a spike in January 2925 to 5k users. In the last months this number is around **4.2k** per month. This chat is less volatile than the others. \n\n\n\n\n\nNext the number of unique authors that posted from PeakD. These are authors that posted directly through the frontend. \n\n\n\n\n \n\n![image009.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23t797uH8Wm9uwv7jF37G5tXCF5nu6EEuXx1Wx2WdTohoYh6k1Aon8VLjb4U6uoLf5y64.png)\n\n\n\nThe number of unique PeakD authors is showing continuous steady growth.\n\nThere is now around **43k** unique authors that have used PeakD to post. In 2024 a total of 6k new accounts have tired PeakD for the first time. In 2023 a total of 7k new accounts used PeakD for the first time. \n\n\n\n## Authors that Posted the Most\n\nHere is the rank of the authors that posted the most in the last 30 days on PeakD.\n\n\n\n\n \n\n![image013.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23vsDe3sX9VmC2Zh8qcSdKhcxSofRRpvGgiZ11CDcy7H5c4DXBYC3YsiG9ijMG5oYY1rG.png)\n\n\n\nThere seems to be some spam accounts at the very top. \nThere is some community run projects that report daily and some genuine account in the second half of the ranks.  \n\n\n## Authors that Commented the Most\n\nHere is the rank of the authors that commented the most in the last 30 days on PeakD.\n\n\n \n\n\n\n![image015.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/EoJz5NSsRPJaZmDxGXMkDq41Zen37zTrNqcGvSV1jgoEe3MLvNB3sxp6Rz4a1xwk7aQ.png)\n\n\nMore genuine accounts when it comes to commenting when compared to posting, although some spam as well. Great job with the engagement for the top accounts here. \n\n\n\n-----\n\n\n\nOverall, we can see that there is an increase in the activity on PeakD at the end of 2024, mostly due to the HIVE price action. In the previous years there has been a drop from the previous ATH in the first half of 2022. Comments have proven to be more resilient and the drop in the numbers of comments is smaller than the number of posts. The number of authors is also more constant. \n\n\n\n\nAll the best\n@dalz\n",

        "body": "[Ecency](https://ecency.com/ \"https://ecency.com/\") is probably the most comprehensive Hive dApp with a web site, desktop application, a phone app and app for short form posting called waves. Its phone app is the most used mobile app for a general Hive experience with notification system and all. They have a relatively easy sign-up process and creating Hive accounts with just a mail verification.\n\nEcency has been around for a long time, and it has went trough a process of rebranding when the Hive fork happened from its previous version eSteem. Ecency has been building for years with no hype around the app, but just providing a nice experience, especially on the mobile side. It had new updates on the UI in the last period as well.\n\nLet’s take a look at some of the data.\n\n![](https://images.ecency.com/DQmVBsFvLbGyhZnr3X2oT1ptSa3C3W1s2HM8kJxdYW3JsGc/01.png)\n\n[https://ecency.com/](https://ecency.com/ \"https://ecency.com/\")\n\nHere we will take a look at the activity on the platform, the overall number of posts, comments, and the number of users. The top content creators for the last month will be presented as well.\n\nThe period that we will be looking at is from the creation of the app on Hive, August 2020 till now.\n\nPosts\n-----\n\nFirst let us see the number of posts coming from the Ecency.\n\nHere is the chart.\n\n![](https://images.ecency.com/DQmWUpZPFZuuYaz3uYzRPSuSeDojRcoYMiYd3VfBBWGx7Hd/image001.png)\n\nWe can see that at the start the app was not heavily used but then it grew by a lot, especially in 2021. The all time high for daily posts has been at the beginning of 2022, where there was 1k post per day. Since then, the activity dropped but not as much.\n\nAfter 2021 the number of posts was in a decline going from 800 to 500 posts per day. Then at the end of 2024 in increased again and continued to grow in 2025 up to 800 posts per day again. In the last period the number of posts is around 600 per day.\n\nComments\n--------\n\nThe chart above was only about posts. What about comments?\n\nHere is the number of comments made per day from Ecency.\n\n![](https://images.ecency.com/DQmZ2Vw9HWYrZvRcRqydkToGeDeg17iEGxk3eszA5KZro5D/image003.png)\n\nWe can see the intiial growth here in 2021 and 2022 up to 8k comments per day. Then a period of sideways action in 2023 and a drop in the first half of 2024. At the end of 2024 a growth again, similar as for the posts, that continued in 2025 and we are now in the range of **4k to 5k** comments per day.\n\nPosts and Comments\n------------------\n\nWhen we combine the posts and comments on one chart we get this.\n\n![](https://images.ecency.com/DQmWPYNBirFjLuKDqAbiA8hRopxmLGNVtHKnGwBuHrdU1ef/image005.png)\n\nThis chart is mainly driven by the comments, since their number is higher. We can see the top for the numbers of posts and comments are not aligned. The ATH for posts was at the being of 2022, while the ATH for comments was at the end of 2022. This is where the overall activity was highest with 8.5k posts and comment made per day back in November 2022.\n\nWe can notice the recent spike at the end of 2024 and the beginign of 2025 again.\n\nWhen we polot the numbers on a **monthly** timeframe we get this.\n\n![](https://images.ecency.com/DQmdcqLVvE9VcsJGCmj44Y7nmyYqnhSRkTLfgmtu4PhZTAn/image007.png)\n\nA growth up until August 2022, and almost constant numbers since then up to 2024. A drop in the first half of 2024 and growth again towards the end of the year.\n\nIn the last months the numbers are around 150k monthly posts and comments.\n\nAuthors\n-------\n\nHow about the numbers of the authors on the Ecency. How many accounts are posting?\n\nHere is a chart for the **monthly** numbers of accounts posting.\n\n![](https://images.ecency.com/DQmX8fB9aNr9VuHd7ygHyFRMm9thcxhHyL7pTB7TSAFfEXV/image011.png)\n\nAfter the initial growth back in 2020 and 2021, in the period after that we have almost constant numbers of MAUs on Ecency. There has been around 4k MAUs for a long time, then a drop in July 2023 to 3.5k. Since then, the numbers have been sideways around the **3.5k** MAUs.\n\nNext the number of unique authors that posted from Ecency. These are authors that posted directly through the frontend.\n\n![](https://images.ecency.com/DQmNXCthwwCFHeC6g6WZqqNk9u88PDv9pRsVuVCa1gkNTY7/image009.png)\n\nThe number of unique Ecency authors is showing continuous growth.\n\nThere is **38k** unique authors that have used Ecency to post. In the first half of 2025 there was around 3k new users, in 2024 there has been 7.5k new unique authors trying the frontend for the first time. Back in 2023 there was 4.5k new accounts.\n\nAuthors that Posted the Most\n----------------------------\n\nHere is the rank of the authors that posted the most in the last 30 days.\n\n![](https://images.ecency.com/DQmQ2mC7qaB3DGJFBYcfX5q2BmNnGyEvkdSyEcUcxtfHXXF/image013.png)\n\nThe top accounts have posted close to 100 posts in a month from Ecency, while the once on the bottom of the chart are with around 60 posts. Some spam accounts here with the more know community member on the bottom.\n\nWhat about **comments**? Here is the chart.\n\n![](https://images.ecency.com/DQmV3Tkhu7tQ5Lq38ecGcsxQbSvakLeu3NYVb8vDWjiSngs/image015.png)\n\nClose to 3k comments per months from the top commenters.\n\n* * *\n\nOverall, we can see that after a period of decline there has been an increase in the activity coming from Ecency at the end of 2024. This is corelated to the price action of HIVE as usual. It’s interesting to note that while the activity has been up and down, the number of monthly active authors has been very steady in the last years even during the bear market.\n\nAll the best @dalz",

        "body": "As is already well known, the Bitcoin protocol is suited for one simple thing, that are transactions and moving coins around. It has a maximum cap of 21M coins, and a system that involves miners writing transactions, nodes reading data, developers and users submitting transaction requests to miners. The system design has successfully endured the test of time and has been very successful till now.\n\nWhat Bitcoin doesn’t have, and that is by design, are smart contracts and all the other things coming with it, enabling DeFi, tokens, NFTs, etc. \n\nWith the rise of the smart contract chains like Ethereum, Solana etc. and the introduction of DeFi a demand for a Bitcoin token representation on these chains has emerged. This demand comes from the need of simple trading Bitcoin on chain, to the more complicated stuff like lending using BTC as collateral and more.\nIn the last period we are seeing a new trend introducing Bitcoin yielding tokens, where the wrapped version of Bitcoin is a yield bearing token similar like the staked ETH tokens, stETH or Solana JitoSOL. \n\n\n \n\n\n![01.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23u5bY7BvJgsLKLP18RF55QkyWW2ro34KnvEY5fuvYLbb5i47oCTRHVPDJZrNhGRUbY6c.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nThe most important thing to have in mind about these Bitcoin derivatives is that they are not actual Bitcoin. A token on the Ethereum network or any other network is not Bitcoin. It is a representation of Bitcoin with a promise to keep a 1:1 value. Usually, the way this works is some entity is establishing a vault on the Bitcoin chain where they keep the native Bitcoin and for every Bitcoin put in that vault/s they mint the wrapper on the other chain. It’s basically a service provided by a third party and it has an inherent additional risk from the third party. \n\n----\nWith this said lets take a look at the tokens list. Here it is:\n\n-\tWBTC\n-\tBTCB\n-\tcbBTC\n-\tLBTC\n-\tSolvBTC\n-\teBTC\n-\ttBTC\n\nThere are more but these are the biggest one and represent most of the industry. \n\n## WBTC\nWBTC is a wrapped Bitcoin on the Ethereum network. How does this work? Well, there is a **centralized** entity, a company that users send Bitcoin to, they locked into a wallet and mint WBTC on the Ethereum network. Because crypto is transparent, users can see both of the wallets for the native BTC on the Bitcoin network and WBTC on the Ethereum network at any time and make sure the balances matches. \n\nWBTC allows users to use Bitcoin in defi protocols like AAVE and MakerDAO. In most cases WBTC is provided as collateral and then users borrow against it. It’s a beautiful thing as long as you manage your position and don’t overleverage and get liquidated. The company that was managing WBTC up until last year was BitGo situated in the US. Since last year they have partnered with BitGlobal, a Honkong/Singapure company under the umbrella of Justin Sun. This has caused controversy and soon after Coinbase launched their Bitcoin wrapper cbBTC.\n\nHere is the chart.\n\n \n\n\n\n![image001.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23t77B8AW1vfSLxv67EpCrpCFBaF6p4JAhY4ZjyG51RyT6TMmQTEa6vgi7etHWuXmyuAY.png)\n\n\n\n\n*Note that the chart above is in Bitcoin dominated units, not USD. It represents how much Bitcoins are being wrapped on Ethereum.*\n\nAs we can see there has been a high growth in the amount of WBTC in the previous bull run. Starting from 2020, till 2022, the amount of BTC, wrapped on ETH has kept growing and reached ATH of **285k** in May 2022. At the time at those prices the market cap was around 10B.  Towards the end of 2022 the amount of WBTC dropped to around 150k and has stayed around those levels up last year. Then in 2024 there was a further drop in the amount of BTC under WBTC and the numbers are now at 128k. This might be related to the rebranding and the new emerging competition for wrapped Bitcoin. \n\n\n## Binance BTCB\nBinance has launched their version of the wrapped Bitcoin on the BSC network to be used in apps like Pancake and other DeFi applications. \n\nThe chart looks like this: \n\n \n\n\n\n![image007.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23t7B7YS6XvruxSJ3rxUmFrwAC8rFNYWLwJRHakRZbkeNLTbBL9Niupo3FzhRVTgFgA2F.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nThis one is a bit odd since there is no clear historical data on the BTCB, or the market cap. Plus it seems that the BTCB is pre-issued by Binance, and it represents sort of max amount of tokens, not the real in use Bitcoin on BSC. CMC shows data up until June 2024, and there is probably data prior to this date, but could found any reliable sources. \n\nIt has been around the **65k** BTC mark for a year now. \n\n\n## Coinbase cbBTC\n\nFollowing the offshore move from BitGo and the partnership with BitGlobal, Coinbase took a step forward and announced their version of wrapped Bitcoin, cbBTC, starting from September 2024. In this case the custodian for the Bitcoins is Coinbase. They are acting as a bridge between Bitcoin and the other smart contracts chains. A totally centralized solution. \nHere is the chart for cbBTC:\n\n \n\n\n![image005.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/EnyoXoZxhKarE4qKKLY7tVE2aF877Qu1kkmyjoQxa6zVJbkmVrK8TmN9H65oCAPCUEk.png)\n\n\n\n\n\n\nWe can see that starting from September 2024 the amount of cbBTC started growing and is constantly in an uptrend. At the moment Coinbase is custodian of **51k** wrapped Bitcoin in the form of cbBTC, or around 6 billion USD. It has the heights grow rate from the top three wrapped versions of BTC. \n\n\n\n## Lombard Staked LBTC\n\nAnother version of the Bitcoin wrappers, but this time with a twist. It provides yield. \n\n>\tLombard Staked BTC (LBTC) is a liquid staking token developed by Lombard, enabling Bitcoin holders to stake their BTC through the Babylon protocol while retaining liquidity for participation in decentralized finance (DeFi) applications. Each LBTC token is backed 1:1 by Bitcoin, allowing users to earn staking yields without compromising their BTC's security or value. This integration transforms Bitcoin from a static store of value into a productive asset within the DeFi ecosystem\n\nThe Babylon protocol is an L2 chain for Bitcoin that tries to bridge Bitcoin to EVM chains and DeFi.\n\nHere is the chart for LBTC.\n\n\n \n\n\n\n![image009.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/Eo1vTqFRqCFVcQB1kLKkCqmi5Co9AxWnP3NtVAXxSs7tkxEekwcMLeRLmfbv8Bnf8EB.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nAs we can see this chart had an uptrend up until recently reaching 20k BTC in April 2025.A drop since then and it is now at around 14k BTC. Still quite high number with a value in USD bigger than one billion having in mind the current BTC prices. \n\n\n## Cumulative Chart for the Top Bitcoin Wrappers\n\nWhen we add all the above together, plus some smaller ones like eBTC, tBTC we get this chart. \n\n \n\n\n\n\n\n\n![image015.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23uQNvHKxBcR4xMUZKFyjBtaWLXN5KxjrarPmuXjY3sb7wJ2dAyFVUMgSYCtLCKUbXZ1A.png)\n\n\n\n\n\n\nThis is a long term chart, starting from 2020, when the only dominant player was WBTC. But we can see since last year, 2024 the competition has heated up significantly and more options for Bitcoin wrappers have emerged. But even with all the new options the previous ATH for Bitcoin wrappers has just now been reached. We are now at **282k** BTC in these instruments, around the same spot from the previous ATH.\n\nCoinbase cbBTC has been the main driver for the growth in the last period, the others have been somewhat stagnant. \n\n\n\nWhen we zoom in, we get this:\n\n\n\n \n\n\n![image017.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23wMPd8mVBGXg5eGQ4J5Cyr4QyihtT27HVTZLyUBPshqxZuDXiNb9XhVjgaJTR9qf8Gxm.png)\n\n\n\n\n\n\nHere we can see more clearly how the WBTC dominance is going down and more other options have emerged. cbBTC is the leader of those, but LBTC some others are also significant players. \n\n## Top Bitcoin Wrappers Share\n\nThe current share of the Bitcoin wrappers looks like this.\n \n\n\n\n\n![image003.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tbPQgijNMcNPnzpqNzSc4GA7brrqJayEFUytVyviberWNASD9jFREY99X3mNWKgsxrU.png)\n\n\n\n\n\n\nWBTC is still dominant with 47%, but far from the only dominant player where it was just a year ago. Binance BTCB is at 24%, while Coinbase cbBTC has 19% share, followed by LBTC etc. \n\n**At the end the market cap for the bitcoin wrappers in USD:**\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n![image013.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tRvjTTUViNj57iGtiELrQns8upTWHwDjLfk3M6APAnWY6qm1WEEobv7L26JgyskmDdD.png)\n\n\n\n\n\n\nWhen we look in USD dollars we have now an ATH in market cap for the bitcoin wrappers with close to **30B** market cap combined. The previous ATH in dollar units was around 15B. In terms of BTC we are around the same spot as in the previous market cap, but obviouslyt the price is now much higher and so does the USD market cap. \n\n\n----\n\nOverall, we can see that there is now more options for the Bitcoin wrappers, but in terms of Bitcoin the allocation remains somewhat stagnant with the exception of Coinbase cbBTC. The other wrappers don’t have a growth in terms of BTC. Where the growth is evident is in the USD value, where due to the increase in the price of Bitcoin, the wrappers now have 30B in market cap, double then the previous all time high. \nThe need for Bitcoin DeFi is obvious and users are searching for yield. This of course comes at additional risk, and everyone should be very cautious when using these products. For sure do not put all your BTC in any of them. My guess is that as time goes on, we will see more and more BTC derivatives that will try to add more functionality and financial instruments to Bitcoin. \n\n\n\nAll the best\n@dalz",

        "body": "Maker and DAI have been one of the crypto OGs. The idea behind the decentralized DAI stablecoin and its implementation have been extremely useful for some users. A very complicated and innovative mechanics were put in places to achieve the DAI stablecoin. The protocol use to be on the top list for the TVL and the value it had accumulated. \n\nHowever, since last year the protocol rebranded to SKY and USDS, with more ways for minting USDS, including so called RWAs (Real World Assets), such as treasury bills. This enables the protocol to basically drive demand for US debt, in the same way Tether and USDC are doing. \nThere is the new governance token on top of it SKY, that serve in governance, voting for new collateral and \nThe old version of DAI and MAKER are still around and they work but they are slowly being decommissioned and converted to the new version via an upgrade function. Its voluntary upgrade.\n\n\n \n\n\n![01.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23u5XZJ14broKg7Zf1UyAd2xLfQPLUDT9X1RrY73Ao9NH1HComLFPNTDrGZfGTLTSuea6.png)\n\n\n\n\nMore to read on MakerDAO in there whitepaper on the [link]( https://makerdao.com/en/whitepaper/).\n\nHere we will be looking at:\n-\tTotal value locked TVL (collateral)\n-\tDAI supply\n-\tLoan to value ratio LTV\n-\tTop tokens used as collateral\n-\tDefi protocols rank by TVL\n-\tNumber of users DAUs \n-\tPrice\n\n**The period that we will be looking at is 2020 - 2025.**\nThe data here is compiled from different sources like DefiLama and Dune Analytics.\n\n## Total Value Locked | Collateral\nIn the case of MakerDAO the TVL is the collateral deposited to mint DAI. Here is the chart. \n\n\n \n\n\n\n![image001.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tGZeC8FJcMisY33wUaLLABkqVhg3c1guT993mme4rXiuK2MmXZRxppe5P28dkTfKrKE.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nThe TVL for MakerDAO was quite small back in 2020. It was under 100M. Then it started growing and in 2021 it has grown exponentially. The ATH for the collateral value in the MakerDAO protocol was reached at the end of 2021 with almost 20B in value. \n\nThe 20B was the ATH for Maker, as it never recovered back to those highs and with the latest happenings and transition to SKY/USDS it will never be at that point again. At the moment the TVL is at **6B**.\n\n\n## DAI and USDS Supply\n\nHere is the chart for DAI and USDS minted per month.\n\n\n![image009.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23t793Yo8nDyB1YancqCvjqDuUy2pJEYgbGEBMcPmk8waM5e5UrPV5YSHJK7d7m4Eb39R.png)\n\n \n\n\n\n*White bars for DAI, blue for USDS*.\n\n\nHere we can see the constant positive months back in 2021 with around 700M DAI minted on a monthly basis, and a record of 1.6B in October 2021. \nIn May 2022 there was a negative 2.2B DAI burnt. \nIn 2023 we can notice the big spike in November, when 1.5B new DAI was minted. The other months are with a lot less volatility. \nWe can notice the sharp drop in October when more than 2B DAI was burned, and I’m guessing a lot of it was converted to the new version USDS, since it has a big positive candle in the same month. \n\n\n**The cumulative DAI and USDS in circulation chart looks like this:**\n\n\n\n\n![image003.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/Eo1vt54ecfBfFAA9bV5AsQyfNSAZALur2rJTWa5DrwHWzAqZz1Y4E7n3GpL3D8F5HPM.png)\n\n\n \n\n\nI have added the USDS supply to this chart for context. As we can see, in October last year there was a drop in the DAI supply, while USDS started at 5B. It has grown fast since then and it is now at **7.3B**, while DAI is at 3.6B.\n\n\n\nThe DAI supply has grown massively in 2021 and the first half of 2022, reaching an ATH of 10B. Then UST happened, the stablecoin marketcap dropped a lot in May 2022, and has continued to go down ever since. A short spike in March 2023, due to the USDC situation. Another spike in November 2023 and almost constant with even a slow decrease in the last months with around **4B** DAI in circulation. \n\nIt’s interesting to see that with the increase of the crypto prices the amount of DAI in circulation has stayed relatively same. DAI has shown that it is resilient and survived bear market, but its grow has been somewhat stale. \n\n\n\n## Loan to Value Ratio LTV\n\nThe LTV value is often used for MakerDAO and DAI, to access the overall health of the ecosystem and the collateral position. It is a ratio between the value of the collateral deposited and the DAI minted. For example, for a 10B in collateral and 5B DAI minted the LTV ratio is 10/5 = 2, or 200% percent. Here is the historical chart.\n\n\n \n\n![image005.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tGZrjFapVEPG8ud6y7YAdnTohEm8Ldurmv5AWP8HFG19G8H5YLTjPxvntCYBgs1eA6A.png)\n\n\n\nFrom the chart above we can notice that the LTV value has dropped over time. At the beginning of 2020 this ratio was at 500%, while in the last year it is around 150% or less. \nWhile this ratio might seem low and might show that there are a lot of vaults close to liquidation, we should bear in mind the type of collateral that is being used over time. At first ETH was the number one collateral and was dominant. But as time progressed USDC became a large share of the collateral to mint DAI. Since USDC is pegged to the dollar there is no need for overcollateralization like in the case of ETH and users are minting DAI for 1 to 1 ratio. This lowers the overall LTV ratio.\n\nIn the last period the collateral structure for minting DAI has changed and migrated back from USDC to mostly Ethereum. Because of this we can see a recent spike in the LTV ratio. \n\n## Top Tokens in the TVL\n\nWhich tokens are mostly deposited in the protocol? Here is the chart.\n\n\n\n \n\n![image011.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tvD1ceEGMe8dHsqVWCtYCWMhe3ZmzYwFC7fkqr8eumQNExZ71Hvr8oWYnQgyfCSxSLD.png)\n\n\nAs we can see USDC an ETH are dominat tokens in the collateral now as TVL. For Ethereum if we summarize ETH and stETH it will be the dominant token. A small share of BTC is also used on the protocol. \n\n\n\n\n## Top Defi Protocols Ranked by TVL \n\nHow is the MakerDAO/SKY protocol doing when compared to the other ones? The total value locked is usually one of the metrics these protocols use. \nHere is the chart.\n\n \n\n\n\n![image013.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tvCoSx2TjZSwMDvgZcwAWuV4ny32pCTdiujyGXkUCHotMMYbcwXxHzHRk3EUbvCm272.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nMakerDAO/SKY is now in the middle of the chart. Back in the days it was number one for a long time. It has dropped down in the last period and lost its high spot. The centralized version of the stablecoins have basically overtaken it. \n\n\n## Price\nWhen it comes to prices, we will be looking at the chart for the governance token MAKER and the stabelcoin DAI.\n\nHere is the chart for the MAKER token. \n\n \n\n\n![image015.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tGaDybdQuwKthtEfNgDFvJ7N6bWCi4d5Th5SP38VK5qkMkmSGyqo6an5R56khCvuyxC.png)\n\n\nQuite a wild ride for MAKER, going from 400 to more than 5k in 2021, and down to 600 in 2022.\nThere was sharp growth again in the first half of 2024 and a drop afterwards, especially during the transition period in October 2024. \nIn 2025 the token price has increased again and It is now trading around 2k that is somewhat a middle ground, still far from its previous highs, but also not at the lows. \n\n\n\nAll the best\n@dalz\n",

        "body": "After a tough period for the BNB token during the bear market, issues with its founder CZ, the BNB has  recover in 2024 and has been one of the few altcoins to reach another ATH. \nJust a reminder that there was a lot of FUD about BNB during the bear market, stories continue to show up and there seems to be no end to it. Court cases were also involved against the CEO CZ that ended with his resignation, huge fine paid in the billions and prison time. But things seem to have been resolved for Binance now with a clear path forward. \nIn the last period there is some data pointing out that the chain is reaching new ATH on multiple fronts. \nLet’s take a look! \n\n \n\n![01.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tvCemicdSf26iFXT593w3ENSuh9ykvSbVfkfHB91E3cAfVLVT7xyxec4nirUrGo7m1N.png)\n\n\nWe will be looking at:\n-\tNumber of Addresses\n-\tActive Addresses\n-\tDaily Transactions\n-\tFees\n-\tContracts\n-\tTVL\n-\tMarket Cap\n\n\nMost of the data is collected from https://bscscan.com/.\n\n## Number of Addresses\nOne of the key metrics for crypto projects is the number of wallets. \nFirst the overall number of wallets.\n\n \n\n\n\n![image001.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23t7BUmkcUKu2dFaaaE4xSP5SHuMibHX8UtTfqBjNqjKRiCyJapkAijSJvAVv1rncgS1v.png)\n\n\n\n\nThe number of wallets on BSC just keeps going up, no matter what.\nThe chain started growing back in February 2021, and since then it kept adding new wallets. What’s interesting is that there is a bump in new wallets created in May 2023 during the bear market. Since then, the numbers have steadily increased. \n\nThe BSC chain now has close to **600M** wallets making it the number one chain in the world by the number wallets. For comparison Ethereum is now around 300M wallets. \n\nOn a daily basis the numbers of new wallets created looks like this:\n\n\n\n \n\n![image003.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23uQLzyFLEsTA8tBPcPMaFCAPBtV43kVapzHVxwWnVHeATuuRir76y2U3UgGLa3JGdqZr.png)\n\n\nThere has been a big spike at the beginning back in 2021, and a steady numbers of new wallets since then. It seems that the new daily wallets kept growing towards 2023 and then spiked in May 2023. Since then, there has been a small drop in the new daily wallets created and again an increase in 2025 going up to 1M on occasions. \n\n*Note that the creation of these wallets is free, so in some cases it can be seen as spam actions*.\n\n\n## Active Addresses\n\nWhat’s more interesting in times like this is how many wallets are transacting. How many of those addresses are actually active?\n\n \n\n![image005.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/Eoc53EjoR2VXSUwzJcsixSfo3qZo2EnvnK5nXBBXc1DH4SC51ddbgKMUTnEoSeYPMpk.png)\n\n\nWhen we look at the number of transactions we have a better understanding of the situation. There was a massive growth back in 2021, then a drop towards 2022, and a sideways action since then up to recently around the 1M daily active wallets. \nIn the last period the number of active accounts increased and reached more than 3M on occasions, reaching a new ATH in DAUs. \n\nCompared to Ethereum for example, this number is around 500k these days. \n\n\n\n## Daily Transactions\n\nThe activity on the networks is mostly represented by the number of daily transactions. Here is the chart. \n\n \n\n![image007.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23u5b6e7kYwVJfkp6BqME9nW1AKHvf4cKUvty8S671jiQ5hv21aVYFHreZpDRf1xReikF.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nWe can notice the spike in the number of transactions at the end of the chart. There seems to be an obvious growth after April 2025, with daily transactions reaching up **17M**. \nDuring the bear market of 2023 the number of transactions was in the range of 3M to 4M per day. In the last period these numbers are around 4M per day. \n\n\n## Fees\nFees are quite the unpopular topic and one of the main reasons for the new EVM chains, as users are trying to find a way to escape ETH high fees. \n\n\n \n\n![image009.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tSKZfYi4KDgjXd6rgFuAvne3masgezixBAGjpvbNVns8GGtNkmf3xeCZ8DCb8cdVL2B.png)\n\n\n\n\nThe fees are in dollar terms, average for the day. \n\nAfter the massive growth in 2021 the fees have dropped during the bear, from 0.6$ to 0.1$. There was a spike in March and April of 2024 up to 0.3 USD. \nIn the last period the fees dropped a lot, and are now just a few cents.  \n\n## Contracts\n\nBSC is a smart contract platform so here is the chart for verified contracts per day. \n\n\n \n\n![image011.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/EoCfj2xq5cvQExGfWRLJxJZiyhN8difqcAsp2q7y1a3wYAUd1Pz4igafHMPPPANjCCh.png)\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA massive growth in the first half of 2021, and downtrend in 2022. In 2023 we can see a spike back in May up to 1500 SC per day, but a drop since then to around 300 per day where it is now.\n\n## TVL\n\nThe total value locked is a metric that is often looked at these chains. It represents the capital that is put in the apps of the chain like DEXs, staking, lending etc. Here is the chart:\n\n\n \n\n\n![image013.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/Eo45oiiN5RffnXTs8FtaERQsT3kQpEp3gxGmCwazFkaDRiGE5Vffc2FcMauUYmF4MB8.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nA literal explosion back in 2021, from zero up to 20B, then a consolidation around the 12B, a further drop to lows of 3B. In 2024 the TVL has increased up to 6B in March 2024, dropped a bit during the summer and back again in the last months. \nIn the last period there has been a slow growth and we are now at **6B** in TVL.\nThe market prices push the TVL a lot since the metric is in US dollars. \n\n\n## BNB Price\n\nWhat about the market cap? \nThis is the ultimate metric for the chains. Here is the market cap for BNB.\n\n\n \n\n\n![image015.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tGe5ERNzc89y65kDbuizNgmEkZ17GscwDnr2Em9LuV9MAnof9cJZchgG8PgCjBf8PMA.png)\n\n\n\n\n\n\nThe BNB price had an amazing recovery and was one of the rare alts to reach the previous ATH in 2024. The price is now at **660** USD, back from the 700 USD where it was. \n\n\nAll the best\n@dalz",

        "beneficiaries": [],
        "body": "\nA look at the last four years for the inflation rate between these two.\n\n\n![image.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz.shorts/23t78uMX2oD7ygf3HQRZS5z89AV7uJukxx85fxPx1efpB3jR1fwGn8bH6eRUKzXfrccgg.png)\n\n\nETH has been trough a wild ride, going down from close to 5%, to a an oscilatory period (fee burns), then a drop after the PoS upgrade in 2022 and a drop in the base inflation to 0.43%. For a short period of time the inflation was negative, due to fee burns, and in the last period its up again close to 0.4%.\n\nBitcoin on the other hand is having its smooth predictable ride with 1.6% inflation rate up to the halving in April 2024 when it dropped to 0.8%. \n\nBoth of these are now very close to each other, with Bitcoin set to drop its inflation rate further in the next halving in 2028, while Ethereum is now with low inflation as well, but unpredictable. ",

        "body": "How are the two major chains doing in the last period? Is the Bitcoin dominance growing or Ethereum closing in? Let’s take a look.\n\n\n \n\n![01X.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23x15EDhwJYkakNvKHz2fCDPUHPfnG9tJd2s2jtay9XL1ifU9484en6Fh3tyMsmd6Vwe8.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nWe will be looking at data for:\n\n-\tInflation and supply\n-\tActive wallets\n-\tNumber of daily transactions \n-\tFees\n-\tMarket cap and BTC dominance\n\n\n**The data is extracted from https://www.blockchain.com/charts and https://ethscan.com/, for the period 2015 – 2025.**\n\nBitcoin has been around since 2009, but Ethereum started with operation in 2015 and from then forward we will be making comparisons. \n\n\n\n## Inflation and Supply\n\nThe limited supply of Bitcoin, the 21M cap, is one of its main features. The Bitcoin monetary policy is well known. Ethereum on the other hand has also taken steps in that direction and it has been even deflationary at one point.  Here is the chart for the supply of the two tokens.  \n\n\n\n\n![image001.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23t74ZhGL2sDSjsdwtbEqXx8QjPVapcG2wWhUDbwAK2F576UXXeExDgDuejo5mVE3Uwvg.png)\n\n\nBitcoin is now at **19.9M** supply with 95% of its supply now minted and only around 5% more to go. Ethereum is at **120M**, six times more tokens in circulation than Bitcoin and it has been around the 120M level since the merge of 2022. \n\n\n### Inflation\n\nWhen we extract the chart for the inflation of the two tokens, for easier comparison we have this:\n\n\n\n![image003.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23t77B7ovFL3DDa7RhfD4YQNCYVoL9kYdwiRchnHv7Yf17bUDdB4V4D2VyoaaBk64BZqy.png)\n \n\n\nWe can see that back in 2015, when Ethereum was launched, both of the tokens had inflation levels of 10% and 15%. Quite high for both. Then in 2016 the Bitcoin halving happened, and Bitcoin went down to less than 4%. Ethereum also had a drop in 2017 to around 7%. In the last years Bitcoin has followed is well known pattern and is now at 0.8% inflation after the April 2024 halving. Ethereum has also reduced its inflation a lot in the last period, especially after the Proof of stake move and now has a 0.43% bas inflation. When activities are high, a part of the inflation on ETH is burned so it goes lower and sometimes even negative.\n\n\nIn the very last period, the last months, we can notice that the inflation rate for these two is now very close. \n\n\n\n\n\n## Active Wallets\n\nHow about active wallets? How many have been used? Here is the chart. \n\n\n\n![image007.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tkpMBFVCmZc6eg39EKw1hCeHnXeW4yYVZ1wsBqpqeMbJv1hPuNB63AWBouJj3z3tJ3d.png)\n \n\n\n\nWhen we look at the numbers of active wallets Bitcoin is in a small lead. Ethereum came close to Bitcoin in the previous bull run, at the end of 2017 and the beginning of 2018. On a few occasions ETH has surpassed BTC in number of daily active wallets. It was close again in 2021, but since then BTC has performed better. \n\n\n\n### When we zoom in  2023-2025 we get this:\n\n\n\n\n![image009.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tbRgoLf1zSMUWesjNnXLBWDd6ybLZF6gNdm3fQa1TJngpp5pEb8rciZmUbJjGz9vK3E.png)\n\n\n\n\nA very close race in the last year with both of the networks in the range of **400k to 600k** daily active wallets. \n\nBitcoin had some spikes in the period, usually with the adoption of the second layer tokens boosted by the Ordinals protocol. \n\n\n\n\n\n## Number of Daily Transactions\n\nHere is the chart for the number of daily transactions.\n\n \n\n![image011.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tS12eENHsP7ZNJpz1wMqWBzdeLZyGRAoemmK1RbfY6m6oWfZwaULEBezgv8EkGiinQF.png)\n\n\n\n\nIn terms of daily transactions Ethereum is in the lead in front of Bitcoin. \n\nEthereum has overtaken Bitcoin in 2017 and has been leading since then. In the last months the tx on Ethereum have increased and have reached **1.6M**.  On the Bitcoin network the transactions have been low around the **500k** mark, after the previous volatility it had due to the L2 experiments, tokens and NFTs. \n\n\n\n## Fees\n\nThe chart for the fees  looks like this. \n\n\n\n\n![image015.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23u5tDCqC2eSS9dbpQ7pR54wzTgruv52nasYmM8ukNuV1yEVDuXQsbFVMcaWrLj1xjBpe.png)\n\n\n \n\n\n\n*These are the average daily fees per transaction in $ value.*\n\n\nWe can notice the volatility in the fees. Back in 2022 especially on the Ethereum network. The fees on Ethereum were as high as 50$, and have dropped to few dollars at the end of 2022. In 2023 fees on Ethereum increased and this has continued in 2024 with the average fees on Ethereum close to 20$. But in the last months the fees on Ethereum are record low levels, less even than Bitcoin. \n\nFor Bitcoin, we can notice the sharp increase in May 2023. This is due to the NFS and tokens. At one point the fees on the Bitcoin network reached 30$. Another sharp move in November and December 2024and a retrace in the last months. \n\nBitcoin fees are now in the range of one to two dollars, while on Ethereum they are bellow one dollar. \n\n\n\n\n\n## Bitcoin and Ethereum Market Cap\n\nThe interesting topic for Bitcoin and Ethereum is *the flippening*, or will Ethereum surpass Bitcoin in terms of market cap and become no.1 crypto. \n\nHere is the historical chart for the Bitcoin VS Ethereum market cap. \n\n\n\n\n\n![image017.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/Eo6CkidgAQMNWPFiPCfvpvK7qXTJ8qc5KNSM5tDBSYjN6TpwRPczzRkotkJe4ShuWtF.png)\n \n\n\n\n\n\nWe can see that at first in 2015 when Ethereum was launched it had a very low market cap compared to Bitcoin. As time progressed in the bull run of 2017 Ethereum has come close to the market cap of Bitcoin on few occasions, but only for a short period of time. \n\nIn the last years the Bitcoin dominance has been growing from around 70% back in 2021 to close to 90% against Ethereum in 2025. It has been quite the ride for Bitcoiners, but not exactly the same for Ethereum holders. Will Ethereum manage to increase its market share going forward? It remains to be seen. \n\n\n\n**The pie chart looks like this**:\n\n \n\n\n![image019.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23t79F6Mw8ier3hdYpqvf3x6fmMFwR48fW9AjMB1WJEK7Gd6LQgKu8wfe7MZHPbbXDQiq.png)\n\n\n\n\nAt the moment Bitcoin is around **2.1 trillion**marketcap while Ethereum is around **320 billions**.\n\n\n\n----\n\n## Summary\n\n\nThese two are now close when it comes to inflation with both tokens bellow one percent yearly inflation. Bitcoin is leading when it comes to active wallets, while Ethereum is in the lead for the number of transactions, although BTC has seen some increase in activity in the last period. The fees on the Bitcoin network have gone up, in the period of NFTs and tokens, but are low in the last months, while on the Ethereum network they are currently at record low levels, lower than BTC.\n\nWhen it comes to the market cap, the 70% - 30% ratio has held for a long time, but now Bitcoin has increased its dominance to 87% to 13%. \n\nWhile these two chains are now totally different in design and function, Bitcoin seems stronger than ever and shows it can do things that Ethereum does as well. Plus the overall ETF approval and the Bitcoin treasury strategy companies like MicroStrategy are doing has pushed Bitcoin higher. \n\n\nAll the best\n@dalz",

        "body": "Ethereum has been proof of stake chain for almost three years now. As a reminder the proof of work and the proof of stake chain merged in September 2022, almost two years after the launch of the PoS chain that runed in parallel with the PoW chain mainet. Finaly unstaking was enabled in March 2023, when everyone who had staked on the PoS chain could unstake if they wish so. \n\n\nHow is staking Ethereum going these days? After everything was finished and time has passed. Are more users unstaking or maybe staking now? It’s been a year since the unstaking is live so let’s check it out. \n\n\n \n\n\n\n![01X.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23xKmb9T2G8HYhdAiRQM7h7Yx7mkMQD2Bjd5MxssV1SWXua6jHAGzgAS1Bw289zKm9D5Y.png)\n\n\n\nHere we will be looking at:\n-\tStaked Ethereum by date\n-\tStaked VS Unstaked ETH since the Shanghai update\n-\tShare of staked ETH\n-\tNumber of validators \n-\tTop staking pools\n\nThe data presented here is mostly gathered from Dune Analytics and Ethscan.\n\n\n## Staked Ethereum by Date\n\nHere is the chart.\n\n \n\n\n\n![image001.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23swiNzBiV87R2PFPRjLyPja2bj3nUDDxpYk93oe2TrjfrrG7CUn7MTqi9GhKiTPPpmpL.png)\n\n\n\n\nThis is the amount of staked ETH since the launch of the Beacon chain and the option for staking Ethereum in November 2020. \nWe can see a constant growth in the amount of ETH staked and, on some occasions, a sharp increase. In the recent period there has been some downtrend but in the very last period we can notice an increase again. \n\n\n\nMore than **35M** ETH staked and this is a new ATH since the previous one that was reached in November 2024.\n\n**If we zoom in 2023-2025 we get this:**\n\n \n\n\n![image003.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/Enyobsa8JDkstzEtaCAemciFDLruTLTffjjs3Wpb7GoUKUX3eoWAjyMfbumz2Ze5MgE.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nHere we can notice a strong growth in May 2023. The unstaking option has caused more Ethereum to be staked than unstaked. Probably users felt more comfortable staking now knowing that they can unstake at any moment if needed. \n\nAt the beginning of 2024 there were close to 29M ETH staked while the year ended with 34.2M ETH staked or 5M more. In the last month of 2024 there was more unstaking happening. \nFor 2025 the year started with 34.2M staked and now we are at 35.5M, so more than 1M ETH staked. Overall we can notice a slowdown in the amount of staked ETH, but still a growth. This is understandable since as the share of staked ETH increase the tempo slows down. \n\n### Deposits VS Withdrawals Since the Shanghai Update\n\nIf take a look at the daily deposits vs withdrawals since the update, we get this:\n\n \n\n\n![image005.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/Eo6BhLmdZm1okj4bC4nC9ANZd3pJGGe2u1ja94kyHmsAgjCyugXdKDJwrYT3JyrpEy5.png)\n\n\n\nMost of the days are in positive, meaning that more ETH is being staked in general that ustaked, even with the ustaking option enabled. There are few big unstaking events in April 2023, where more than 100k ETH was unstaked in a day. \n\nWe can notice some bars on the downside that represents the usntaking that has happened in the period. \n\n \n### Share of Staked Ethereum\n\nWhat is the share of staked Ethereum? Here is the historical trend. \n\n\n\n \n\n![image007.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23t797twambpae2FbxKq2rmjZEZgQiw74HSA5azhYGsLWzTaHWurbYtZkSEKrnGGc3xiG.png)\n\n\nWe can notice that the staking was activated later in the Ethereum lifecycle and since recently it has started to gather more momentum. It’s worth noting that since last year Ethereum cut their inflation down as well and is deflationary in the last period. What this means is that the ETH issuance is lowered, and at the same time the staking is locking more ETH, basically lowering the liquid supply from both ends. \n\n**The liquid Ethereum supply looks like this:**\n\n\n \n\n\n![image009.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23t76pL8JaedDgR25PNheZb1kwNqK4L7zuCawnkWhF5HbR7RiPnMpiCsQ2U1HUQrcoVmF.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nWe can see the drop in the liquid ETH supply, from 113M at the top in 2020 to 85M now. It seems that there is finally some slowdown in the amount of ETH staked. Will see where the balance is found. Staking provides APR, but if more ETH is staked this APR goes down. Also, the APR for staking depends on the network activity and the fees paid by users. \n\n**The current share of staked ETH looks like this:**\n \n\n\n\n![image011.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23t77FXbzZ34UTpabCv8ujzamnmFx68VuNd87VyuzwbAm1sEXLsaPgk7MsMeipjfcweoz.png)\n\n\n\n\n\n\nWhen compared to the total ETH supply that is around 120M now, the 35M staked ETH represents a **29%** of the supply. It seems that there is some equilibrium around this mark.  \n\n## Number of Validators\nHere is the chart.\n\n\n \n\n\n![image013.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/Eo1vqET7sxbmzRdMJbyFk7D8GhG1ArqyoNWBHzqU5KRUjsWkjqhN3nmj7Kfi2X6ePb1.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nThe number of validators has also continued to grow. At the moment there are **1.1M** validators. We can notice some drop at the end of 2024 and the beginning of 2025 and a growth again in the last month. \n\nNote that these are not unique validators, as most of them are represented by a pool or some type of CEX. There is now even a proposal to decrease the upper limit for a validator from 32ETH, so at some point the number of validators might consolidate. \n\n\n## Top Ethereum Stakers\n\nWho is staking the most? Here is the chart.\n\n\n \n\n\n\n![image015.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tv8f2nBsCNftdrgmKE9PdfzECaJu9dwx8LZsrEwMCdMqQwnnb8HtzcZnW5HHViQNAWu.png)\n\n\n\n\n\n\nThe **Lido** pool is on the top with **9M** ETH staked. This pool has even its own token for governance. On the second spot is the Binance exchange followed by the Coinbase exchange on the third spot.\n\nLido has dominated in the past, but it seems that it has peaked and now has an even lower amount of ETH staked from the beginning of the year.
