        "body": "How did Hive do in June 2025 from an inflation standpoint? Let’s take a look!\n\n\n \n\n![01.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23u5bkKqspoPDvtS2nkiVKVuncK7tEgThvCTMrttQWE19R4w17j9uNS2Kr2vNeHf4ZZLc.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nThe projected inflation for Hive for 2025 is **5.5%** on a yearly basis, or around 0.45% on a monthly basis. \n\nHive has a double currency system, HIVE and HBD, with conversions between them that add or remove HIVE from circulation on top of the regular inflation. Furthermore, the decentralized hive fund DHF, that serves as a DAO converts the HIVE that is in the DHF into HBD. \nThe @hbdstabilizer has also grown and it plays an important role in the overall tokenomics, making conversions and trading on the internal market.\nBecause of this additional mechanics the HIVE inflation and supply can be drastically different in real time than the regular/projected one. \n\nTo be able to follow the HIVE supply we need to take a look at all the different ways HIVE is created, author, curation, witness rewards, conversions etc, then net that out with the HIVE burned from conversions, accounts fees, null transfers etc. To get the virtual supply we need to do the same for the HBD supply as well. \n\n\n## HIVE Created \n\nHere is the chart.\n\n\n \n\n![image001.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23xV8rXh1hFqraE8kJvCzHyVRLSfgf8DY394e8K5DpNmA3FDkBG7AqY4mRamXFo5jrfN3.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nThe chart above includes:\n-\tAuthor rewards\n-\tCuration rewards\n-\tWitness rewards\n-\tStaking rewards\n\nThese are the *regular* ways new Hive enters circulation, and all of them are through vested HIVE, aka powered up. The regular inflation is around **75k** HIVE per day. \n\nWe can notice the increase in the daily HIVE issued because it is dependent on the virtual hive supply, or the base for inflation. When the price of HIVE is low, the virtual hive supply increases, and when it is up, the virtual hive supply decreases. After a period of growth, especially in the summer of 2024, there was a decline, but in the last few months there has been an increase again.\n\nThe thing is the **conversions** are playing a major role in the ecosystem. Here is the chart again, including conversions.\n\n\n\n\n![image003.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23u5tHZxbWR4XMFMuJ1UWZmHzxzb6HHpE7NTBKP7uXwsGDSievktsLcLBXPHNuit6e1zF.png)\n\n \n\n\n\nWe can notice that the HBD to HIVE conversions are the dominant in the chart. This works in both ways and a big part of them is converted back to HIVE, especially through the work of the stabilizer. \n\nIn general, there are less conversions since the summer of 2023 that is mostly because of the stabilizer that has reduced its funding since then and the size of the conversions in both ways. Also, market dynamics influence the conversions a lot, as users usually convert when the HIVE price is low. \n\n\n## HIVE Removed from Circulation \nHere is the chart.\n\n \n\n\n![image005.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tkk3Wy6hWAfPoLmqXMGEsAMMmqN4SgmhT1bDCbnmSoH9CuyxRAbkWWhZ4DAX1GtVbMe.png)\n\n\nThe above takes into consideration six different ways of HIVE removed:\n- Ninja Mined HIVE To HBD Conversions In DHF\n- HIVE transfers to DHF and converted to HBD\n- Transfers to null \n- Null as post beneficiary\n- New accounts creation fee\n- HIVE to HBD conversions\n\nThe HIVE transfers to the DHF are dominant. These are transfers made by the stabilizer. We can see a few spikes in the HIVE to HBD conversions (blue), with one occurring just recently. These were due to the increase in the HBD price. We can also notice the drop since the summer of 2023, same as the opposite conversions due to the lower funds and low volumes that the stabilizer is doing.\n\n\n## Historical HIVE Supply\n\nWhen all the above is added and removed, we get this chart for the all-time HIVE supply.\n\n\n \n\n\n![image007.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/Eo44rEXuSqadBPxjWPbRdXARDyd1vy1GZFt1vgu5FQM34SuBBh1zxVEuZC7een3BmCf.png)\n\n\n\n\n\n\nUp until August 2021, the supply was almost steadily increasing with a small fluctuation. Then there was a drop in the supply in September 2021. Since then, from time to time we can see some drops in the supply in February and April 2023. \n\nJune 2025 ended with **480M** HIVE in circulation.\n\n\n## HBD Supply\n\nHere is the chart for the HBD supply. \n\n \n\n\n\n![image011.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23t77MG8aDNpPaDjHYuxcY5xgxz29as8CtUDCtyo95zTRbFkjB7nBkNJCeYkmprjZo7dr.png)\n\n\n\n\n\n\nThe light color is HBD in DHF. The HBD in the DHF is not freely circulating HBD and only enters circulation when payouts to the DHF workers are made. \n\nHBD is being created and removed in various ways, but the conversions play the major role here in both directions. Other ways HBD are created are DHF proposal payouts, author rewards and interest. \n\nWe can see that after a downtrend in 2022, in the last period the HBD supply is very stable around the 11M.\nIn the last month the HBD supply has been very stable around the **11M** with almost no change.  \n\n\n\n## Virtual HIVE Supply\n\nWhen we add the HIVE equivalent supply from the HBD to the HIVE supply we get the chart below.\n\n\n\n\n![image013.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tGY4jgkpWj5ZRnW2m5HYZ73kdMh9aa3qnxeeeQRfdsj8hXPcSaAqdHiVFxEJgGdbgxM.png)\n \n \n\n\nThe light color is HIVE that in theory can be converted from HBD at the current market prices for HIVE. \nWe can see that the virtual supply fluctuates a lot, mostly because it is tied to the price of HIVE. As the price of HIVE drops, the virtual supply increases and the opposite. \n\nWe can notice that after the sharp increase in the virtual supply there is now a pullback in the last months.\n\n\n### When we zoom in 2023 - 2025 we get this:\n\n\n \n\n![image015.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tGZdmtTH1cDnLAQpNxaQoWbiZDa5seWE9t3oKAYpyXPg1sXnSiLk6rmGpxF58wkU7Ep.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nHere again we can see the increase in the virtual supply towards the end of the chart. The regular HIVE supply has slowly increased in the period. \n\n### Projected VS Realized HIVE Inflation in 2025\n\n \n\n\n\n![image009.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23t74pCNfxLkKWf7BbucVQwbWQCF22qPTvEY21wdSD7i6aCJUvGpmLeqc6D7DHcZrL3QZ.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nThis chart tells the story of the new HIVE entering circulation in 2025.\n\nWe can see that in the first months of 2025 the projected vs realized inflation were close to each other/ Since March these two diverged and the realized inflation started to surpass the projected one. For the first half of 2025 the project inflation in absolute numbers is 13M HIVE, while the realized is at 17M. In terms of percentage the projected for 2025 is at 5.8%, while the realized annualized inflation is at 7.41%. \n\n\n\n### Monthly Inflation\n\nIf we plot the monthly inflation in 2024-2025, we get this.\n\n \n\n\n\n\n\n![image019.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23w2FYKtgcEQpcgPfjytUapTaJ3LWKfXDtWMteNuJbq3UX8SFn6fWPTxW9hyNDH2npwkT.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nThis is a chart for the period of 2024-2025. \nAs we can see, all the months in the period are positive. May 2024 is the lowest one with 0.36%, while August 2024 is the highest with 1.46%.  In the last months we have moderate numbers around the 0.5% mark. \n\nJune 2025 is just around the projected one with **0.69%**.\n\nIn terms of absolute numbers, the HIVE supply in June 2025 has increased from 477M to 480.3M, adding **3.3M** HIVE in circulation, while the projected one is around 2M.\n\n### Yearly Inflation [%]\nThe yearly, projected and realized inflation looks like this.\n\n \n\n\n\n\n![image021.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/EoCbLf8fXoxDJVcLVWefpza1mXsHmfrYYJav7Z9b4MoWGXVFXw1njSC8sNST79Qnwf7.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nAfter the first four months of 2025 the annualized HIVE inflation is at 7.4%. This is higher than the projected 5.5% for 2025. The reason is because of the HBD to HIVE conversions. The HBD supply is almost constant in the period at 11M HBD, and approximately the same amount of HBD that is entering in circulation on a monthly basis is being converted to HIVE.\nBut we are still early in this year with four months behind us. Last year the first half was somewhat neutral, but then the second half ended being more inflationary. Will see how things will evolve in 2025. \n\n\n### Net HIVE Created by Category in April 2025\nHere is the new HIVE put in circulation by category for the month.\n\n\n\n\n\n![image023.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tvB1m48N7PFcT6ywgfcr1UPQcc5749dqUmjQU1GsMFZpL12vi3y35uBPNb48xdXjTds.png)\n\n\n \n\n\nConversions are first with 1.1M HIVE created in this way. Conversions are the main variable that is changing the Hive inflation and when they are positive the inflation is above, or when they are negative the inflation is below the projected one. \n\nThe curation rewards are in the second spot with close to 1M HIVE. \nSome HIVE was burned for @null as beneficiary and account creation fees. \n\nNote that authors rewards are paid 50% HIVE, 50% HBD, and the HIVE share only is at 500k, while approximately the same amount was paid in HBD equivalent. \n\n\n\nAll the best\n@dalz",

        "body": "This is the long term chart for the historical Hive Power share and the Hive supply, from a recent post of mine.\n\n\n\n![image.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz.shorts/Eoni8npBDZYXM8mKiwriBxHDhGnjmUXRgHUCkTfDhVht2mL9LQ2dXv23UoRcvs31cnf.png)\n\n\nWhat I find interesting from this chart is that the Hive Power or locked Hive (including the DHF), is almost roughly constant in the entire history of Hive, starting even back from Steem back in 2016.\n\nAt the very beging all the Steem back then was powered up and locked with almost no liqudity. The powering down period at first was set in years. Later it was shortened to three months with a weekly share, what now seems long :). \n\nThe main point is that the powered up and locked Hive in apsolute numbers has been around the **200M** mark for all the time.\nMeanwhile the liquid Hive keeps growing and we are now at a record high.\n",

        "body": "Hive has multiple methods to distribute inflation that helps its token distribution and stay decentralized. With the addition of the HBD savings interest there is now a total of **six ways** the inflation on Hive is distributed: authors, curators, staking, witness, DHF and HBD interest. \n\n\n\n\n![01.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tvVgx9sjycAbfkc9fiQSinZ3ggFPhQdonqWZpLygfTYCenzXDwgnkUNZVDWJvtUu2H5.png)\n\n\n \n\n\n\nHere we will be looking at the overall inflation distribution for HIVE, looking at the following\n-\tAuthors rewards\n-\tCurators rewards\n-\tWitnesses rewards\n-\tDHF/DAO rewards \n-\tHBD interest\n-\tCumulative rewards\n\n## Top Authors \n\nHere is the chart for the top 20 Hive authors that earned the most in the month.\n\n \n\n\n![image001.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23u5te9jqck5rqz8ei5mBCMuiJnyZVf9cuSAJ5qx85DGYDTdng24KvZN1Z6MCA7LX1zZr.png)\n\n\n\n\n\n*Note: These are not totally accurate numbers because there is a conversion on VESTS to HIVE, for simplification. Also some of the top beneficiaries like the hbdstabilizator, null, reward.app, etc are excluded.* \n\nI have made a breakdown in the author and beneficiary rewards. \nAuthor rewards are one of the most know in the blockchain as a lot of users are attracted to them. \n\n@oflyhigh is on the top.\n\nThere are around 6.5k accounts that have received rewards in June 2025. The **median** payout is 30 HIVE, while the average is around 130 HIVE.\n\n\n## Top Curators \n\nHere is the chart for the top 20 Hive curators that earned the most in the month. \n\n\n \n\n\n![image003.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tvArbtZMr65uYr1FPnormQVhMvyYF2QaBB3mcFea36EvBumKT9SKWzsbXruvYobHVH9.png)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n@appreciator is on the top here, followed by @alpha and @blocktrades.\n\nThe accounts above are the biggest curators on the Hive blockchain. Hope they will do a great job in curating and making this place grow.\n\n## Top Witnesses\n\nThe top witnesses’ earnings charts look like this. \n\n\n \n\n![image005.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tH1RUjDFwEemGrzs9siDNjUFFA8qYbYhE7okqUfNa8ZAawYHCMYRQnAZoWJAN2kurvT.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nI have included more than 20 accounts in this chart to show the drop in earnings after the 20th spot. The top 20 are earning around the same amount of HIVE (HP), around 12k per month.  \n\nThere seems to be a healthy competition among witness now, especially around the 20th spot. \n\n## The DHF/DAO Payouts\n\n\nAccounts that received funding from the DHF/DAO in the period.\n\n \n\n\n\n![image007.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tbMYDnRCZEiETgBZhLJiNy1oQp82ChQKNwRLVqEKa7vfgDKk5mWjA7WE8LsCG4WAfC6.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nDHF workers are paid in HBD, and the numbers above are in HBD. \n\nA total of 15 accounts received funding in June 2025.\n\nThe @vsc.network account is at the top here, followed by @keychain, @ecency etc. A total of 116k HBD was paid in June 2025, and it is relatively lower than the previous month when it was 250k, mostly due to the lack of the @valueplan account, that usually has big payments. \n\n\nNote on the special **@hbdstabilizer**. I have excluded this account from the here, since it is dominant on the top, with **370k HBD** received in the month, but since technically it’s not keeping those funds, it is excluded from the list. \n\n## Top HBD Interest Earners\nHere is the chart.\n \n\n\n\n\n![image009.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tGXrZCwHBLtWpa6foTZp4m7mpzKfSiyCv2xEHLWdowprX5Bv4tTKoxZxDcLq2TdCbNu.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nThe @lazy-panda is on the top here with 28k HBD, followed by the @blocktrades and the @sps.dao. A total of 97k HBD was paid as interest rewards in June 2025.\n\n## Top Earners Cumulative\nFrom the data above we can compile the payout for a single ranking on overall top earners on the Hive blockchain for the month. \n\nHere is the chart.\n\n \n\n\n\n\n\n![image011.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23uEwtXZSngeQkFPWpjYCRi3tZWGJv2zqCyM46K7DrUVk3RVzd6NZ4tanBzhs3hBqupvu.png)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n*Note: These are not totally accurate numbers because there is a conversion on HBD to HIVE implemented, and VESTS to HIVE, for simplification.*\n\nI have separated the different earnings for the top accounts accordingly. \nThe @vsc.network is on the top here followed by @lazy-panda and then @blocktrades.\n\n\n\nAll the best\n@dalz\n\n\n**I’m a witness. Please consider supporting me https://peakd.com/me/witnesses**\n\nP.S.         "body": "The Hive Power is an essential parameter for the Hive ecosystem. Hive Power holders are the ones that vote for witnesses, DHF proposals, curate posts, and receive curation rewards. It’s the main asset on the chain. \nHolding powered up HIVE is a big commitment from its users as it takes three months to power it down. \nThe HIVE price impacts this parameter as many other things as well. Usually when the prices are down, we can see more powering up and when they are up users tend to power down more. We have seen this in the past. \n\nLet’s take a look at the data.\n\n \n\n\n\n![01.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23w2csk3rjBM3wjB5PGvaMGw89XEgeXNDFsTfUmXa9jSmm3U8BvZsfuf6dPEyPwzVX3Gg.png)\n\n\n\n\n\n\nWe will be looking at:\n-\tHive Powered Up by Date\n-\tHive Powered Up by Month\n-\tHive Power Supply\n-\tHive Power historical Share\n-\tTop Accounts That Powered up\n-\tTop Accounts That Powered Down\n\n*Note that in the daily amount of powered up HIVE I have included the HP that is rewarded daily to hive users, as that HP enters in circulation and adds on top of the existing HP.*\n\n\n## Daily Hive Power Changes\n\nHere is the chart.\n\n \n\n![image001.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23t7BGEduC9ajJLxDdhFZLGQecqfn7gdrtHR1C9RT94XTdcqSjuRbfgRNrDWnt1UDcejP.png)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nThis chart dates to 2016 for context.\nAs we can see there was a lot of powering down back in 2016-2017. This is because the token started with all the HIVE, or STEEM back then, powered up, and there were no liquid tokens to trade on exchanges. \nAnother spike in the powering downs is at the beginning of 2018, and again in April 2020 when the Hive fork happened and there was a lot of turbulence like exchanges powering up and then down. \n\nIn the last years we can notice that the volatility has dropped a lot and there is more stability around Hive Power. \n\n**When we zoom in 2024-2025 we get this:**\n\n\n \n\n![image003.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tGVct8KB3adB2nDyCu8tdUZekVrgq3Jfevqu36eqYjcp5bRUTZ2mqRWNvahmoTNTgbK.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nWhile we can notice the ups and downs, the volatility is much lower than the previous years, and in the range of **-200k to +200k** HP daily with occasional spikes. \n\nWhat is noticeable here is the latest spikes in powering up, first in July 2024 on a few occasions there was more than 1M HIVE powered per day, and again at the beginning of September on few occasions around 500k HIVE was powered up. \nAt the end of 2024 and the beginning of 2025 there was a period with more power downs, due to the increase in the HIVE price in the last period we can see the opposite trend with more power ups happening due to low HIVE prices. \n\n### On a monthly basis we have this:\n\n \n\n\n\n![image009.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/Eo6DABcoPo83KqLRVbaUTGv3EUiF6shVD8trJ2LZBAJ84gngQhzJNLZ1NTU9teZ9bsh.png)\n\n\n\n\n\n\nHere we can notice the relativly quite first half of 2024 then a spike in July 2024 and the summer, and a drop toward the end of 2024. January 2025 was also negative in terms of powering up, and in the last months we are seing again a positve shift. As mentioned this is haighly corelated with the HIVE price. \n\n\n*Note that the new HIVE that is entering in circulation is as HP, around 2M per month and this chart is taking into account that as well.*\n\n\n### The yearly chart looks like this:\n\n \n\n\n\n![image011.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tGbqxac2VEkqZ4AwxHzTV8o5prBv77E1oRVXRwG48cyrkoDQDsjbp1H6WY7gAZHPU6N.png)\n\n\n\n\n\n2017 has been the one year with more HIVE powered down. A net 15M HIVE powered down in 2017. 2022 has been a record high year for HP added with 17.5M HP. In 2023 we were around 6M HP while for 2024 we are at 13M more HP added in circulation. For the first half of 2025 we are at just 2M in positive.\n\n\n## HIVE Power Cumulative Supply\n\nWhen we plot the cumulative HIVE power in the period, against the total supply we get this.\n\n \n\n\n\n![image013.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/Eoni9s67j9aE6M5wk9uAm9ciC3Ejim6BuGs8gPr8na53GKv5TedF3Ru7cz6GLQmBYK4.png)\n\n\n\n\nThe bottom strongest white is HP, while the share in the middle is the HIVE that is locked up in the DHF. The top is liquid HIVE.\n\nWe can notice that in the last years there has been an uptrend in the amount of HIVE Power.\nThe HIVE in the DHF was previously powered up, but then it was transferred in the DHF and is now slowly converted to HBD over a period of five years. This is also locked HIVE. \nWe can notice the ups and downs in March 2020 when the hostile takeover happened. \n\nOverall, the HIVE Power has been growing slowly in the whole period, but the liquid HIVE has even more aggressive expansion up until 2021. The other thing that influences the liquid HIVE supply is HBD, and when HIVE to HBD conversions happen that reduces the liquid HIVE. The liquid HIVE is attacked so to speak from two sides, HP and HBD.\n\n\n## Hive Power 2020 - 2025\nWhen we zoom in on Hive Power only, we get this:\n\n\n\n\n\n![image015.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tGZrGwLaASNM5KpH4fR74HjSAWWWJf8cod5MQ1TEXWVAAaWrSbcXp5icgNsHeV2rMvS.png)\n\n \n\n\nA slow increase in the amount of HIVE powered up, from 140M HP in 2020, to **187M** HP now. We can notice the movement in the last year, a bump during the summer of 2024, then a drop toward the end of the year and a growth again in the last months. \n\n\n\n**The chart for the liquid HIVE looks like this:**\n\n \n\n\n\n\n![image017.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tGa1VcVvQQ2EwmyX6pZNxBZdMfdAz8S1uvTDzwWC1eyTES8nehAnpZvP8ZB9BMDmMun.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nA steady uptrend here as well with some spikes on the downside. This happens usually when there are conversions to HBD.\nWe can see the drop back in September 2021, when there were a lot of conversions to HBD. A recent smaller drop in February 2023 as well. \nIn 2020 there was around 145M liquid HIVE and now we are at 257M.\n \n\n\n## Hive Power Share [%]\nHere is the chart in percentage points. \n \n\n\n\n\n![image021.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tRxJ5efgqS1GXr1tK3aBYs5suxeNghwwMzUXRHEKht1P6hq5Tv6cj8XwuE4JFcaBAWC.png)\n\n\n\nThis is from the start of the Hive fork in March 2020.\n\nAn overall downtrend in the HP share. There was an increase back in 2021 and since then a downtrend with some occasional spikes. Back in 2022 for a long period the share was hovering around 50%, then it dropped in 2023 and 2024, and in the last months of 2025 it has been hovering around 42% share and it is the lowest it has been in the Hive lifetime. \n\n\n## HIVE Supply Share\nWhen we plot the current supply on a pie, we get this.\n\n \n\n\n\n![image023.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23swigqqhSJj2oehT5EE6sjxgP4VTaD9uzzW6k6q8fjxWLhMgFY5V22TXzs2tYE59qSBh.png)\n\n\n\n\n\n-\t39% Hive Power\n-\t54% Liquid HIVE\n-\t7% HIVE in the DHF\n\nBearing in mind that the HIVE in the DHF is locked we can say that a cumulative **46%** of the HIVE supply is powered up / locked. \n\n## Top Accounts that Powered Up in 2025\n\nWho is powering up the most?\nHere is the chart for the first half of 2025.\n\n\n\n\n\n![image025.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tv8FJiVzeR2Utb3Q8UksQa5KqhEpE69cuNAbbefGDtt4UBcBi9gHd9WPa5SbubJmTLK.png)\n\n \n\n\n\nThe @honey-swap account has been making some movements recently with its HIVE holdings, some of it was moved and landed out for Binance yield, and it has also powered up in 2025. @themarkymark and @pfunk next on the list. \n\n\n\n\n## Top Accounts that Powered Down in 2025\n\nWho is powering down the most?\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n![image027.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/Eoc5566bwjJShR526GXdWxj178oGVbaX2LHruEpwJ7j8ij2pPSW5MRrZtA8mtTCaafR.png)\n\n\n \n\n\n\nThe @ipromote account has been powering down the most followed by the @hbdstabulizer and then @arhag. \n\n----\n\nThe HIVE power share is at record lows now. A positive thing from this is the HP holders will get even more rewards because the staking share from the inflation goes to less HP. The HIVE price has decreased and has caused some users to power up in the last months. \n\nAll the best\n@dalz",

        "body": "Bitcoin has scaling issues. It’s almost design at this point. Not sure was there a vision in the very early days when the network was started by Satoshi Nakamoto, but after the block wars of 2017, the path has been chosen. The path is small blocks on layer one, limiting the amount of data that can be stored and transacted on the network. The scaling solutions for Bitcoin are now left to Layer 2s. \nThe Lightning Network is one of those solutions. It is not the only one though. There are other solutions like Liquid, Fedimint, Drivechains etc.  Even Hive can be a scaling solution for BTC if we implement a sufficient enough integration with it. \n\n\n\n \n![01.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tkk184amgT2HhrzF1pmbgcWms89wDFwipH1B319K4vt97g7VPPX3Y1ZoJQqJ6XVxjtQ.png)\n\n\n\nHere we will be looking at the data for the Lightning network. A short explanation from ChatGPT: \n\n> The lightning network operates through the creation of payment channels between users, which allow for transactions to occur off the main blockchain. These transactions are only settled on the blockchain when the channels are closed, reducing the burden on the network and enabling the consolidation of many transactions into one. This system relies on smart contracts to ensure the security and fulfillment of transactions without the need for third-party intermediaries\n\nIn theory everyone can run a lightning node, there is now a custom Raspberry Pi that does this. The process starts with opening a channel to another wallet that is on chain transaction with fees. But after the channel is created the two wallets can transfer sats for a tiny fee of usually one sat per transaction (0.0001 USD currently). You can open a channel to some of the major nodes that are connected to a lot of the other nodes and indirectly have access to all those nodes. No need to open multiply channels if you are an individual. \n\n\nBuilding the lightning network is a slow process, nodes are opened one by one, as well as channels. This takes time. \n\nHere we will be looking at:\n-\tNumber of nodes\n-\tNumber of channels\n-\tBTC balance on lightning\n-\tNumber of channels per node\n-\tCapacity per node\n-\tTop lightning nodes\n-\tTransactions\n\nThe data is collected from sources like bitcoinvisuals.com, 1ml.com, lightningnetwork.plus etc. \n\n## Bitcoin Fees\n\nBefore going into the data on the lightning network lets take a look at the fees on the Bitcoin base chain.\n\n\n \n\n![image001.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23u5XN9GnLwgHS2zyKW1txAmw6eNY9VF2pUW3h9EtwAAaNHePj6VawWbTbQeCt7yfe1zg.png)\n\n\nFees are what is making users use L2 solutions. When they are high users avoid transacting on the base chain. It also makes no sense for everyday use like buying coffee with Bitcoin. \n\n\nWe can see the spikes in the chart above in the previous bull market in 2021 when the fees reached more than 50 USD per transactions. Another spike happened recently at the end of 2023 and beginning of 2024, when there was some hype around NFTs and tokens on Bitcoin.\nA smaller spike happened in November 2024 as a result in the increase in the Bitcoin price. In the last period the fees on the Bitcoin network has been relatively low due to the reduced activity.\n\n\n## Number of Lightning Nodes\n\nHere is the chart for the historical data for the number of lightning nodes. \n\n\n\n\n![image003.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23t76buN2roNoLVSw7nsJ7P6fgDoAaEsxiYKq1GfCkH3AdbXWcBvh9kLqKWQNtT2h9NgG.png)\n\n \n\n\n*This chart shows the number of nodes with and without channels.* \n\nWe can see that since its launch in 2018 the number of lightning nodes have grown. They have grown more aggressive in 2020 and 2021 reaching an ATH of 20k nodes at the end of 2021. Then in 2022 there was a sharp drop to around 17k, since when the number of lighting nodes has remained constant around that number for two years. A small increase in 2024 and a drop since then to bellow **15k** nodes where we are now. \n\nAs mentioned, running a node is quite easy for a little bit technical people. You can do it on a small home computer or Raspberry or choose some cloud provider. \n\n## Number of Channels\n\nEach node can open multiple channels to other nodes, meaning the number of channels is greater than the number of nodes. The more channels the better the network is interconnected. Here is the chart. \n\n \n\n\n![image005.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/48FiELArksEwMVeZiPKDeXC7R1kqQbxRwt4woiy3aN2WGC8MZaJtJ1cyuGBYbaARV3.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nThis chart follows the node chart to some extent with more aggressive numbers. The number of channels has grown aggressively in the 2020-2021 period, reached and ATH to 84k, and started going down in 2022. Ita has been mostly a downtrend since then, with occasional increase and we are now at **56k** channels. \n\n\n\n\n\n## BTC Balance on Lightning\n\nWhen a node is created and channels opened, they are usually funded with Bitcoin transferred from layer 1 to lightning. Each channel has some amount of Bitcoin on it. The collective amount of Bitcoin on all the Lightning channels represents how much BTC is transferred to the network. This is usually referred as *lightning capacity.*\n\n\nHere is the chart. \n\n\n\n\n![image007.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23t797uH1KCx2tHLStCjpu2NKzm5GMCNf1wdoTmJPT6qBbMhVmupmQ19bUbgjYBqiiwHA.png)\n\n\n \n\n\nThe chart above has the info for BTC and USD value. \nIn terms of USD value, the lightning network has recently reached an ATH, at the end of 2024 with 500M USD value stored on it. Then as the price dropped so does the value in USD. But if we look at the amount of BTC on the lightning network it has dropped in the last period from 5.5k to **4.2k** BTC where we are now. \n\nIn terms of share of the total supply this is a relatively low number to 0,024%. \n\n\n\n## Number of Channels per Node\n\nHow many channels each node has opened? Here is the chart.\n\n \n\n\n\n![image011.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tGW1ffMkb8QPrDwMWPaHywLpDjz7R83HSP4FKWNq6SzSYHmkT8iqAFpWbkEG735a1jD.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nWe can see that in the beginning the number of channels per node has grown to 20 channels per node. This is due to the fact that at the beginning there were not a lot of nodes. As the network grew, the number of channels per node dropped, since some of the nodes don’t have opened channels, or have just one channel. In the last years the number of channels per node has slowly going down and now we are at the **6** channels. \n\n\n\n## Capacity/Balance per Node\n\nEach node funds its channels with Bitcoin/Sats. Here is the chart. \n\n\n\n\n \n\n![image009.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tGXhNUbaxr7x2EMT4dVz3mQuFbnafwCx1M8BcqTVFGiV3cdXqQ8zTas4GnsGqQhmqLM.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nThis is the average amount of SATS per nodes.\nAs we can see there has been a sharp increase in the beginning to 50M stats per node, then a drop towards 20M stats per node and a growth in 2022 and 2023. Interestingly, the amount of average SATS per node has increased in the bear market, probably due to more node shutting down in the bear market, leaving only the well-funded nodes. \n\nIn the last period the capacity per node has been growing and is around **60M** SATS per node, that is equivalent to around 70k USD with today’s BTC prices. \n\n\n## Top Lightning Nodes\n\nWhich lightning nodes hold the most BTC. Here is the chart. \n\n\n\n \n\n![image013.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23uExBWJ33tEhBSn2W4J9HUHabddWv5HhZxCoEK4MeXx3PHJV4e9xMhAthYauNnjAzC2e.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nThe Binance node is on the top here with close to 600 Bitcoin on its lightning node. For those unaware it’s an exchange node. OKX also another exchange on the second spot with 470 BTC. \nBitfinex has more than one lightning node and if we sum them up it will be on the top. \nSome of the other exchanges in the top lightning nodes as well, like Kraken and the WalletOfSatoshi that is the simplest lightning wallet, but its custodian. \n\n\n----\n\nOverall, the lightning network seems to have grown a lot in 2020 and 2021 but slowed down a bit in 2022-2023. Meanwhile, most of the top exchanges have implemented lighting, Coinbase included, but it is still not in the top 10. More companies are building infrastructure, and the network is much more developed than a few years ago. More companies are accepting lighting as payment as well. We are now at the beginning of the next Bitcoin cycle, and we will see how things will evolve and will lightning will emerge as the network for mass user adoption. 2024 has been somewhat stagnant for lightning with growth towards the end of the year due to high prices. In 2025 the overall trend for number on lightning seems to be down. \n\n\nAll the best\n@dalz",

        "body": "The supply of a token on exchanges is a parameter that is usually closely monitored. The top coins, Bitcoin, Ethereum are especially closely monitored when it comes to the supply on exchanges. What about HIVE? \n\nWhat is the share of the HIVE supply held on exchanges? What is the trend is it going up or down? How has deposited/withdraw the most? Let’s take a look!\n\n\n\n![01.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tvD5oZ6JdUSBhMxRLxRS84LD21Yv1nPut8p7CgGVaoxpnf9KzsuaYNzqAXXA1wZJmnR.png)\n\n\nHere we will be looking at the following:\n-\tNet deposits VS withdrawals\n-\tHIVE balance on exchanges\n-\tTop accounts that deposited to exchanges\n-\tTop accounts that withdraw from exchanges\n-\tTop exchanges balance\n-\tUpbit and Binance balance\n\nExchanges taken in the analysis: Upbit, Binance, Bithumb, Hive Engine, Huobi, Gate.io, MEXC, CoinEX, Indodax and Bitget. There are few more exchanges but the volume there is quite low.\n\n\n\n## Net Daily Deposits and Withdrawals from Exchanges\nWhen we add the deposits and withdrawals on a **daily** basis the chart looks like this.\n\n \n\n\n\n\n![image001.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23swigrpCy6ta1HiR6hWqTHtSbQjjz6ZZDYGEUmjY8RfTQcJkTjyy5yQcDPik6tpTKn9r.png)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n*Note: Transfers between exchanges accounts are excluded from the data above.*\n\nThe most noticeable moves here as well are back in 2021, when first there was a lot of withdrawals and then deposits to exchange. Since then, we ca see some spikes up and down, but much smaller moves. Most of the time there is more daily deposits then withdrawals. We can notice the recent spikes in January 2025 and then lower volumes again.\n\n\n## Monthly Net Deposits VS Withdrawals \n\nWhen we add the deposits and withdrawals on a **monthly** basis the chart looks like this.\n\n \n\n\n![image003.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23t78yA23rJBxfiz3M9fCTc2yerc1RDoiB56eDDVraxnXybCpcNNyoTSpGuTy8tgC4Maf.png)\n\n\n\n\nA clearer representation here. \nAgain, the volatility back from 2021 is noticeable here as well. This is because of the HBD movements at the time, when HBD increased to above its peg, and a lot of HIVE was withdrawn from exchanges and converted to HBD. \n\nIn the last period there is constantly more HIVE deposited to change each month, with a peak in January 2025, close to 5M HIVE deposited monthly. In the last months, May and June, there is around 1M deposited monthly. \n\n\n\n\n## HIVE Balance on Exchanges\n\nWhat is the amount of HIVE on exchanges? \nHere is the chart.\n\n  \n\n\n![image005.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23t77FWNMwtDyfN8Xts2Sf8enqGUkVWhE1SoRpdQpycJhfpSfqKvjBJL18qPv8uLySurs.png)\n\n\n\n\nAs we can see the overall HIVE balance on exchanges has been growing, with some dips along the way. The biggest dip happened back in September 2021, when there was a lot of HIVE converted to HBD due to the increase in the HBD price. A steady growth since then with occasional small dips. \nThe current supply for HIVE on exchanges is at **216M** HIVE. \nAt the beginning of 2025 this number was at 202M meaning 14M HIVE was deposited to exchanges in the first half of 2025.\n\n**The yearly data looks like this:**\n\n| Year | HIVE to Exchanges |\n|------|-------------------|\n| 2021 | -2,440,953        |\n| 2022 | 15,324,520        |\n| 2023 | 24,000,220        |\n| 2024 | 38,984,092        |\n| 2025 | 14,808,319        |\n\nWhen we plot the balance on the exchanges against the total HIVE supply, we get this.\n**HIVE share on exchanges in percent %.**\n\n \n\n\n![image007.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23t77MDkPMmTkhU3CY6wHcGguvJWu2b5YgcVzjNp4JXGZKyVzk545sBj9ayJrVAC1yfYd.png)\n\n\n\n\nFrom the chart above we can say that the HIVE balance on exchanges has been growing both in absolute and in relative terms. \nWe are now at **45%** of all the HIVE on exchanges and have been hovering around that spot for the whole of 2025. This is an all-time high when it comes to the share of HIVE on exchanges. At the beginning of 2024 the share was at 39%, so a 6% growth in the share of HIVE on exchange in 2024. \n\n\n**The top exchanges that hold HIVE are the following:**\n\n\n \n\n\n![image009.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tv66UjwqzznBKUc1bnv3BpEShx4ypZrNT8HEKypPmCXHmvn7irQ6JLmSDeLRx5oAvKd.png)\n\n\n\n\nUpbit is absolutely dominant with 145M HIVE. On the second spot is Binance with 46M, followed by another Korean exchange Bithumb. \nUpbit and Binance have been the major two exchanges for HIVE for years now. There has been some new listings recently but still not a significant amounts on those. \n\n\n### Upbit\n\nWhen we take a closer look to Upbit we have this chart: \n \n\n\n\n![image011.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23t79QMScqLWX9owvLoU4mYeZsoNzvXuLa3hH5ZnQdkXAuPehtXMxsYPQSCbDkLjMqgjb.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nIt has been growing in most of the period, especially back in 2021. In the last year there was a small decline in the amount of HIVE on Upbit, in the first half of 2024, then an increase agai, and it the very last month there is a dip again. A total of **145M** HIVE is now on Upbit!\n\n\n### Binance\n\nThe Binance chart looks like this:\n\n\n \n\n\n![image013.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tGaDaKoavYzrra76cQDZiySPDECUDF4D9qsDZHJFCDxL5jRS23AQazYu5ac3SJFXhUB.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nA more diverse trend here. An increase in the beginning, then a drop and somewhat side action in the last few years, up to 2023, when at the end of the year the and the beginning of 2024 the amount of HIVE on Biance started growing again with a spike towards the end of the year and the beginning of 2025 up to 50M, then a drop and again a recent spike just a weeks ago to 50M and back again to 46M where we are now.\n\nIt seems that since the introduction of Hive features on Binance the volatility has increased and there is more movements on tokens, especially between Binance and Upbit as the biggest pools. \n\n\n\n**Here is the chart for Upbit VS Binance**:\n\n\n\n\n![image015.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tGVusKbyWQgz2NiiKSNjt4fah149Zx95inN4VxXqjYGegh1Sfi81bApk4qz2uQY8Jbz.png)\n \n\n\n\n\n\nAt first, four years ago, these two were close, but then Upbit kept on growing while Binance dropped a bit. In the last period Upbit, both Upbit and Binance have kept growing with some volatility in between. \n\nAs mentioned in the six months, especiay since the introduction of Hive features, there seems to be higher volatility and more coins moved between these two, as we can notice at the end of the chart. \n\nStill there is a big gap between these two, with close to 100M HIVE more on Upbit then Binance, a 145M to 46M. Upbit is a real risk for HIVE with the number of tokens there.\n\n\n## Top Accounts that Deposited to Exchanges in 2025\nThe last two months have seen some positive action. Here is the chart who deposited the most to exchanges. I have excluded exchanges to exchanges direct movements. \n\n\n \n\n![image017.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/EoCauXoDyZ1oJtn4qd1YfJh9HBzGZDLVzUhGVByQThYfY3GCnYgxq7X1ejEPCCpaFS9.png)\n\n\n\n\nThere seems to be new arbitrage accounts in the top, as some of the accounts move tokens around, just between different accounts and they show up here. This seems to be the case for the top three accounts. \n\n\n\n*Note that this is a net HIVE deposited to exchanges, with both, deposits and withdrawals taken into account.*\n\n\n## Top Accounts that Withdrawn from Exchanges in 2025\nWho has withdrawn the most funds from exchanges? Here is the chart.\n\n \n\n\n\n\n![image019.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tv8s5JEj71kP5Npp6vH5Sdrs7DVyGAw4JNeVQspHpY7ir9Ta5XeWZs2PhbCRRTeMDP7.png)\n\n\n\n\n\n\nOverall, from the above we can say that most of the accounts are some type of market makers that get into the list. Not a lot of regular community members that move large amounts around. \n\n\n\nAll the best\n@dalz",

        "body": "\n\nUSDC has been one of the stablecoins, (a dollar pegged tokens), that has tried to grow and build a reputation as the safest and the most legit out there. It wants to be a legitimate competitor to Tether USDT, but it is US based and in compliance with all the regulations, unlike Tether that is an offshore company and not subject to US regulations. \n\nBut even with all its regulation and compliance USDC had a real market test back in March 2023, when due to a bank failure it lost its peg for one weekend. Before this event, USDC was considered by most the safest stablecoin to park your dollars. In 2024 there seems to be some positive numbers again.\n\nLet’s take a look at the growth of USDC through some data.\n\n\n \n\n\n\n![01X.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23vrkWEv3Sncj8bYQyx71z9aiZVpEkTSQaEJyjdfXjddhkwCRmyyx6Y51LeJkgKmp55tw.png)\n\nUSDC is issued by Circle. It is a US-based company that is regulated and has regular audits on its holdings. \nHere we will be looking at:\n-\tDaily USDC printed\n-\tMonthly USDC printed\n-\tUSDC supply\n-\tNumber of daily users\n-\tUSDC chain allocation\n-\tUSDC VS USDT\n\nThe data is collected from tools like Coingecko and Dune analytics. \n\n## Daily USDC Printed\n\nUSDC started at the end of 2018, but here we have data from 2019, for simplicity, and because there is not much movement in 2018.\n\nHere is the chart for the USDC printed per day. \n\n\n\n![image005.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23t74yJBmSvwNXit4yn5SXukd9YPZMJohF93kqxv8UShFG6i5k7FKfcdTsVyE2m3WMNVy.png)\n\n\n\n\nAs we can see in the first years there was not a lot of printing for USDC. The larger amounts started to come in 2020 and increased significantly in 2021.\nAt times there was more than one billion USDC issued per day. \nWe can notice the sharp burns that happened in March – April 2023 when the deppeging event happened. \n2024 seems to be a mixed bag with a higher numbers in the first half and some lows in the second half and spike toward the end of the year. In 2025 we seem to have a moderate growth.\n\n## Monthly USDC Printed\n\nHere is the monthly chart for better visibility.\n \n\n\n\n![image007.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23t797uiVbaWRVKRyBTDfVKuCDgGZbLy22isN8YShH1ujDTpwE2dsmABvMypu4p1LWmEQ.png)\n\n\n\nWe can see that up to 2022, there was in general more USDC monthly printed, and then in 2022 the trend shifted with almost every month being in the negative.\nA massive negative bar in March 2023, when almost 10B USDC was taken out of circulation. This was during the deppeging event. \n\nWe can notice the spike at the end of the chart that is January 2025, where almost 10B more USDC was put in circulation. This month recorded the highest amount of new USDC printed. In the last two months we have smaller growth and even a dip back in May 2025, because of the overall market conditions. \n\n\n\n\n## USDC Supply\n\nThe chart for the USDC supply looks like this.\n\n\n\n\n![image001.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23t77B9uCtbVKChedhXwpbVBcGSngwupHAj46i3P81CV7mVhHENcN1gTSREFobfTKgi3r.png)\n\n\n\nWe can see that prior to 2020, the marketcap of USDC was negligible, with under 1B in supply. Then there was a huge increase in 2021 when almost 40B USDC added to the supply. \nThe peak for the USDC market cap was in June 2022, with around 55B in market cap. At this time Tether was experiencing FUD, and a lot of the stablecoins were transferred to USDC. \nSince the summer of 2022, the supply of USDC has went down, with a massive drop in March 2023 . In 2024 it increased again and spiked towards the end of the year and the beginning of 2025 reaching a new ATH of **61B** in market cap. \n\n**If we zoom in, we have this.**\n\n \n\n![image003.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tGVYdeW1XwxGdGdEJxXCV7pYiSMkCXMNmjy7d9Xc3ohGKomt1bgVJmQ9ZnE8PuvkzkS.png)\n\n\nThis is for the last two years, 2024 and 2025. We can see that there was a steady growth in the period, with most of it happening at the end of 2024 and the beginning of 2025. In the last months since March 2025 the supply of USDC has been stagnant with no growth. \n\n## USDC Allocation on Different Chains\n\nUSDC is centrally issued but can live on multiple chains. Here is the chart. \n\n\n \n\n![image009.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23uQNnf1da114YVT4mNhVBJtMsS75jHpuFRELkya5Uf116wrSCbfw1Pufgs3prozLkyHo.png)\n\n\nObviously, the big share of USDC remains on Ethereum with 68% share, but it was even higher in the past up to 80% at some point. We can notice that Solana is now on the second spot with USDC allocation of 12% of the USDC is there now. This growth happened at the end of 2024, but has been stagnant in the last period. Interesting Arbitrum is now close to 10%. Base comes on the fourth spot, while it was second a year ago.\n\n\n## USDC VS USDT\n\nHow is USDC doing against the number one stablecoin Tether? Tether was founded three years before USDC, so it has some head start. Is USDC managing to catch up?\n\nHere is the chart.\n\n \n\n\n![image011.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/Eo1vUVNwWxpSmriU5hrFuyb7JGUbqEewne6eGeQFvb29cikXoQLajDmTe9diZG53ME6.png)\n\n\nAt first these two were both growing on a similar pace in the bull market of 2020 and 2021. The in 2022 when the bear market kicked in the correlation between the two became almost negative, when one was growing, the other was falling. \nTether came out as the stronger from the bear market can consolidated its number one position even further. \nIn the last year both of these tokens have been growing again in marketcap but we can notice that Tether is clearly outperforming USDC, and especially in the last months, when USDC has been stagnata while Tether kept growing. \n\n\n\n**In relative terms % the chart looks like this**:\n \n\n\n\n\n![image013.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tRtHqZ48ArLVkDLxsLeaeYQBZdsVpQBPf6d8aAByJkYLikeUEFiTEyeH6vRHkmZS5Zz.png)\n\n\n\n\n\n\nThe USDC market share against Tether has been growing up until the summer of 2022, when it reached a 45% of the USDT and USDC marketcap (56B to 66B), and it was looking that at some point USDC will flip Tether, but then it lost momentum and started losing market share. It dropped to 20% at the end of 2023. \nIn 2024 the USDC market share was hovering slightly above the 20% and has gained momentum in the last month of the year reaching almost 30% share after a long period of time. In 2025 the growth against Tether stopped and it has been mostly stagnant with even a slight drop in the period back to under 30% share, close to 28%. \n\n\n\n\nAll the best\n@dalz\n",

    "body": "HBDStats now has Hive stats!\nSince my last [update](https://peakd.com/hive-133987/@dalz/hbdstatscom-update) back in April I have added more elements to the web. Let’s take a look!\n\n\nLet’s take a look.\n\n \n\n\n![01.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tkjcwb5gpPPGzrTAAMprujbR71EVRCdqpNxDSZ4X8CjsJQzwA3yWCZrRLCE44SsWvBf.png)\n\n\nhttps://www.hbdstats.com/\n\n\nFirst and foremost, there is now a new tab on the top with the HBD and HIVE options:\n\n \n![Picture1.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23tGTG7T3SbFU3WKphHB6Ui5CN3FyP5pHULD8nHCUKzAj2X8kx4p1LbjSvrGmfMaF3pfq.png)\n\n\n\n\nWhen you toggle on the HBD tab there are the options:\n- Debt\n- Savings\n- HBD Supply\n- DHF Supply\n- Cumulative\n- Interest\n\nMost of these were there before the update, except for the **interest** chart, that is now new.\n\n\n\n\n![InterestRate.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23swcKD6nVJMaHyw3vi7LnKBw8A1ZVMb9fpXtMRdXxPBMQFhZ5DKqQv2g1xARJLJmuWVE.png)\n\n\n\n\n \n\n\nHere we can see the historic move of the interest rate for HBD in savings. We can see that prior to 2021 there was no interest for HBD, then a series of few adjustments on the upside, up to 20% and then a drop to the current 15%.\n\nHaving historic HBD interest is a vital parameter that users holding HBD in savings should have in mind, and to note that this parameter is dynamic and has seen changes in the past, based on what then users can bring their conclusions about HBD allocation. \n\n\n## Hive Stats\n\n\nOn the totally new addition, the hive tab, currently we have this:\n- Hive Supply\n- Hive Power\n- Active Accounts\n- Transactions\n</br>\n\n\n The **Hive supply** is obviously a key parameter, as for any other blockchain. \n\n![HIveSupply.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23swbvyyvpefjMEB6MAhbcGjcQoBkYRTokvCQhLBwyCnrKoLoigxucTaXojaWx8P2ovLw.png)\n\n\n\n\n\nThe supply and the inflation rate are something that is closely monitored from the community, as it represents the debasement of the token holders, and when corelated to the staking rewards it gives users, info are they beating inflation with their earnings. On top of this there is info on the current supply data. As for the other chart, users can change the timeframe to 1Y and less. Additionally, as for the other charts, there is a download button for the token supply in CSV form, with daily data back from 2016 that anyone can use in their analysis. \n\nGoing forward I will add another chart with the inflation data represented in % units.\n\n**Next on the list is the Hive Power data:**\n\n\n \n\n![HivePower.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23swc1PT6dpsS2yxtCHUJ3KPPfUuRnZPdmmwMQcctwcDyKwjhz1T9EBUX6E3AHiKEGJhS.png)\n\n\n\n\nAnother key parameter is how much of the token supply is staked, or in this case powered up. Here we have an overview from the very beginning of the chain back in 2016. The option for choosing a different timeframe is here as well and the download button. \nAnother interesting parameter that can be added here is the share of the Hive Powered up, currently at 39%. A historic chart can be a good representation for this as well.\n\n#### Daily Active Accounts\nAnother key parameter, daily active accounts!\n \n\n![DAUs.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23swcKCogmCAcgey42wnhZCUNQJPXL7V9tqevXd82dGLJzigVhysRjP7X9nhmcXV9ULUu.png)\n\n\n\nHere as well we have a historical data going all the way back. Note that the number of active accounts is for all types of operations, and the massive spike back in 2021 is due to the explosion in the activity on Splinterlands. Going forward a breakdown of the active accounts by operation can be included, like account posting, voting, custom_json, transfers, etc. \n\n\n\n\n#### Number of Transactions per Day\nAnother key parameter, the activity on the chain, or the number of transactions per day. \n \n\n\n\n\n\n![Tx.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23swdzuaftB5zNiDmy2cgKYSuU8xHnEKRnsjoU7DGioRugh6BtHpjfehdZ9amGmz7ZTAt.png)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nThis chart as for the active accounts includes all types of operations made, the options for adding a further breakdown by type of operations can be implemented here as well. \n\n### Future Plans\nAs already pointed out, I do plan to add a few more charts, especially on the Hive side, including the inflation rate, share of Hive powered up, and breakdown of the activity and transactions by type of operation.\n\nOn the HBD side, there can be more aditions, like daily paid HBD interest, DHF payouts, top holders etc. \n\nAnother major addition I plan to add is data on the **Splinterlands** tokens, SPS and DEC. I do post now from time to time about the supply and inflation of these tokens, but getting data on the historical supply can be a challenge. There are APIs that Splinterlands provide for the current supply, from where I can make daily snapshots and create a timeseries. \n\n\n\n\n#### Support the Project\nThe web has a nice amount of data and charts now, from the early beginning, where there was only one chart. It is a full stack web, with a backend, its own database and APIs. While I do this for personal pleasure, growth and to upscale my skills, any appreciation is more than welcomed. It will for sure boost motivation and speed up the development :). I dont know exactly how many hours I have put in it till now, but it is a lot. For sure I do plan to put all the code on github, and the data is free to be downloaded even now, for every chart. \n\n\nI have integrated donation buttons in HBD, for anyone that finds the provided data useful. The transactions lead to keychain link with all the safety measures in place, first choose account, and then confirm the transaction. \n\n \n\n\n![Support.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/dalz/23swaANVxztCrADgi1Z3jdxR8dSQtJHmJ74sQDy2Kj39qNWgU1KDUfMiYgkqgYqfrX8nv.png)\n\n\n\n\nhttps://hbdstats.com/\n\n\n**If you have any additional proposals, feedback and addition you want to see in the web, let me know in the comments!**\n\nAll the best\n@dalz\n",

        "body": "I heard the sad news that we've lost one of the biggest characters in the music industry yesterday. \nOzzy Osbourne and I share(d) birthdays - 3rd December (he had a few birthdays before I started my run).\nHis music wove around my formative years - especially from my teens. I leaned toward the harder side of music, veering towards the chaos of Heavy Rock, rather than the 'trendy' side. I preferred leather and denim, t-shirts, boots and long hair - I still do, if truth be told. The short back-and-sides style of the 80s didn't appeal to me, and the music wasn't punchy enough.\n\nI remember the album Black Sabbath Greatest Hits for the cover as much as for the music. I looked at that cover time after time. It's so complex and filled with tableaus of such horrifying torture that I couldn't help but be fascinated. Studying the cover whilst listening to the music is one of my enduring memories of music and those times.\n\nFront\n![black sabbath greatest hits fried egg 1560.jpg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmPu8pv9EqS2oohxs8N7g7GC78mea85z96pJfxQvUteg8j/black%20sabbath%20greatest%20hits%20fried%20egg%201560.jpg)\n*Google search*\n\nBack\n![back black sabbath greatest hits fried egg 1561.jpg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmPCopcx9KCVAd6WSks7S7zb5CMLtbw1saq4Rz6iAgt4Vp/back%20black%20sabbath%20greatest%20hits%20fried%20egg%201561.jpg)\n*Google search*\n   \nThe album image is by Pieter Bruegel the Elder. Completed in 1562, the images of skeletal figures - human and animal - wreaking chaos and terror upon the living sums up perfectly the artists depictions of his ideas of the inevitability of death.\n\nThe album captured my attention as much in the visual as in the audial. If I'm in the mood, I'll listen to nothing but Black Sabbath and Ozzy all day.\n\nI went to see Ozzy just after he'd shaved his trademark long hair. It's only in the last few years that I heard the reason why he shaved his head. He did it because he was suffering burn-out and didn't want to go out on stage. \nI remember he came onto the stage and someone threw a long black wig to him. He caught it and made jokes. Someone else threw a toy bat, but I think he'd learned his lesson and he didn't bite its head off that time.\n\nEvery time I've been to see Ozzy, he stood out as a great showman. He knew exactly how to entertain his audience.\nAt Monsters of Rock in 1996, he supported the headliners KISS and in my opinion, he was the better act. \nI also went to see the Reunion Tour in 1997 - the day after our birthday, for my birthday. Fear Factory supported Sabbath and Ozzy was as much the showman as he ever was!\n\nThe last time I went to see Ozzy and Black Sabbath was in 2013 at Sheffield arena. \n\nI remember hearing him on the radio a few years ago. He phoned a DJ on Radio 1 and was chatting away. The DJ reminded Ozzy that they were Live and he must not use profanity. At the time, Ozzy and his family were all over the television with The Osbournes - the 'fly on the wall' show. Ozzy shared a story about his dogs getting into a cupboard in the kitchen, finding the 'chip fat' (the french fries oil), eating it all and vomiting all over the place. Ozzy was exceptionally well behaved and didn't swear.\nThe DJ asked what Ozzy was doing for Christmas. \nOzzy sounded quite laid-back and he said he was chilling in the UK for a few days and then he was flying back to the US in time for Christmas.\nThe DJ said, \"Ozzy, it's Christmas Eve.\"\n\"Oh Fuckit!\" Ozzy was heard on live radio...\n\nHe was one of a kind, a magician in the music industry, performing for millions of fans. His legacy of music will live on.\n\n![81vWpAwEluL._SY466_.jpg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmc8C3vMKD5jSxDEvUXzDvx9k2EAoA8CYLrikCPkAtuA5D/81vWpAwEluL._SY466_.jpg)\n\n[Link](https://www.amazon.com/I-Am-Ozzy-Osbourne/dp/0446569909)\n\nRest In Peace Ozzy",

        "body": "I think I have a title for my book. I suppose you can see there's a theme if you've come into contact with my work before.\nIf all this is new to you, stick around, I'm writing up a storm at the moment and I'm happy to share the process.\n[First post](https://hive.blog/hive-124999/@michelle.gent/remember-ash-and-the-favour-man)\n\n![Ash Favourman.jpg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmWebhSSCYdemvpe71hojxEi8yDTexvu1p1WTy15ijcWdo/Ash%20Favourman.jpg)\n\nAgain, Ash finds herself embroiled in a world of trouble - this time, she has backup that she can rely upon.\n\nI wrote a scene involving Ash and a bad guy that seemed to want to keep himself out of my spotlight, but I'm delighted to say I found him and I can now write a story around him.\n\nAsh and I have found a few other bad guys to deal with too and I'm concentrating on rounding-out their characters so the Readers can make up their own minds about them.\n\nThis story has been difficult to wrap my head around because of the complexities of drawing in the Readers, making Ash a believable and likeable character (although I doubt if she would care if you like her or not, the sassy bleeder!) and the situations in which she lands. When it all starts coming together, as it is now, it's so gratifying. I am around 30,000 words in to this story, with a little more than that left to go.\n\nI'll leave you with a snippet of Ash's life.\n\n---\n\nJustin pinched the bridge of his nose. His eyebrows raised and to Ash, he looked suddenly tired. “Go on,” he said. “Explain it to me like I’m five years old.”\nAsh shifted in her seat and was about to start talking when she heard something outside. She sat upright in her chair. “You expecting someone?” she said. \nJustin shook his head ‘no’ and listened too. \nA shadow passed the side window where Justin used to sit. A split second later, a figure followed the shadow and passed the window. \nAsh grinned and gave a little chuckle of relief. “Rob’s back!’ she said. \n“Deflection again,” Justin muttered. \nShe scowled at him. “I may as well tell this once,” she said and waited for Rob to walk in through the door.\n“Go on then, tell us both your good news and then you can tell me why you’ve shaved your head again,” Justin said, his voice as stern as it got with Ash. \n“Why the fuck have you got a gremlin in your living room, Justin?” Rob said as he approached the table. He pulled out the chair next to Justin, placed a mug of tea on the table and tuned his attention to Ash. “You’re a fucking ugly looking lad, I’ll give you that.”\n“I’m not,” Ash said. “If I was an ugly looking lad, I wouldn’t have had the job offer I just got, would I?’\nJustin placed his sandwich on his plate. “What job offer? Who offered you a job, doing what? Where, when and what does it entail?”\n“Calm down, it’s only a bit dodgy. I have protection, and it’s really good money,” Ash said. She sat down opposite Justin. She placed her hands on the table, fingers splayed out, thumbs almost touching. Her fingernails were bitten down and she realised they’d see, and they’d understand that she was a bit more anxious than she pretended to be.\nJustin said nothing. He stared at Ash unflinchingly and Rob looked from one to the other, with growing concern.\n“Explain the ‘only a bit dodgy’ part to me, would you?” Justin said in a voice so calm it made Rob worry.\n“Don’t go all Police Officer interrogation on me, I know what I’m doing and it’s not as risky as some of the stuff you know I’ve pulled and got away with,” Ash said, leaning back in her chair, feigning nonchalance. She folded her arms and met Justin’s gaze.\n“Is that supposed to make me feel better?” Justin said. “It doesn’t make me feel better.”\n“OK, maybe I should have mentioned this before I agreed to it, but I didn’t see the harm. Mr Fitz-Stanley…”\n\nAnd with that tempting little tid-bit, I'll leave you to figure out if you like what you've read, if you would read on - and more importantly, would you read the previous book, Ash and the Favour Man?\n\nComments, criticism, critique, advice and questions all welcome.\n\n[YouTube link](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j73hpf4ugVc)",

        "beneficiaries": [],
        "body": "Yes, it's time the ducks got a bigger home. They have out-grown their box which seemed way too big for them when they were first put in there. \nAs their homes are all temporary at the moment, at least until they can go into their (yet to be made) new, outside home, it makes little difference if their new accommodation is a plastic storage box, a state-of-the-art designer duck house or, as in this case, a coffee table turned upside down with a pond liner to keep the little webbed-footed delights enclosed.\n\n![68ABC81E-AD86-4B20-961A-5FCE16698E59.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmbp3iGrge1v55F8QEVhYvmNe4h9T8RYTxCPtLCSpxsvyt/68ABC81E-AD86-4B20-961A-5FCE16698E59.jpeg)\n*The first home*\n*The chicks had this as their home to begin with, and ducklings took up residence a week later*\n\nThe first place they moved to was a series of plastic greenhouse frames to extend the height of a storage box we had.\n\nThat worked for a while, but it couldn't last, they grow so fast!\n\n\n![0C667A9D-2849-445C-A830-398C585C86BD_4_5005_c.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmX4bF9o9K4HTsoxjgVYVeraGJSHe6w7WCTtN6uq485rgo/0C667A9D-2849-445C-A830-398C585C86BD_4_5005_c.jpeg)\n*Just keep swimming!*\n\nTheir next home was a taller box and it has worked well for a good few weeks. They are now cramped because, as I said, they grow really fast! They were smaller than the chicks to begin with - the chicks hatched a week before the first of the ducklings.\n\nSo we built a new enclosure - and I hope this will keep them happy until they can regulate their temperature. They need to grow feathers to be able to live outside. At the moment, the chicks and ducklings are reliant on a heat source. When their feathers come in, they will be able to regulate their temperature themselves and that's when we will need Cluckingham Palace and The Quack House.\n\n\n\n![E9CAA5EC-7901-4544-9972-12BB6B89EC77.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmbk99fXeQhAGzD416uXxx6hWzgLcff66qLAK514GPbY2R/E9CAA5EC-7901-4544-9972-12BB6B89EC77.jpeg)\n*Adventurous little ducker*\n\n\n![C4D9102A-C49F-4587-8539-F1B05D7F5CF8.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQma7uKWM1au8E5vjkXYxP6uVHPSsjmzwkTVF3BkcgYKz8e/C4D9102A-C49F-4587-8539-F1B05D7F5CF8.jpeg)\n*They needed a step to their water at first. Now, I have to use different water containers because they tip the container over and complain about it being wet in their home!*\n\n![97FDA65F-6059-47D0-8056-0D3E454F3D6A.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmdfH7iRbeYDKSGLpxBsTrpazwDQKqUKWQ7akrDrSfNBgo/97FDA65F-6059-47D0-8056-0D3E454F3D6A.jpeg)\n*A bit bigger than they were!*\n\n\n![E3122C65-A95F-4306-AB4B-41A638F994AE.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmV8yQhCjw9PrcXqQdfH9CMzArm19aMzGf1jRL8seaXtPj/E3122C65-A95F-4306-AB4B-41A638F994AE.jpeg)\n*This is where the phrase 'Mucky Duck' came from - maybe*\n\n![594927C3-7A15-4F8A-B35B-A278A161F76E.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmdQWQ97BzxLijdJdYwDmeNhywEVyaWpyoP86LMhiwwhVe/594927C3-7A15-4F8A-B35B-A278A161F76E.jpeg)\n*They are a lot bigger now!*\n\n![A9E5F16C-7350-4E6E-ABE4-5540CBFFF2D1.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmV2RV9QdBkpF9FXg9CnB5ViE9MSVWYeXcgfcbit8KAMxC/A9E5F16C-7350-4E6E-ABE4-5540CBFFF2D1.jpeg)\n*No names for them yet, but I am toying with 'Cover', 'Roll', 'Dive', 'Weave' and 'Vanish'. Can you guess why?*\n\n![6F2ED563-2362-41CF-88F2-538FCDD63726.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmTvM93Zaj9hUiEfGXt4g6TPAAxpUWtEmhxSANRJmVKsyz/6F2ED563-2362-41CF-88F2-538FCDD63726.jpeg)\n*One coffee table*\n\n![7CC836B8-5647-47DF-BDC7-0269961C606A.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmVAQ6diWkhmquq7NnsUdcMm1fJsC53M86UT3fjVzmnb9j/7CC836B8-5647-47DF-BDC7-0269961C606A.jpeg)\n*Add a pond liner and a few more water containers and the ducks have a new home!",

        "beneficiaries": [],
        "body": "So yesterday, I wrote a post on our homestead... wait - what day is it? \nOh, so the post was *5 days ago!*\nThat can't be right!\n\n![1F230CEE-7A43-4F05-A7B3-6C777FD278BE.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmQQz182PU5king3XcDkFd6ByEdKJD1KgX1dGyuvh1LJPS/1F230CEE-7A43-4F05-A7B3-6C777FD278BE.jpeg)\n*Candled egg - the process of shining a light through the shell to see if the egg is viable*\n\nWell, I guess I have a lot to tell you then!\n\nThe ducklings are growing daily. Today we realised they are too big for their home and we now have to make a new one for them. They're not big enough to go outside yet - actually, the reason is that they can't regulate their temperature yet because their feathers are still coming in, but it won't be too long now.\n\n![E46562C7-A7B3-4AC5-9538-42F7AD05AEE4.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmdkCT17wyd5eX1bwHoHA9Wb8pz1VeftCVPpiyYyTCVPK4/E46562C7-A7B3-4AC5-9538-42F7AD05AEE4.jpeg)\n*Just hatched*\n\n![4BFADED8-2B3E-4562-8146-730750E004F9.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmaTNLpRqDPm37McbWtc4PSPHpwYG5jhGyGE2iu4jmCZ7z/4BFADED8-2B3E-4562-8146-730750E004F9.jpeg)\n*Newborn ducklings*\n\nThe chicks, though they are growing, are not growing as fast as the ducklings and they can't go outside either - for the same reasons as the ducklings.\n\n\n![68ABC81E-AD86-4B20-961A-5FCE16698E59.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmbp3iGrge1v55F8QEVhYvmNe4h9T8RYTxCPtLCSpxsvyt/68ABC81E-AD86-4B20-961A-5FCE16698E59.jpeg)\n*Chicks*\n\nYesterday (ah, now I remember, that's where one of the days went) we went to our friends' house because the local sheep farmers were shearing their sheep. There's a great sense of community here, in rural France, the farmers ask to put their sheep on neighbours' land and the neighbours benefit from not having to cut the grass.\n\nSo, we went off, armed with a few builder's bags (heavy duty rubble sacks). We came away with 3 bags of fleece! Score!\nYes, I am mindful of the nursery rhyme 'Baa-Baa Black sheep, have you any wool?'\nWe came away with 3 bags full, *and* there's a black fleece in there as well!\n\nWe also came away with an old duck house, with heavy concrete food dishes that the ducks can't tip over!\n\nThen we were taken on a mini-tour and discovered the shed the previous owners had built is going to be taken down and do we want/need any of it as it will be scrapped otherwise?\n\nSo, in return for a day's work, we get a substantial outbuilding, including metal bars for supports (that's why it's lasted 20+ years), hefty planks and roofing sheets!\n\nWe're going to make a date to fetch the shed/outbuilding and make it into another duck/chicken/goose house!\n\nUp in the old barn, there are also a few doors and things that we can utilise - which are ours if we want them! Our friends are of the same mind as us, re-use, re-cycle and renovate as much as we can - not just to save money, but to keep useful things out of the landfill.\n\n So, what are we going to do with the fleeces? \n\nI hope to spin some of the better quality wool and use the rest in my garden - apparently it's great for mulch, slug and pest control and keeping down the weeds. \n\nI can't wait to get started on all these projects, but for now, I have a flock of ducklings that need a bigger home!\n\n\n![96418185-9E5C-408D-B895-D98383EAEEBE.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmZUxWsPsPqS9Wk6EqXxZzBt4gC17f61N35pLmbbn4Vtce/96418185-9E5C-408D-B895-D98383EAEEBE.jpeg)\n*Mum! It's a bit cramped in here!*",

        "author": "michelle.gent",
        "author_reputation": 390430496503313,
        "beneficiaries": [],
        "body": "We're living the dream! \n\nWe live in France, in a nice house with more rooms than we need for most of the year, but on occasion, those rooms are filled with visiting friends and family.\nOur property comprises 28 acres (11 hectares). Half of the land is grassland for the horses and garden and half woodland - which provides us with fuel for winter and posts etc for fencing.\n\nWe have a growing collection of animals - 1 Belgian Malinois, 5 horses (the reason for our move), 2 cats (non-specific breed), 2 chickens, 1 rooster, a 'bantle' of fish and lately, we have new arrivals - 4 chicks and 5 ducks which hatched in our incubators.\n\n![IMG_4935.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmQiedYj9s27g35sNHu7M75VpCPpzhbiJMsHLQVwLKpLMW/IMG_4935.jpeg)\n*Tora*\n\n\n![IMG_4244.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmder9svfwNTY8yUgHXoQabkBTfAZKgG3s22C2QgxK2bNV/IMG_4244.jpeg)\n*Story (background) and Nimbus*\n\n\n\n![IMG_5113.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmYkstgDGy5tSoLS5GdJUqNxpG7kjYuMCAprX13fPxUV9c/IMG_5113.jpeg)\n*Lewis*\n\n![IMG_5103.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmQrozwKLjPHzS23yLXbrBik3yjpvMJWqqZAN9hGpNpfAQ/IMG_5103.jpeg)\n*Goran being goofy*\n\n![IMG_5074.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmX3dmLWy3DR4zqvth8Rzds5fBpPfARZXMNamMERa822U5/IMG_5074.jpeg)\n*Onyx*\n\n\n\n![IMG_5071.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmSKU7zGobULPBrzvNqMLttDkmcWk4xBhjBk7koVoivr8i/IMG_5071.jpeg)\n\n*Goran*\n\n![IMG_4953.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmcgdxYXhT8dxQNcC5LCkrM8BXx9n93Pt5CkP7XLeahjoh/IMG_4953.jpeg)\n*One missing*\n\n\n![IMG_5088.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmbmWyyqnufruViMNNJuicgx1dDDVarLeC5z7UnUCuGrcj/IMG_5088.jpeg)\n*Sunset*\n\n\nOur lives have changed from stressed to blissfully peaceful (if still busy as ever). \n\nMoving kit and caboodle from England to France has been an epic journey, filled with health issues and other stresses, but we are finally getting into our stride.\n\nWe had a new deck built early this year and we're enjoying the views from the vantage point of our 'Skydeck'. The vista is awe-inspiring.\n\n![IMG_4159.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmfUjUrdLVZ69SYfiC8PkSFQNRH4776Mft9FnMxMhc1fRY/IMG_4159.jpeg)\n*Before work started on the deck*\n\n![2025-04-07-16-08-37-341.png](https://images.hive.blog/DQmNvUGmEkYYFvmLxu4whxcMJKPjfa7KEc6JPXNN3cXBJ7q/2025-04-07-16-08-37-341.png)\n*Skydeck from the drone*\n\nWe seem to have got to a place where we're close to an 'even keel' kind of situation, where work and play is becoming more balanced and we're finally getting to grips with the language (me not so much, but @s0u1 is certainly getting there now).\n\nI'm adding a few pictures with descriptions to reintroduce the new life we've chosen.\n\nThanks for reading, more updates and pictures of the animals soon :)",

        "body": "A long, long time ago, I started writing a story on here. It was a cathartic exercise for me, one that created its own issues along the way. I wrote a semi-autobiographical tale about a young girl, caught in between abusive relationships and a potential threatening situation.\n\nI self-published that book, but took it down almost immediately. I printed a few and gave some out at Hive Fest. \n\nA few years passed and when I moved to France, I heard on the grapevine that certain people were worried about what I was writing and had made threats to sue me if I wrote about them.\n\nI can wait to tell those particular stories - defamation isn't something you can sue for after you die. So, to that end, some stories, using real names will just have to wait.\n\nHowever! Ash and the Favour Man was reprised. I sent the manuscript to a friend who runs a Publishing house and he liked what I'd written. He liked the story so much that not only did he publish Ash and the Favour Man, but he also entered the book into a competition.\n\nI spent six months working on publicity for the book and the competition and eventually, when the results were announced, I was over the moon to find I'd won!\n\nThe Peoples' Book Award for Fiction 2024 - otherwise known as The Frederick Forsyth Prize for Fiction.\n---\n\n![438101808_762010782691115_4801222910033586996_n.jpg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmcv7f8jFueMmzLDsYWKtvNGWQM7iECA6hopax4DthDHpx/438101808_762010782691115_4801222910033586996_n.jpg)\n\n\nThis morning, I sat down to write again.\n\nAsh II - Title undecided (but possibly Ash to Ashes) is on the way and I decided to do what I did the first time - share it on Hive.Blog.\n\n---\nJustin sat at the table reading the newspaper. A shadow passed the back window, and he looked up to see his adopted daughter, Ashleigh. He watched as she checked her surroundings before unlocking the back door. The checks included kicking the door to the outside toilet, to make sure there were no unwelcome callers to deal with.\nJustin smiled and looked down at his newspaper as though he hadn’t noticed.\nAshleigh entered the house through the back door, and he heard her click on the kettle.\n“Ash?” Justin called. “That you?”\nShe popped her head through the door into the small but functional living room. “You know it’s me, I saw you looking,” she said.\nJustin grinned. “That’s my girl,” he said to himself.\n“What did you say?” Ash called from the kitchen. “I can’t hear you over the kettle.”\n“Nothing,” he called back, loud enough for her to hear over the noise she created as she made his lunch.\nShe finally made it into the living room and placed a small plate of sandwiches and a mug of water on the table before him. She pushed her hood back off her head and stood behind the other chair at the table, opposite Justin.\n“Thanks, Kid,” he said. He looked up at her at last. His sandwich forgotten, halfway to his mouth, he sat up in his chair. “Bloody Hell, Kid! What happened to your hair?”\nAsh rubbed her hand over her scalp and smiled. “I like the sound it makes, listen,” she said.\n“Deflecting? Justin said in a stern voice.\nAsh nodded. “I’ll answer your question if you take your meds,” she said, handing him a couple of pills.\n“Just happened to have them to hand, did you?” \n“Yeah, you know,” she said. “I figured you’d ‘forget’ to take them if I didn’t remind you.”\nHe popped the pills into his mouth and lifted the mug using both hands. She nodded as he controlled the slight tremor in his hands and didn’t spill the water. He gulped at the water and struggled not to cough. Ash moved forward to help. He stopped drinking and glared at her over the lip of the mug. She backed off and stood up straight. “Ok,” she said. “I was only going to help if it looked like you were drowning.”\nJustin placed the mug on the table and stretched his neck to help the tablets go down. He swallowed again. \nOnce he was comfortable, he leaned back in his chair and sighed. “What did you do with your hair, and why?”\nAsh placed one finger to her lips and winked. “I’m in disguise,” she said.\nJustin closed his eyes in a slow blink. The kind of blink a cat will make when sitting in its favourite place, warm, safe and cozy, but Justin’s slow blink conveyed everything opposite to a contented, relaxed cat. Ash’s smile wavered and disappeared.\nWhen Justin opened his eyes, her expression had changed from cocky to contrite.\n“What did you do,” he said. “And how many favours am I going to have to call in?’\nAsh grinned. “None,” she said, her face brightening in a grin. “None of your favours, I have my own stash.\nJustin’s expression went from weary to stern again. “You don’t use your favour stash on frivolities,” he said. “The longer you can keep them, the more valuable they become.”\n“I know that,” she said. She pulled out the chair and sat down at the table. “I didn’t use any of my favours. In fact, I actually gained a few.”\nJustin pinched the bridge of his nose. His eyebrows raised and he looked suddenly tired to Ash.\n“Go on,” he said. “Explain it to me like I’m five years old.”\nAsh shifted in her seat and was about to start talking when she heard something outside. She sat upright in her chair. “You expecting someone?” she said.\nJustin shook his head ‘no’ and listened too.\nA shadow passed the side window where Justin used to sit. A split second later, a figure followed the shadow and passed the window. Ash grinned and gave a little chuckle of relief. “Rob’s back!’ she said.\n“Deflection again,” Justin muttered.\nShe scowled at him. “I may as well tell this once,” she said and waited for Rob to walk in through the door.",
