        "beneficiaries": [],
        "body": "It seems like every day is good news week right now - and believe me, that's such an improvement on the previous few years.\n\nThis morning at 04:30 (yes, four-thirty in the morning, before the sun had even made an effort to get up and put on its hat) our household woke up, got up and got on the road.\n\nWe were taking our daughter @danielles, her husband @greg-shackleford and their friends to the airport for their journey home. They've been house/horse/dog/chicken-sitting for us while we visited the UK for a wedding.\n\nWhen we got home, we went back to bed and I'm not convinced it was a good idea, to be honest. I've been sluggish all day since we re-got up (is that a thing?)\n\nI've been neglecting the horses lately (not neglecting them per-se, but I've not been giving them the time they deserve). I decided to take Onyx into the stable and groom his winter coat off.\n\nHe's not used to the attention and would not stand still. He's not a bad-tempered horse and I'm never afraid he'll kick or bite. He does lift his head so I can't reach his ears (although he stopped doing that when I countered his efforts with brushing his neck) and he really does enjoy a good butt-scratch. \n\nAll-in-all, we got everything done. The mud and dust is mostly out of his coat, although I couldn't brush his feet as the grass and ground is sodden, those feet aren't going to be brushed until the mud has dried.\n\nWhen we'd finished his grooming, I led him out of the stable, into the driveway and we took a few photos.\n\nHere they are:\n\n![IMG_2601.JPG](https://images.hive.blog/DQmainsDyteWSgMRJV3Mwx9ynKaE7dbxicMWh9p5zoFdmab/IMG_2601.JPG)\n*Onyx - not behaving like a perfect show-pony*\n\n![IMG_2616.JPG](https://images.hive.blog/DQmaBh7hszow19yXc4JeBCU6woFpx2dzbBARHZ1ZpBxBTEQ/IMG_2616.JPG)\n*The road outside our house is really narrow - it's a good thing the traffic is scant*\n\n\n![IMG_2618.JPG](https://images.hive.blog/DQmXApPrQnVBUAM7TfqtWXCrHFG8cX4zt16hGqRn1LC4tim/IMG_2618.JPG)\n*I let him loose in the field we're cutting for hay when the weather improves*\n\n\n![IMG_2628.JPG](https://images.hive.blog/DQmPDrdWwGHsDfXAasGQRMduWghjj6RzcQw4iT6JNnYXHjy/IMG_2628.JPG)\n\n![IMG_2630.JPG](https://images.hive.blog/DQmPmr6oSpt2VueXSByCz4TS5KsZWYrAtMhwpj1cw2xEzGB/IMG_2630.JPG)\n\n![IMG_2633.JPG](https://images.hive.blog/DQmdV6Z129q9sukK5D4YkjSWzVXMwNNx97zeyPYsWxccLTR/IMG_2633.JPG)\n\n![IMG_2635.JPG](https://images.hive.blog/DQmQSut4VYVbZRbPQzXPzXM1AZoYkEuEw3aZZmbxshnJvJz/IMG_2635.JPG)\n*Tora - Belgian Malinois*\n\nhttps://www.youtube.com/shorts/J3jL2qrGeU8\n\nhttps://www.youtube.com/shorts/HolO60qFAX4",

        "body": "![IMG_2361.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmQWrggWaCih9zteryBBXZoGPjyV9PayvfrnTBeNPofawF/IMG_2361.jpeg)\n\nWe live in a very different environment to what we’ve been used to. We lived semi-rurally, in a suburban type of setting. Lots of space, large gardens, nice houses (horrible neighbours sometimes). I had access to fields for my ponies, but they were a drive away, rather than a short walk (or even a long walk).\n\nThen we packed up our whole lives, lifestyle, kit and caboodle and moved to another country.\n\nWhat we believed to be semi-rural where we were before, would be considered almost city-living here! The difference is vast!\n\nThe short walk to my ponies is even shorter than going to the bottom of my garden at the old house. I could hop to the stables if I needed to.\n\n\n![IMG_2264.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmQrSrKBoihFk3SbpbgdzWeQTj7AvQ8bspomRcM87aYaHK/IMG_2264.jpeg)\n\n\nThe neighbours are pleasant and keep themselves to themselves mostly. They all wave and say ‘Bonjour!’ but that is it. There are no curtain-twitchers to be found – well, even if there were, the neighbours are so far away, they can’t see my house through their windows.\n\nThe garden is a huge contrast to what we had before. We were lucky, our house was an older-style, and the garden space was generous. It’s a handkerchief compared to the garden we have now! I have a third of an acre just for growing vegetables.\n\n\n![IMG_2496.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmVFR3h4VUHkWTngAzc7W6aNjKvNwmUNMTojk4fGZ3foXk/IMG_2496.jpeg)\n\n![IMG_2331.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmZZv8fPSDQWcJb4MZMdshnNVqcSFMBRudB4fUfyyWf6kX/IMG_2331.jpeg)\n\n\n![IMG_2083.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmeJQSiTtLnWKdj4J8jS9MQtetnkYn5LPa2gxEi9mAVQFd/IMG_2083.jpeg)\n\n\nThe house was a holiday-home, and it was kept so well, we were really fortunate to find this property. We’ve slowly started to arrange things how we like them – it’s taken 2 years so far and we’re nowhere near to completion on the decorating.\n\nWe’re trying to become self-sufficient as much as possible, hence the third of an acre of veg plot.\n\nWe also have to source our own wood for the winter and that is a year-round job. We have grassland for the horses, and also woodlands so we really can be quite self-sufficient.\n\nOver the winter, we use quite a lot of wood on the log-burning stove, so cutting down (dead) trees, logging, splitting the logs and storing them takes a lot of space, time, energy etc.\n\nThat’s where this post takes us.\n\nToday’s jobs that I set for myself were to move the remaining split logs into the shed, stack them neatly and use them first. Then I wanted to clear the cut logs from the side of the drive and tidy the space up a bit.\n\nHere goes:\n\nHow it started: \n\nJob 1 - to take the split logs inside and store them neatly.\n\n![IMG_2511.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmZdUJsLLH71HF51MoXVjewMrnzCeMM4Fk3Kcsq9oXWEQt/IMG_2511.jpeg)\n\n\n![IMG_2512.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmPr4Th9QB6ruZXx55K1wVq9MXBznS3ooNgPkKJQYCFYRG/IMG_2512.jpeg)\n\n\n![IMG_2513.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmWu1Ck75fHbqMW4KmEgn2fu1NSb2QPPfQ4XxcKRZR3hGB/IMG_2513.jpeg)\n\n\n![IMG_2514.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmS1w1JsHdzVu7bBn6igEnrzV2feGB65JusTczDDqpuLES/IMG_2514.jpeg)\n*Tora, my Belgian Malinois is looking for mice and the chickens came to have a look too*\n\n![IMG_2517.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmbKFgK3mDBQUR6z4po5AU2S22GDHkhrMyh1wJzvw9Vyx4/IMG_2517.jpeg)\n\n\n![IMG_2518.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmXewLtzQu6DNhSVk1rUQJxf6saiKMksbcLfhzt8RbcDdk/IMG_2518.jpeg)\n*There doesn't seem so much wood when it's stacked like this!*\n\nJob 2 to clear the cut logs, stack them and tidy the space.\n\n\n![4C8202B0-328A-4ADC-9D05-DD3662B80B71.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmPuLGjidfpKz25pYQdnRipCzLgbUdVYXxNSZYThS1y2XU/4C8202B0-328A-4ADC-9D05-DD3662B80B71.jpeg)\n\n\n![IMG_2523.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmcxNDcoxmWJgKuz1U5KhfmviYFSxiTsiKtZoHBC5r6Suq/IMG_2523.jpeg)\n\n\n![IMG_2524.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmS1ubj9SsDvZ1v2i9p3UMbGw7gqgjkSAopkLt4sozFTxh/IMG_2524.jpeg)\n\n\n![IMG_2525.jpeg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmeeTJmojDBSNygs66dHkH5rXb6Lxm2cCzkhzEFEFeVPUR/IMG_2525.jpeg)\n*Doesn't that look better!*\n\nStacked the logs and raked the front of the log stacks. All I have to do is let them settle for a bit and cover the stacks before it rains again.\n\nSmug-mode engaged!",

        "body": "Hi again, I've just dropped in to share some amazing news. \n\n![Ash.jpg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmXY2DAp6xmmwa9vSk5qEvoaiJsQ2T6cDSr4AF97R9287V/Ash.jpg)\n\n\nI wrote a story, serialised here, on Hive.blog, called Ash and the Favour Man. It was started as an experiment of sorts, I wrote a writing prompt and went on to fulfil the prompt with a story about a young girl in an abusive situation. Some of my own past came crawling out of the dark recesses of my memory and soon it was a fully-fledged story.\n\n[Amazon link](https://www.amazon.com/Ash-favour-Man-Michelle-Gent-ebook/dp/B0CKC5XNHJ)\n\nLast year, I spoke to one of my friends in the publishing industry and he encouraged me to re-start my writing. I told him about Ash and the Favour Man and he asked me to send the manuscript to him.\n\nA few days later, he told me his company was going to publish my book. I was over the moon at the news, of course. He then dropped a bombshell. Not only was his company publishing the book, he'd also entered it into a competition.\n\n[Book Prize](https://peoplesbookprize.com/)\n[Announcement of winners](https://peoplesbookprize.com/2023-2024-winners/)\n\nThe last date for voting was 30th April.\nOn 2nd May this year, I found out Ash and the Favour Man had won.\n\nI can now say I'm an award-winning author and you know what? It's ALL down to Hive.blog.\nIf I hadn't joined, I wouldn't have done anywhere near as much writing as I have.\n\nAll I have to do now, is get back to it.",

    "body": "I heard the sad news that we've lost one of the biggest characters in the music industry yesterday. \nOzzy Osbourne and I share(d) birthdays - 3rd December (he had a few birthdays before I started my run).\nHis music wove around my formative years - especially from my teens. I leaned toward the harder side of music, veering towards the chaos of Heavy Rock, rather than the 'trendy' side. I preferred leather and denim, t-shirts, boots and long hair - I still do, if truth be told. The short back-and-sides style of the 80s didn't appeal to me, and the music wasn't punchy enough.\n\nI remember the album Black Sabbath Greatest Hits for the cover as much as for the music. I looked at that cover time after time. It's so complex and filled with tableaus of such horrifying torture that I couldn't help but be fascinated. Studying the cover whilst listening to the music is one of my enduring memories of music and those times.\n\nFront\n![black sabbath greatest hits fried egg 1560.jpg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmPu8pv9EqS2oohxs8N7g7GC78mea85z96pJfxQvUteg8j/black%20sabbath%20greatest%20hits%20fried%20egg%201560.jpg)\n*Google search*\n\nBack\n![back black sabbath greatest hits fried egg 1561.jpg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmPCopcx9KCVAd6WSks7S7zb5CMLtbw1saq4Rz6iAgt4Vp/back%20black%20sabbath%20greatest%20hits%20fried%20egg%201561.jpg)\n*Google search*\n   \nThe album image is by Pieter Bruegel the Elder. Completed in 1562, the images of skeletal figures - human and animal - wreaking chaos and terror upon the living sums up perfectly the artists depictions of his ideas of the inevitability of death.\n\nThe album captured my attention as much in the visual as in the audial. If I'm in the mood, I'll listen to nothing but Black Sabbath and Ozzy all day.\n\nI went to see Ozzy just after he'd shaved his trademark long hair. It's only in the last few years that I heard the reason why he shaved his head. He did it because he was suffering burn-out and didn't want to go out on stage. \nI remember he came onto the stage and someone threw a long black wig to him. He caught it and made jokes. Someone else threw a toy bat, but I think he'd learned his lesson and he didn't bite its head off that time.\n\nEvery time I've been to see Ozzy, he stood out as a great showman. He knew exactly how to entertain his audience.\nAt Monsters of Rock in 1996, he supported the headliners KISS and in my opinion, he was the better act. \nI also went to see the Reunion Tour in 1997 - the day after our birthday, for my birthday. Fear Factory supported Sabbath and Ozzy was as much the showman as he ever was!\n\nThe last time I went to see Ozzy and Black Sabbath was in 2013 at Sheffield arena. \n\nI remember hearing him on the radio a few years ago. He phoned a DJ on Radio 1 and was chatting away. The DJ reminded Ozzy that they were Live and he must not use profanity. At the time, Ozzy and his family were all over the television with The Osbournes - the 'fly on the wall' show. Ozzy shared a story about his dogs getting into a cupboard in the kitchen, finding the 'chip fat' (the french fries oil), eating it all and vomiting all over the place. Ozzy was exceptionally well behaved and didn't swear.\nThe DJ asked what Ozzy was doing for Christmas. \nOzzy sounded quite laid-back and he said he was chilling in the UK for a few days and then he was flying back to the US in time for Christmas.\nThe DJ said, \"Ozzy, it's Christmas Eve.\"\n\"Oh Fuckit!\" Ozzy was heard on live radio...\n\nHe was one of a kind, a magician in the music industry, performing for millions of fans.         "body": "<center>\nhttps://images.hive.blog/DQmWdgBwutUJ3x1F3qaQkJWVgGeozx6eeSEoNBBXz1fWfAb/Sin%20t%C3%ADtulo.png</center>_\n<br>\n---\n\n\n  \n\n\n\n<br>\n<div class=text-justify>\nSaludos a la Comunidad Full Deportes de Hive, la Pasión por el Deporte nos une, y estamos aquí con ese objetivo: Para conversar, debatir, aprender y exponer el extenso mundo deportivo, desde la visión multidisciplinaria (múltiples deportes)  . Les cuento que el pasado sábado   26 de abril asistimos como periodistas acreditados (por la Federación Venezolana de Karting) a la II Válida del Campeonato Nacional de Karting en el Kartodromo Internacional “Carmencita Hernández” de Maracay, estado Aragua, Venezuela. \n</div>\n<br>\n\n<center>\nhttps://images.hive.blog/DQmebtBDy8vJmXaC8FpcEqj23CdeEdQKQJTCzg8s8tuy9aM/sport%201.png</center>\n\n<br>\n\n\n<center>\nhttps://images.hive.blog/DQmetm5yWFhXVxF3Utkvy1A74BG8JxDTZqtPcjsefvLobeQ/sport%202.png\n</center>\n<br>\n<div class=text-justify>\nAnte todo  debemos decirle que fue nuestra primera experiencia cubriendo una disciplina deportiva relacionada con el mundo de los motores, algo sumamente nuevo, los días previos a la jornada fueron de mucha expectativa, indagamos un poco sobre el Karting, diseñábamos en nuestra mente una especie de plan para cubrir la competencia (dicho plan no cumplimos jajaja, la dialéctica de una pauta periodística es así...) y nos aventuramos con la esperanza de vivir grandes emociones ( así fue... un mosaico de emociones).\n</div>\n<center>\nhttps://images.hive.blog/DQmTjbU7iCSx5oGa9hMHjWR63u61czTVEnEehxdgGbXqZJV/sport%203.png\n</center>\n<br>\n\n\n<div class=text-justify>\nEn ese sentido, a las 7:30 am de ese día partimos desde nuestro Pueblo Villa de Cura a la Ciudad Jardín  la capital Aragueña: Maracay, un viaje en autobús con nuestro bolso cargado de los elementos  básicos de un periodista: agenda,  bolígrafo, lápiz también, anteriormente usábamos grabadora pero con la inteligencia amplia... que nos ofrecen los teléfonos  celulares  podemos disfrutar de una variedad de herramientas en un solo aparato, por supuesto nos llevamos nuestra Cámara Profesional que nos acompaña desde hace 12 años, las fotos que acompaña a esta publicación fueron tomadas con ella. Cuando llegamos a la Kartodromo, nos invadió una inexplicable energía como de nostalgia y alegría que me nos hacia reflexionar brevemente sobre esta locura positiva que es el deporte con la dicha de vivir una pauta más. \n</div>\n<br><br><center> \nhttps://images.hive.blog/DQmXEA56g8NHzD3dNcQzkdTvyC6FnsKf7tuKExqt79wrrXc/sport%204.png</center>\n<br><br>\n </div>\n<div class=text-justify>\nNos presentamos con los colegas, recibimos nuestro pase que nos acreditaba  para cubrir y acceder a las áreas reglamentarias para cubrir la válida, conversamos un rato con David Rodriguez, Jefe de Prensa de la Federación, quien en cada instante nos ofrecía datos para entender mejor el desenvolvimiento de las carreras. Asimismo, este Campeonato Nacional se está realizando en diferentes circuitos de Venezuela , desde la Categoría Infantil hasta la Máster, por ejemplo uno de los corredores, Ricardo Montilla (Master) dijo presente con su hijo quien corrió en la categoría senior,  la jornada terminó puntualmente a  las 4:00 pm con la premiación al mejor estilo de la Formula 1; La dinámica de esta válida consistia en tres rondas  por categoría donde acumulan los puntos según la posición que alcanzaban en cada ronda y de esa manera se definía el ganador de esta válida. \n</div>\n<br><center>\nhttps://images.hive.blog/DQmUF9DmnHTEwi33mX6BxYHwpJEE7rwcq9F73bYkuZ7dpnR/sport%205.png\n </center><br>\n\n<div class=text-justify>\nEstos son vehículos que  corren a más  90 kilómetros por hora,  lo cuál genera mucha adrenalina para los pilotos y también para los espectadores, brevemente quiero decirles que el Karting nació en el sur de California en 1956, gracias al ingeniero  Art Ingels quien construyó el primer kart en el garaje de su casa, en ese momento utilizó tubos de acero para el chasis y un motor de cortacésped West Bend para la propulsión, este invento generó este deporte que es preámbulo para el automovilismo profesional, en el caso de Venezuela, la carreras de pilotos como Pastor Maldonado, Rodolfo Gonzalez o Ernesto Viso, no hubiesen sido lo mismo sin el karting , ya que de allí aprendieron  los fundamentos a la hora de conducir , experimentaron el roce internacional o siendo un trampolín para sus posteriores carreras. \n</div>\n\n<center>\nhttps://images.hive.blog/DQmQf32sJTPkJCDHVKBgXgioT6YVtL2Wpv3uWbmdzRQFEKu/sport%206.png</center>_\n<br>\n\n\n<div class=text-justify>\nSiguiendo con lo vivido ese día en la válida; observamos la gran responsabilidad de cada piloto, porque tal vez algunos pensarán que solamente es manejar a grandes velocidades y listo, también existe un preparación física previa, los vimos estirándose y nos comentaban que ellos alternan sus entrenamientos  con rutinas de gimnasio, cardio, levantamiento de Pesas, todo esto para generar resistencia, fuerza y estabilidad muscular, aspecto que marca la diferencia en la pista.  \n</div>\n\n<div class=text-justify>\nPor otra parte hablamos con Mariuska Morales, la única mujer compitiendo en esta oportunidad, una joven que corre en la categoría senior, quien  resaltó la dificultad del circuito y resaltó el talento de los demás pilotos, aunque también aseguró que no se deja amilanar por ser mujer “ Nunca te sientas mal ser mujer y hacer este deporte, porque todos somos iguales en una sola pista” Enfatizó la Piloto que sueña con llegar  F1 Academy ( La Formula 1 para mujeres) y aprovechó la ocasión para enviarle un mensaje a todas las mujeres amantes del automovilismo  “Que se animen, que no tengan miedo, puede ser riesgoso pero no sabemos lo que pueda pasar porque pueden ser muy grandes o exitosas en este deporte” enfatizó Morales.  \n</div>\n\n\n<div class=text-justify>\nFinalmente, queremos decirle que nuestro deseo es seguir asistiendo a este tipo de evento, esta experiencia nos dejó un fascinante sabor de boca y nos garantiza la curiosidad para seguir indagando sobre el karting, que tal vez no sea el deporte número uno en Venezuela, pero cuenta con un historial muy grande y hasta de muchos eventos internacionales organizados con total nivel, por cierto “Carmencita Hernández” quien es reconocida dirigente deportivo en Venezuela y Kartodromo de Maracay  nació y se crió  en el pueblo donde yo vivo: Villa de Cura... Quien sabe!, posiblemente podamos contactarla y entrevistarla para Hive y la Comunidad Full Deportes, todo es posible.  \n</div>\n\n\n<br>\n<center>\nhttps://images.hive.blog/DQmWBhMVCqxZuoHPmoPnHzr9AxcM7Hmu35FKjq7rKMcyP8J/sport%207.png</center>_\n\n\n<br>\n<center>https://images.ecency.com/DQmTfZEVnBfZkY5CkVe4YuZYNsDZkroeV82xxpyxgvVsm5o/separador.png</center> \n<br>\n\n\n\n<div class=text-justify>\nAgradecido de que me hayan acompañado con su lectura hasta acà, me despido hasta la próxima oportunidad.\n</div>\n<br> \n\n<center>https://images.ecency.com/DQmTfZEVnBfZkY5CkVe4YuZYNsDZkroeV82xxpyxgvVsm5o/separador.png</center> \n<br>\n\n\n<center> <b>English version</b></center> \n<br>\n<center>\nhttps://images.hive.blog/DQmWdgBwutUJ3x1F3qaQkJWVgGeozx6eeSEoNBBXz1fWfAb/Sin%20t%C3%ADtulo.png</center>_\n<br>\n<div class=text-justify>\nGreetings to the Full Sports Community of Hive. Our passion for sports unites us, and we're here with that goal in mind: to converse, debate, learn, and share the vast world of sports from a multidisciplinary perspective (multiple sports). Last Saturday, April 26th, we attended the 2nd Round of the National Karting Championship at the \"Carmencita Hernández\" International Karting Track in Maracay, Aragua State, Venezuela, as accredited journalists (by the Venezuelan Karting Federation). \n</div>\n<br>\n<center>\nhttps://images.hive.blog/DQmebtBDy8vJmXaC8FpcEqj23CdeEdQKQJTCzg8s8tuy9aM/sport%201.png</center>\n\n<br>\n\n\n<center>\nhttps://images.hive.blog/DQmetm5yWFhXVxF3Utkvy1A74BG8JxDTZqtPcjsefvLobeQ/sport%202.png\n</center>\n<br>\n<div class=text-justify>\nFirst of all we must tell you that it was our first experience covering a sporting discipline related to the world of motors, something extremely new, the days before the event were full of expectations, we investigated a little about Karting, we designed in our minds a kind of plan to cover the competition (we did not fulfill said plan hahaha, the dialectic of a journalistic guideline is like that...) and we ventured out with the hope of experiencing great emotions (and it was... a mosaic of emotions). \n\n</div>\n<br>\n<center>\nhttps://images.hive.blog/DQmTjbU7iCSx5oGa9hMHjWR63u61czTVEnEehxdgGbXqZJV/sport%203.png\n</center>\n<br>\n\n<div class=text-justify>\nIn that sense, at 7:30 am that day we left our town Villa de Cura to the Garden City the capital of Aragon: Maracay, a bus trip with our bag loaded with the basic elements of a journalist: agenda, pen, pencil too, previously we used a recorder but with the broad intelligence ... that cell phones offer us we can enjoy a variety of tools in a single device, of course we took our Professional Camera that has been with us for 12 years, the photos that accompany this publication were taken with it. When we arrived at the Kartodromo, we were invaded by an inexplicable energy like nostalgia and joy that made us reflect briefly on this positive madness that is the sport with the joy of living one more guideline. \n</div>\n\n<br><center> \nhttps://images.hive.blog/DQmXEA56g8NHzD3dNcQzkdTvyC6FnsKf7tuKExqt79wrrXc/sport%204.png\n</center><br>\n\n<div class=text-justify>\nWe introduced ourselves to our colleagues, received our passes that accredited us to cover and access the regulatory areas to cover the event, and we chatted for a while with David Rodriguez, Head of Press for the Federation, who constantly offered us information to better understand the progress of the races. Likewise, this National Championship is being held on different circuits in Venezuela, from the Children's to the Masters categories. For example, one of the racers, Ricardo Montilla (Master), was present with his son, who raced in the senior category. The day ended punctually at 4:00 pm with the awards ceremony in the style of Formula 1; the dynamics of this event consisted of three rounds per category where points were accumulated based on the position they achieved in each round, and in this way the winner of this event was defined.  \n</div>\n\n<br><center>  \nhttps://images.hive.blog/DQmUF9DmnHTEwi33mX6BxYHwpJEE7rwcq9F73bYkuZ7dpnR/sport%205.png\n </center>\n<br>\n<div class=text-justify>\nThese are vehicles that run at over 90 kilometers per hour, which generates a lot of adrenaline for the drivers and also for the spectators, briefly I want to tell you that Karting was born in Southern California in 1956, thanks to the engineer Art Ingels who built the first kart in the garage of his house, at that time he used steel tubes for the chassis and a West Bend lawnmower engine for propulsion, this invention generated this sport that is a preamble to professional motorsports, in the case of Venezuela, the careers of drivers like Pastor Maldonado, Rodolfo Gonzalez or Ernesto Viso, would not have been the same without karting, since there they learned the fundamentals when driving, they experienced the international rose or being a springboard for their subsequent careers. \n</div>\n<br>\n<br>\n<center>\nhttps://images.hive.blog/DQmQf32sJTPkJCDHVKBgXgioT6YVtL2Wpv3uWbmdzRQFEKu/sport%206.png\n</center>_\n<br>\n<br>\n<div class=text-justify>\nContinuing with what we experienced that day in the qualifying session, we observed the immense responsibility each driver takes. Some might think it's just about driving at high speeds and that's it. There's also a need for prior physical preparation. We saw them stretching, and they told us they alternate their workouts with gym routines, cardio, and weightlifting, all to build endurance, strength, and muscular stability, all of which makes a difference on the track. \n</div>\n\n<div class=text-justify>\nOn the other hand we spoke with Mariuska Morales, the only woman competing on this occasion, a young woman who runs in the senior category, who highlighted the difficulty of the circuit and highlighted the talent of the other drivers, although she also assured that she does not let herself be intimidated by being a woman \"Never feel bad about being a woman and doing this sport, because we are all equal on a single track\" emphasized the driver who dreams of reaching F1 Academy (Formula 1 for women) and took the opportunity to send a message to all women who love motorsports \"Go for it, don't be afraid, it can be risky but we don't know what can happen because you can be very big or successful in this sport\" emphasized Morales. \n</div>\n\n\n\n<div class=text-justify>\nFinally, we want to tell you that our desire is to continue attending this type of event, this experience left us with a fascinating taste in our mouths and guarantees us the curiosity to continue investigating about karting, which may not be the number one sport in Venezuela, but has a very long history and even many international events organized at a high level, by the way \"Carmencita Hernández\" who is a recognized sports leader in Venezuela and Kartodromo de Maracay was born and raised in the town where I live: Villa de Cura ... Who knows!, possibly we can contact her and interview her for Hive and the Full Sports Community, everything is possible. \n</div>\n<br>\n<br>\n<center>\nhttps://images.hive.blog/DQmWBhMVCqxZuoHPmoPnHzr9AxcM7Hmu35FKjq7rKMcyP8J/sport%207.png</center>_\n<br>\n<br>\n<br>\n<center>https://images.ecency.com/DQmTfZEVnBfZkY5CkVe4YuZYNsDZkroeV82xxpyxgvVsm5o/separador.png</center>         "body": "<center>\n![MINITHEHIDENCOSTOFFORGIVEN.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/manclar/23u64kLNkfqJV61qcFXGiSBeKjUWSdcAsoUxSiFGi7o9jRKUjMvxyRDhWEz5koVgJEdjm.png)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<div class=\"text-justify\">\n\n#\n\n<center><img src=\"https://images.hive.blog/0x0/https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/manclar/23tv8niTgDV9Nw5p2hSfnLTmaDqahUiDosHNzKbH4s77bUKPEFiUG1UZtmL4FmapuSSh8.jpg\"></center>\n<center><sub>*This is a bilingual publication, you can go directly to the SPANISH version by clicking [HERE](#Español\")*\n</sub><hr>This is my post for #freewriters 2810 prompt \"presidential pardon\" hosted by @mariannewest </center>\n<hr>\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSpeaking of a presidential pardon makes me imagine, at the very least, an uncomfortable situation. I put myself in the shoes of whoever has to make that decision.\n\n First of all, whoever is requesting it must have made a very serious mistake for a person to ask for a presidential pardon.  \n\nThe crime committed must have been treason against the country, stealing an impressive amount of money, and I also imagine it could involve someone who has likely embezzled large sums.\n\n Perhaps someone who revealed state secrets—this makes me think of many possibilities, including the fact that this person is an expert liar and probably a spy. \n\nThis individual may have worked for a long time in a consulate or been involved in government affairs, likely in an embassy, and knew many of the secrets discussed in that embassy or consulate.  \n\nFrom what I understand, based on my limited knowledge of the subject, consulates are responsible for facilitating trade alliances and operations between two countries. \n\nThe country that has a consulate in another nation—for example, Venezuela having a consulate in the United States—employs a consul (in this case, a Venezuelan) who is responsible for establishing trade relations between merchants, entrepreneurs, or industrialists from both countries.  \n\nThis is how alliances are formed, and I suppose that the person requesting this presidential pardon likely exploited some of the secrets they knew about these companies. \n\nI imagine they may have revealed information about secret contracts, undisclosed bids, and deals made to favor certain U.S. businessmen. And, as always, politics gets in the way.  \n\nSo, I believe the president and their advisors must carefully study who they grant a presidential pardon to. Obviously, there are many political influences at play here, because these kinds of pardons require the intervention of numerous mediators to make them happen. \n\nIn the case of the United States, I understand that governors can request a presidential pardon for someone.  \n\nThe president themselves can also decide to grant a presidential pardon. In Venezuela’s case, I recall this only happening with Hugo Chávez Frías, when former President Rafael Caldera granted him a presidential pardon or clemency for the crimes he committed in attempting to overthrow a government. He was given clemency, a presidential pardon, for that crime.  \n\nMany people comment that it was precisely because of this presidential pardon that the disaster leading to Venezuela’s current crisis unfolded. \n\nThe country is in turmoil because when this figure—and I say \"figure\" because he is not an important one in a positive sense, but rather an infamous one who led to the country’s destruction—was released from Venezuelan history. \n\nHad this person not been freed, they would have remained imprisoned or perhaps died in a dungeon, and the country might have taken a different, healthier path than the one we are living through now. \n\nPresidential pardons are a very delicate matter and must be handled with extreme caution.  \n\nSadly, political factors always interfere and influence who gets pardoned. I doubt that most of the pardons granted in different countries are legitimate or truly deserved. It is very difficult, really, to prove that someone deserves a presidential pardon.  \n\nThe person must have made amends in a very loyal and recognizable way to society for the harm they caused to deserve such a pardon. At least, that is what I think from my corner and my point of view.\n  \n\n\n\n\n\n<center>Translated with [Deepsek AI](https://deepseek.com) \n</p></center>\n\n# <center><div class=\"phishy\">Español<a id=\"Español\"></a></div></center>\n\n\nHablar de un indulto presidencial me hace imaginar una situación cuando menos incómoda. Me pongo en los zapatos de quien tiene que tomar esa decisión. \n\nPrimero que nada, quien lo esté solicitando debe haber cometido un error muy grave para que una persona solicite un indulto presidencial.  \n\nEl delito que debe haber cometido debe haber sido una traición a la patria, robar una cantidad impresionante de dinero, y también me imagino que se puede definir como alguien que probablemente ha robado mucho dinero. \n\nQuizás alguien que reveló secretos de estado y esto me hace pensar en muchas posibilidades, incluyendo el hecho de que esta persona es una especialista en mentir y probablemente esta persona es un espía. \n\nEsta persona ha trabajado por mucho tiempo para un consulado o involucrada en asuntos de gobierno, probablemente en una embajada y conocía muchos de los secretos de quienes hablaban en esa embajada o en ese consulado.  \n\nSegún he entendido, dentro del poco conocimiento que tengo del tema, que en los consulados se encargan de llevar a cabo alianzas y operaciones comerciales entre los dos países. \n\nEl país que es el representante, digamos, que tiene el consulado en otro país y el otro consulado, digamos que Venezuela tiene un consulado en Estados Unidos. \n\nEsta persona, este cónsul de Venezuela, que es venezolano, se encarga de establecer relaciones comerciales entre todos los comerciantes y todos los empresarios o industriales venezolanos y los industriales americanos.  \n\nDe esta manera, se crean alianzas y supongo que esta persona que está solicitando este indulto presidencial probablemente usó varios de los secretos que conocía sobre estas empresas. \n\nMe imagino que pudo haber revelado información sobre contratos secretos, de licitaciones secretas y tratos que se hicieron para favorecer a ciertos empresarios de Estados Unidos. \n\nY como siempre, la política está de por medio.  \n\nAsí que, creo que el presidente y las personas que lo rodean, que son los que lo hacen, tienen que estudiar muy bien a quién le van a dar este indulto presidencial. \n\nObviamente, aquí hay muchas influencias políticas de por medio, porque este tipo de indultos necesitan la intervención de muchas personas que median para que esto se pueda lograr. \n\nEntre ellos, hablando en el caso de Estados Unidos, entiendo que los gobernadores son los que pueden solicitar que a una persona se le dé un indulto presidencial.  \n\nY el mismo presidente puede decidir dar un indulto presidencial a esa persona. En el caso de Venezuela, creo que esto ocurrió que recuerdo solo con Hugo Chávez Frías, que el presidente, el expresidente Rafael Caldera, le dio un indulto presidencial o una indulgencia por los delitos que cometió de haber hecho o intentado el derrocamiento de un gobierno. Y se le dio una indulgencia, un indulto presidencial por haber cometido ese delito.  \n\nY mucha gente comenta y dice que precisamente como consecuencia de este indulto presidencial fue que todo el desastre que llevó a lo que es Venezuela hoy, el país está en crisis precisamente porque cuando este personaje fue liberado de la historia venezolana, y digo personaje porque no es precisamente un personaje importante de buena manera, sino que es un infame que llevó a la destrucción de lo que es el país hoy. \n\nSi esta persona no hubiese sido liberada, entonces esta persona seguiría atrapada en una mazmorra o probablemente habría muerto, pero en una mazmorra y el país quizás habría tenido otro destino, un destino más sano que el que tiene actualmente, que el que vivimos en estos momentos. Los indultos presidenciales son algo muy delicado y que se debe manejar con mucho cuidado.  \n\nLamentablemente, el factor político siempre está de por medio e influye en quienes van a ser indultados. Dudo que todos los indultos que se han otorgado en los diferentes países la mayoría sean legítimos o sean meritorios. \n\nEs muy difícil, realmente, demostrar que alguien merece un indulto presidencial.  \n\nLa persona tiene que haber reparado de una manera muy leal y reconocible con la sociedad el daño que ha hecho para poder merecer el indulto. Al menos esto es lo que pienso desde mi rincón y mi punto de vista.\n\n\n\n</div>\n\n<center>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nThumbnail of the post edit using [canva.com ](https://www.canva.com/)and maded with [Bing ai](https://sl.bing.net/gEmYP3nXbIy)\n\n\n![sepmanclarciudad.jpg](https://images.hive.blog/0x0/https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/manclar/23u5SwkDMqTct4Kgqsv3RVeNxduJ3R3FDChujBLRHKcxWWPmnvnMa18nuuKjHxhFkJSK3.gif)\n<sub>This is my black cat \"manclar\", this hive name account is to honor his dead (it happened years ago).</sub>\n\n![](https://images.hive.blog/0x0/https://cdn.rcimg.net/MicroReylatos/eea03629/39af3c9a0e98248e06b4b9e61ceb136d.png)\n\n\nThe divisor is made by @albiro2050, if you want one made in your style, visit him and he will gladly take care of your commission.\n</center>\n\n---\n\n\n\nPosted Using [INLEO](https://inleo.io/@manclar/the-hidden-cost-of-forgiving-the-unforgivable-engspa-adj)",

        "body": "<center>\n![MINIETERNALYOUTHISNOTATMYTH.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/manclar/23xyZjzCnr43kymnJRnbaRm6JFt7gjVqF1fKnHZyUfmpc7DBRDSPP2dzhbXv5kGdh8zfz.png)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<div class=\"text-justify\">\n\n#\n\n<center><img src=\"https://images.hive.blog/0x0/https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/manclar/23tv8niTgDV9Nw5p2hSfnLTmaDqahUiDosHNzKbH4s77bUKPEFiUG1UZtmL4FmapuSSh8.jpg\"></center>\n<center><sub>*This is a bilingual publication, you can go directly to the SPANISH version by clicking [HERE](#Español\")*\n</sub><hr>This is my post for #freewriters 2805 prompt \"not a myth\" hosted by @mariannewest </center>\n<hr>\n\n\n\n\n\n\nToday, I want to talk to you about my state of mind over the past few days, despite the fact that I’ve been doing an activity I hadn’t done in years—one that has recently filled my life in a very refreshing way. It’s an activity I dedicated myself to long ago for many years.  \n\nI found myself playing *World of Warcraft* again. \n\nI spent 5 or 6 years of my life devoted to that video game, and I remember it as if it were yesterday: the days when, within this great game, I met other people, had conversations over the internet through the game itself and voice chat. \n\nBack then, we used TeamSpeak because I don’t think communication programs like Discord existed yet. We handled all our conversations and in-game activities through TeamSpeak.  \n\nI remember how complicated things could get for us sometimes. When the TeamSpeak servers crashed or stopped working, we had to rush to another server or already have backup servers ready as an emergency measure so we could keep talking if one of them failed. \n\nWe had everything organized. We were a group of several friends. \n\nI remember my friend Gabriel was there, as well as my friend Puchu from Mexico—who are now married, and have been for so many years. They’re husbands and have a child.  \n\nSo many years have passed! So many things we’ve lived through! \n\nAnd this ties into today’s topic: **it’s not a myth**. \n\nThat myth about us being eternally young is, let’s say, a reality. \n\nBecause even though our physical bodies age, and our minds grow older chronologically, that youthful spirit of reliving those times—those memories I’m revisiting with this new activity I’m dedicating myself to—takes me back to that gaming era. \n\nHonestly, I can say it’s incredibly refreshing, and again, **it’s not a myth** to feel young when doing these activities.  \n\nIt’s like drinking from the fountain of eternal youth when you reclaim that spirit, that spark that reignites the flame inside you and makes you feel so much better. \n\nFor the past few days, the past few weeks, I’ve been staying up until 6 in the morning—and with great pleasure. \n\nTo the point where I can thankfully say I’ve stepped away from my activities here on HIVE. \n\nAnd that’s something that makes me feel really good, because being here consumes so much of my time, and I haven’t been seeing the results I’d like, as I’ve mentioned lately.  \n\nIt makes me incredibly happy because it lets me see a different side of life and interact with people who aren’t constantly talking about HIVE, above or below. \n\nI know this is what fills their lives, but for me, after spending eight years here on HIVE, it’s very important to have another kind of activity. \n\nAnd above all, to know that the people in this new space have no idea about HIVE—and I really don’t want them to know. Mixing this activity I do here on HIVE with the other one that’s kept me awake for weeks with such joy would, I think, poison and tarnish this whole feeling of happiness I’ve been experiencing.  \n\nI truly feel very happy because one thing has nothing directly to do with the other. \n\nAnd what matters is that I feel good—and that **it’s not a myth**, all of this I’m feeling. \n\nI thought it would be very hard in life to ever feel as good as I did back in those *Warcraft* days. And I wanted to share this feeling and this new perspective, because it’s given me a much fresher and far better outlook than the one I had before.  \n  \n\n\n\n\n\n<center>Translated with [Deepsek AI](https://deepseek.com) \n</p></center>\n\n# <center><div class=\"phishy\">Español<a id=\"Español\"></a></div></center>\n\n\nHoy vengo a hablarles sobre mi estado de ánimo en los últimos días, a pesar de que estoy haciendo una actividad que no hacía desde hace años y que últimamente ha llenado el espacio en mi vida de una manera muy refrescante. Porque es una actividad a la que me dediqué hace años durante mucho tiempo.  \n\nMe encontré jugando World of Warcraft. \n\nPasé 5 o 6 años de mi vida dedicado a ese videojuego, y realmente lo recuerdo como si fuera ayer: los días en los que, dentro de este gran juego, conocí a otras personas, tuve conversaciones a través de internet por el juego mismo y por chat de voz. \n\nEn esos tiempos usábamos TeamSpeak, porque creo que no existían programas de comunicación como los de ahora, tales como Discord. Hacíamos todas las conversaciones y todas las actividades del juego a través de TeamSpeak.  \n\nRecuerdo que muchas veces se nos complicaban las cosas porque, cuando los servidores de TeamSpeak caían o dejaban de funcionar, teníamos que ir corriendo a otro servidor o ya tener establecido, como mecanismo de emergencia, otros servidores en los que podíamos seguir hablando en caso de que alguno de estos fallara. \n\nYa lo teníamos todo organizado. Éramos un grupo de varios amigos. \n\nRecuerdo que estaba mi amigo Gabriel y mi amiga Puchu, de México, que ahora son esposos desde hace tantos años. Son esposos y tienen un hijo.  \n\n¡Cuántos años han pasado! ¡Cuántas cosas hemos vivido! \n\nY esto tiene que ver con el tema de hoy, que **no es un mito**. \n\nEse mito de que somos eternamente jóvenes es, digamos, una realidad. Porque, aunque nuestro cuerpo físico envejece y nuestra mente envejece cronológicamente y somos mayores, ese espíritu juvenil de revivir esos tiempos y esas cosas que estoy recordando con esta nueva actividad a la que me estoy dedicando me remonta a esa época de videojuegos. \n\nLa verdad, puedo decir que es muy refrescante y, nuevamente, que **no es un mito** sentirse joven cuando se realizan estas actividades.  \n\nPorque es como si bebieras agua de la fuente de la eterna juventud cuando recuperas ese espíritu, esa cosa que aviva la llama en ti y que te hace sentir mucho mejor. \n\nLos últimos días, las últimas semanas, las he pasado despertando hasta las 6 de la mañana y con gran placer. \n\nHasta el punto de que puedo decir, afortunadamente, que he abandonado las actividades aquí en HIVE. \n\nY eso es algo que me hace sentir muy bien, porque estar aquí me consume mucho tiempo y no veo resultados suficientes, como les he estado diciendo últimamente.  \n\nMe hace muy, muy feliz porque me hace ver otro aspecto diferente de la vida y tratar con otras personas que no solo hablan desde arriba y desde abajo sobre HIVE todo el tiempo. \n\nSé que esto ocupa sus vidas, pero para mí es muy importante, después de estar ocho años aquí en HIVE, tener otro tipo de actividad. \n\nY, sobre todo, saber que en el lugar donde estoy la gente no sabe sobre HIVE. \n\nY realmente no quiero que lo sepan, porque mezclar esta actividad que hago aquí en HIVE con la otra que me tiene despierto durante semanas con gran placer, creo que intoxicaría y ensuciaría todo este sentimiento de alegría que estoy teniendo.  \n\nRealmente me siento muy feliz porque una cosa no tiene nada que ver directamente con la otra. \n\nY lo importante es que me siento bien y que **no es un mito** todo esto que estoy sintiendo.\n\nPensé que sería muy difícil en la vida poder sentirme tan bien como me sentí en esos años que jugué *Warcraft*. Y quise compartir este sentimiento y esta nueva forma de ver las cosas, porque me da un punto de vista más refrescante y mucho mejor que el que tenía anteriormente.  \n\n\n\n\n\n\n</div>\n\n<center>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nThumbnail of the post edit using [canva.com ](https://www.canva.com/)and maded with [Bing ai](https://sl.bing.net/gEmYP3nXbIy)\n\n\n![sepmanclarciudad.jpg](https://images.hive.blog/0x0/https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/manclar/23u5SwkDMqTct4Kgqsv3RVeNxduJ3R3FDChujBLRHKcxWWPmnvnMa18nuuKjHxhFkJSK3.gif)\n<sub>This is my black cat \"manclar\", this hive name account is to honor his dead (it happened years ago).</sub>\n\n![](https://images.hive.blog/0x0/https://cdn.rcimg.net/MicroReylatos/eea03629/39af3c9a0e98248e06b4b9e61ceb136d.png)\n\n\nThe divisor is made by @albiro2050, if you want one made in your style, visit him and he will gladly take care of your commission.\n</center>\n\n---\n\n\n\nPosted Using [INLEO](https://inleo.io/@manclar/eternal-youth-isnt-a-mythits-a-mindset-heres-my-proof-engspa-ds6)",

        "body": "<center>\n![MINIHOWGOSSIPSHATEREDMYREPUTATION.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/manclar/23tH8BvcsEyyZc5fEBdndcVpVhayweB2dZdurrLE9ZupAYJ5nsRAQ6XzcsqUxNfFhU7mV.png)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<div class=\"text-justify\">\n\n#\n\n<center><img src=\"https://images.hive.blog/0x0/https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/manclar/23tv8niTgDV9Nw5p2hSfnLTmaDqahUiDosHNzKbH4s77bUKPEFiUG1UZtmL4FmapuSSh8.jpg\"></center>\n<center><sub>*This is a bilingual publication, you can go directly to the SPANISH version by clicking [HERE](#Español\")*\n</sub><hr>This is my post for #freewriters 2802 prompt \"credibility\" hosted by @mariannewest </center>\n<hr>\n\n\n\n\n\n\nThis is a topic of which I have something very particular to say, because talking about credibility is something that touches my heart a lot, especially because of the number of events and stages that have happened to me in life. \n\nTo understand this, you have to have a little context. I'm going to talk to you about a very personal situation in my life.  \n\nAs you know, coming from a dysfunctional family with an abusive father, due to different circumstances in life, both my mother and my father became sick with dementia. \n\nI had to take care of both of them for approximately two and a half years while they suffered from this monstrous and terrible ailment.  \n\nTaking care of a person who suffers from dementia is a very complicated task, especially if you do not have the tools to know what it is or how to handle this person, and without having constant advice from a specialist who could dedicate himself to the case. \n\nThe doctors who diagnosed each of them—both mom and dad—in this condition were simply government doctors, and they did not tell me in detail how to treat these people.  \n\nI had to do an investigation and ask different doctors and look for information on the internet to know how to deal with and take care of these people in the best way, both for their mental health and my own, because the mental wear and tear is obviously very large.  \n\nWhat has to do with today's issue of credibility is that, after so much treatment and so much care that I gave each of them, obviously they came to the end of their lives. \n\nBut what happens—and has to do with today's issue—is that in the neighborhood where I live, which is a place full of gossip and rumors from people who do not have anything better to do but to take care of other people's lives (in this case, mine), believing that they know my life and my situations better than I do, they began to mess with my credibility.  \n\nThey said that it was because of me that they had become sick with dementia, both in the case of my mother and in the case of my father. \n\nPrecisely today, I was talking to this friend that I told you about in the previous post about this—that people did not really know what had happened—because they said that I put them in a nursing home to be able to live my life better. \n\nAnd it really was not like that, because I found myself in an extremely difficult situation in which I had two options: either dedicate myself only to take care of them and not work (I could not generate money, and I was going to run out of money to be able to give them what they needed), or find another solution.  \n\nThey consumed diapers, food, personal hygiene articles of daily use, clothes, and apart from that, the institution where they were asked for certain collaborations and certain things that had to be taken, without counting the things that they were asking for later, such as wheelchairs, sticks, etc. And all that came out of my pocket. \n\nAt that time, I did not have a job, and I had to make the decision to put my mother—and then my father, years later, after my mother died—in a nursing home so that I could work and pay for things.  \n\nBut people damaged my credibility. I lost credibility among people because they decided to crucify me as the cause of their illness, and on that side, I lost credibility with them—which displeases me, really. \n\nAnd I lost credibility in all of them, in all the people who live here, because that was the good side that showed me who each of the people is and what they thought and what they talk about me.  \n\nToday, I am far away, and I absolutely do not want to have anything to do with any of those individuals because I know exactly what they talked about me.\n\nAnd obviously, I am quite resentful toward them, and I do not plan to give my arm to twist for any reason. I don’t want to participate in any activity in which they are involved or that they are driving, because it simply repulses me.  \n\nCredibility is something that is very important and very valuable and must be respected—the merits that each person has, that has managed to strengthen and grow their credibility in their well-being, for their future, for their life, and a good life. \n\nThis is the example of what I can say about credibility: whoever has it should keep it, and whoever observes it should respect it and value it, because it is a great treasure.  \n\n\n\n\n\n<center>Translated with [Deepsek AI](https://deepseek.com) \n</p></center>\n\n# <center><div class=\"phishy\">Español<a id=\"Español\"></a></div></center>\n\n\nEste es un tema del cual tengo algo muy particular que decir, porque hablar de credibilidad es algo que me toca mucho el corazón, especialmente por la cantidad de eventos y etapas que me han sucedido en la vida. \n\nPara entender esto, hay que tener un poco de contexto. Voy a hablarte de una situación muy personal en mi vida. \n\nComo sabes, al venir de una familia disfuncional con un padre abusivo, debido a diferentes circunstancias en la vida, tanto mi madre como mi padre enfermaron de demencia.  \n\nTuve que cuidar de ambos durante aproximadamente dos años y medio mientras padecían este monstruoso y terrible mal. \n\nCuidar a una persona que sufre de demencia es una tarea muy complicada, especialmente si no tienes las herramientas para saber qué es o cómo manejar a esta persona y sin tener el consejo constante de un especialista que pudiera dedicarse al caso, porque los médicos que diagnosticaron a cada uno de ellos, tanto a mi madre como a mi padre, en esta condición, eran simplemente médicos del gobierno y no me explicaron en detalle cómo tratar a estas personas.  \n\nTuve que hacer una investigación y preguntar a diferentes médicos y buscar información en internet para saber cómo lidiar y cuidar a estas personas de la mejor manera, tanto por su salud mental como por la mía, porque el desgaste mental es obviamente muy grande. \n\nLo que tiene que ver con el tema de hoy, la credibilidad, es que después de tanto tratamiento y tanto cuidado que les di a cada uno de ellos, obviamente llegaron al final de sus vidas.  \n\nPero lo que ocurre y tiene que ver con el tema de hoy es que en el vecindario donde vivo, que es un lugar lleno de chismes y rumores de personas que no tienen nada mejor que hacer que meterse en la vida de los demás, en este caso en mi vida, creyendo que conocen mi vida y mis situaciones mejor que yo, comenzaron a dañar mi credibilidad, diciendo que fue por mí que ellos habían enfermado de demencia, tanto en el caso de mi madre como en el de mi padre.  \n\nPrecisamente hoy estaba hablando con este amigo que te mencioné en el post anterior sobre esto, que justamente la gente no sabía realmente lo que había pasado, porque decían que los metí en un asilo para poder vivir mi vida mejor, y realmente no fue así, porque me encontré en una situación extremadamente difícil en la que tenía dos opciones: o dedicarme solo a cuidarlos y no podía trabajar, no podía generar dinero y me iba a quedar sin recursos para darles lo que necesitaban, porque consumían pañales, comida, artículos de higiene personal de uso diario, ropa, y aparte de eso, la institución donde estaban pedía ciertas colaboraciones y ciertas cosas que había que llevar, sin contar las cosas que luego iban pidiendo, como sillas de ruedas, bastones, etc.  \n\nTodo eso salía de mi bolsillo. \n\nEn ese momento no tenía trabajo y tuve que tomar la decisión de ingresar a mi madre y luego a mi padre, años después, cuando mi madre ya había fallecido, en un asilo para poder trabajar y pagar por todo. \n\nPero la gente dañó mi credibilidad, perdí credibilidad entre las personas porque decidieron crucificarme como la causa de su enfermedad, y por ese lado perdí credibilidad con ellos, lo cual me disgusta mucho, realmente.  \n\nPerdí credibilidad en todos ellos, en todas las personas que viven aquí, porque ese fue el lado bueno que me mostró quién es cada una de esas personas y lo que pensaban y lo que hablaban de mí. \n\nHoy estoy lejos y no quiero tener absolutamente nada que ver con ninguno de esos individuos, porque sé exactamente lo que hablaron de mí y obviamente estoy bastante resentido con ellos, y no planeo dar mi brazo a torcer por ninguna razón.  \n\nNo quiero participar en ninguna actividad en la que ellos estén involucrados o que ellos impulsen, porque simplemente me repugna y me da muchisimo ASCO.  \n\nLa credibilidad es algo que es muy importante y muy valioso, y se deben respetar los méritos que cada persona tiene, que ha logrado fortalecer y hacer crecer su credibilidad en su bienestar, para su futuro, para su vida y una buena vida.  \n\nEste es el ejemplo de lo que puedo decir sobre la credibilidad. Quien la tiene, que la conserve, y quien la observe, que la respete y la valore, porque es un gran tesoro.  \n\n\n\n\n\n</div>\n\n<center>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nThumbnail of the post edit using [canva.com ](https://www.canva.com/)and maded with [Bing ai](https://sl.bing.net/iHNpwpUaBRQ)\n\n\n![sepmanclarciudad.jpg](https://images.hive.blog/0x0/https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/manclar/23u5SwkDMqTct4Kgqsv3RVeNxduJ3R3FDChujBLRHKcxWWPmnvnMa18nuuKjHxhFkJSK3.gif)\n<sub>This is my black cat \"manclar\", this hive name account is to honor his dead (it happened years ago).</sub>\n\n![](https://images.hive.blog/0x0/https://cdn.rcimg.net/MicroReylatos/eea03629/39af3c9a0e98248e06b4b9e61ceb136d.png)\n\n\nThe divisor is made by @albiro2050, if you want one made in your style, visit him and he will gladly take care of your commission.\n</center>\n\n---\n\n\n\nPosted Using [INLEO](https://inleo.io/@manclar/how-gossip-shattered-my-reputation-engspa-ewy)",

        "body": "\n\n\n# **Hey everyone,**\n\nAnother week, another blog post. Today I want to touch on a few important topics: **my goals for the near future**, an **idea I have for a personal game project**, the possibility of creating a **community focused on pixel art and game dev**, and also my plans to **return to social media** after some recent setbacks.\n\nI’ll be honest – I’ve been pretty absent from online spaces lately. My thoughts weren’t clear, and life kept throwing curveballs. I was struggling with medication adjustments, some health issues, and financial stress. But I feel like I’m finally getting my footing again, and now’s the time to say: enough. It’s time to do things properly, get back on track, and start moving forward again.\n\n**You can’t sit still and just wait for change to happen. If you don’t take action, nothing improves.**\n\n---\n\n### My Three Main Goals for the Near Future\n\nSo here are the three main things I want to focus on: **developing a new game**, **possibly building a small creative community**, and **rebooting my social media presence**.\n\n---\n\n### A New Game Project (Besides *Pumpkin Cat*)\n\nApart from *Pumpkin Cat*, which I mentioned in the last post, I have another – much bigger – game idea. It’s going to be a **narrative-driven RPG**, with 2D visuals and a rich story. I don’t want to give away too much just yet, since there are still a lot of aspects I’m figuring out, but I can say that the concept is already **well-developed**, both in my head and on paper.\n\nI’ve outlined several mechanics, general story arcs, and ideas for the world. The only thing stopping me is that I **still need to learn a lot more** – both in terms of programming and game design. So this will definitely be a **long-term project**, but I thought it would be nice to share a bit of it with you now.\n\n---\n\n### A Pixel Art & Game Dev Community (This Is Not a Promotion)\n\nAnother idea I’ve had for a while is starting a **community space** – possibly here on Hive – focused specifically on **pixel art and game development**. It could be a place for people to share tips, resources, maybe even set up a **Discord server** where we help each other improve and collaborate.\n\nAnd just to be clear: **this is not a promotion**, and **Alien Art Hive** or any other creative group **doesn’t need to feel threatened** by the idea. I have huge respect for the communities that already exist here. What I’m talking about would be a niche addition, aimed specifically at **indie devs and pixel art lovers**, and only if there’s interest for it.\n\nAt the moment, I don’t have the following or engagement to launch something like that. But if more people join in and the support grows, I’d be more than happy to take that step in the future.\n\n---\n\n### Returning to Social Media: Instagram, YouTube, TikTok\n\nAnother major goal for me is to **get back to being active on social media** – particularly **Instagram, YouTube, and TikTok**. I’ve had a bit of a hiatus recently due to everything I mentioned earlier, but now I’m slowly regaining focus and energy.\n\nBy the time this post goes live, I might already be getting back into it. But I still need a little more time to settle in. The medication I’ve started recently is helping, and I’m beginning to feel like I can finish things properly again, instead of jumping between projects with no structure.\n\n---\n\n<center>***Take a second and check out this art <3***</center>\n\n<center><h1>***Static version down below!***</h1></center>\n\n\n![Third.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/ggenos/48K7YkeeLdxBvxPdi67qgeu8ajWGjA45k2191HkLEJCnDrbGUQSLFxK3NevaizNa7k.png)\n\n***Like the man gazing at the black hole, I’m staring into the unknown—ready to make my dreams a reality. You should be too!***\n\n\n---\n\n### I’d Love to Hear From You\n\nI’ve noticed that not many people leave comments on my posts, and I totally understand – I haven’t been consistent. But I’d genuinely appreciate even a small comment or bit of feedback.\n\nLet me know:\n\n* What you think about the new game idea,\n* Whether you'd be interested in joining a creative community like the one I described,\n* Or just share something cool you’re working on.\n\nEven a simple \"Hey, this was a good read\" goes a long way.\n\n---\n\n### A Quick Thought on Goals and Motivation\n\nIf you’re struggling with planning or achieving things, here’s a reminder that it really helps to **break big goals into smaller ones**. It’s hard to get anywhere when you don’t even know where you’re going. Saying “I want to do this or that” without knowing *why* makes it much harder to actually finish anything.\n\nSo take a moment to define your purpose. Give your goals meaning. When you know what you're aiming for, the steps become clearer – and far more achievable.\n\n**Remember: the end goal justifies the means – but only if you know what that goal truly is.**\n\n---\nTools used in this post:\nProcreate For Ipad \nApple Pen\nInspiration : Split Fiction / Exploding star sequence\n**<u>This art was made in 100% by me, if you're intrested in commision hmu :)</u>**\n\n---\n</center><center>Feel free to check me on [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/artggenos/), [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@artggenos) and [Ko-fi](https://ko-fi.com/artggenos)\n\n</center><center> Music for today's post [here](https://open.spotify.com/track/7AMGgAPFczs3wJgMqu6Eqi?si=350f3cf8e07a4877).\n\nI'll see you in 2 weeks guys, and I hope you liked today's post!\n---\n\n---\n<center><sup>These graphics were already shared on my socials.</sup></center><center><sub></sub></center>\n\n\n",

        "body": "<center>\n![MINIHOWISURVIVEDDECADESOFEMOTIONALTRAUMA.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/manclar/23vrtfYH56V9WHNaTXSvCX9cbDdCVuBmgo4hng6KHWm5B4RVa5Ydb4embtxSBfw6X9dsH.png)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<div class=\"text-justify\">\n\n#\n\n<center><img src=\"https://images.hive.blog/0x0/https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/manclar/23tv8niTgDV9Nw5p2hSfnLTmaDqahUiDosHNzKbH4s77bUKPEFiUG1UZtmL4FmapuSSh8.jpg\"></center>\n<center><sub>*This is a bilingual publication, you can go directly to the SPANISH version by clicking [HERE](#Español\")*\n</sub><hr>This is my post for #freewriters 2800 prompt \"no more stress\" hosted by @mariannewest </center>\n<hr>\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMy life is full of many concerns, many doubts, anxieties about what the future will be like. \n\nAnd if you are thinking that I have anxiety problems, you are right. For many years I have had serious chronic anxiety problems due to many situations that I have had to live and try to overcome in life.\n\nComing from a dysfunctional family, with a father who got us used to living in domestic violence for more than 40 years. Although violence was never physical, it did turn out to be psychological, which is the worst. I lived with a lot of fear every day.\n\nI remember at this precise moment, when in my time as a high school student, and I'm talking about this was about 35 years ago approximately, or maybe more, probably more, 40 or 42 years ago, I had to go to high school and on the one hand I was very scared and unhappy to go to high school because in high school I suffered the bullying of those who lived there day by day, because I was always the character or the one who was withdrawn, the aside or the weirdo of the group. \n\n\nThe student who was always quiet and sat in the last chair to go unnoticed and who did not like to talk to anyone. And they always made fun of me, for example, they put tacks on me for when I sat down, they made fun of me saying I was obese, saying I was weird, etc.\n\nAnd I was always segregated, so going to school was for me a situation of a lot of stress, it caused me a lot of anxiety, but it also tired me a lot of anxiety to go home. Because when I left school, going home meant meeting a father who was going to compare me to the children of other parents, saying that they had a future, telling me that I was never going to achieve my goals, that they were an example and that he felt very ashamed of me. \n\nAnd of course all this made me very bad and he did not know about the whole situation that I was going through at school, my mother was getting older, but this situation marked me for many years of my entire adolescence, it made me live in constant stress until a time came in my life as a teenager, when I started to be a young adult, I would say that at the age of 26 or 27, I began to realize these things.\n\nI said that I did not want more stress, no more stress, and I began to take things lightly, but the challenges that life had prepared for me were different, they were of another type, of another level. \n\nIt turned out that my father, from the age of 20, decided not to give me more sustenance, and I had to earn my sustenance, including paying for my own studies, because my mother helped me, but my father did not want to help me pay for any of the studies, he said that it was not worth it, that it was a waste of time, in those times I took very dark paths that I do not want to remember, and it was a quite difficult and quite stressful stage in my life. \n\nWhat I want to make clear with all this is that whatever it costs, there must come a time to decide and tell yourself that you should not have more stress, no more stress in your life, because this is something that causes us a great emotional damage, and it can create or build a resentful person against society as I am.\n\nA few moments ago I was holding a conversation with a person I have known for many years, the son of a person who is no longer there, that person who died was a very good friend of mine, he was my teacher, and now the son feels very close to me because I treated his father very well, and from time to time we hold certain conversations. \n\nAnd we were having a conversation that helped me to release a lot of stress, that I have a very particular problem due to the condition of diabetes, I have an infection in my foot and this infection produces a very unpleasant smell, so when people approach me they perceive the smell and it is repulsive, I know, and I don't like having to explain why I smell like that. \n\nIn fact, I prefer that they stay away from me and that they repudiate me, I don't care if they think that I am a dirty, a scoundrel, which in parentheses I am, because I don't like to deal with society and humanity.\n\nThe point is that my friend's son mentioned the smell and told me that I was not worried that he did not repudiate me because I knew that was the product of the medical problem that I have. That was a breeze of fresh air for me, it did a lot of good.\n\nWhat I want to say with this is that it relaxed me a lot to have this conversation with the son of my old friend who has already passed away and that this helped me to release a lot of stress. \n\n\n\n\n<center>Translated with [Deepsek AI](https://deepseek.com) \n</p></center>\n\n# <center><div class=\"phishy\">Español<a id=\"Español\"></a></div></center>\n\n\nMi vida está llena de muchas preocupaciones, muchas dudas, ansiedades sobre cómo será el futuro. \n\nY si estás pensando que tengo problemas de ansiedad, estás en lo correcto. Durante muchos años he tenido serios problemas de ansiedad crónica debido a muchas situaciones que he tenido que vivir y tratar de superar en la vida.  \n\nProveniente de una familia disfuncional, con un padre que nos acostumbró a vivir en violencia doméstica por más de 40 años. Aunque la violencia nunca fue física, sí resultó ser psicológica, que es lo peor. Viví con mucho miedo todos los días.  \n\nRecuerdo en este preciso momento, cuando en mi época de estudiante de secundaria, y estoy hablando de que esto fue hace aproximadamente 35 años, o quizás más, probablemente más, 40 o 42 años atrás, tenía que ir a la escuela y por un lado estaba muy asustado e infeliz de ir a la secundaria porque en la escuela sufría el acoso de quienes vivían ahí día a día, porque siempre fui el personaje o el que estaba retraído, el apartado o el raro del grupo. \n\nEl estudiante que siempre estaba callado y se sentaba en la última silla para pasar desapercibido y que no le gustaba hablar con nadie. Y siempre se burlaban de mí, por ejemplo, me ponían tachuelas para cuando me sentaba, se reían de mí diciendo que era obeso, que era raro, etcétera.  \n\nY siempre fui segregado, así que ir a la escuela era para mí una situación de mucho estrés, me causaba mucha ansiedad, pero también me cansaba mucho la ansiedad de ir a casa. \n\nPorque cuando salía de la escuela, ir a casa significaba encontrarme con un padre que me iba a comparar con los hijos de otros padres, diciendo que ellos tenían futuro, diciéndome que yo nunca iba a lograr mis metas, que ellos eran un ejemplo y que él sentía mucha vergüenza de mí. \n\nY claro, todo esto me hacía muy mal y él no sabía de toda la situación que yo estaba pasando en la escuela, mi madre ya estaba envejeciendo, pero esta situación me marcó por muchos años de toda mi adolescencia, me hizo vivir en constante estrés hasta que llegó un momento en mi vida como adolescente, cuando empecé a ser un joven adulto, diría que a los 26 o 27 años, empecé a darme cuenta de estas cosas.  \n\nDije que no quería más estrés, no más estrés, y empecé a tomarme las cosas con calma, pero los desafíos que la vida había preparado para mí eran diferentes, eran de otro tipo, de otro nivel. \n\nResultó que mi padre, desde los 20 años, decidió no darme más sustento, y tuve que ganarme el sustento, incluso pagar mis propios estudios, porque mi madre me ayudaba, pero mi padre no quería ayudarme a pagar ninguno de los estudios, decía que no valía la pena, que era una pérdida de tiempo, en esos tiempos tomé caminos muy oscuros que no quiero recordar, y fue una etapa bastante difícil y bastante estresante en mi vida. \n\nLo que quiero dejar claro con todo esto es que, cueste lo que cueste, debe llegar un momento para decidir y decirte a ti mismo que no debes tener más estrés, no más estrés en tu vida, porque esto es algo que nos causa un gran daño emocional, y puede crear o construir una persona resentida contra la sociedad como yo.  \n\nHace unos momentos estaba sosteniendo una conversación con una persona que conozco desde hace muchos años, el hijo de una persona que ya no está, esa persona que murió era un muy buen amigo mío, era mi maestro, y ahora el hijo se siente muy cercano a mí porque traté muy bien a su padre, y de vez en cuando sostenemos ciertas conversaciones. \n\nY estábamos teniendo una conversación que me ayudó a liberar mucho estrés, que tengo un problema muy particular debido a la condición de diabetes, tengo una infección en el pie y esta infección produce un olor muy desagradable, así que cuando la gente se acerca a mí percibe el olor y es repulsivo, lo sé, y no me gusta tener que explicar por qué huelo así. \n\nDe hecho, prefiero que se alejen de mí y que me repudien, no me importa si piensan que soy un sucio, un sinvergüenza, que entre paréntesis lo soy, porque no me gusta lidiar con la sociedad y la humanidad.  \n\n\nEl punto es que el hijo de mi amigo menciono lo del olor y me dijo que no me preocupaba que el no me repudiaba porque sabia que eso era producto del problema medico que yo tengo. Eso fue una brisa de aire fresco para mi, me hizo mucho bien.\n\nLo que quiero decir con esto es que me relajó mucho tener esta conversación con el hijo de mi viejo amigo que ya falleció y que esto me ayudó a liberar mucho estrés. \n\nLibera el estrés, no dejes que se acumule porque es dañino.  \n\n\n\n</div>\n\n<center>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nThumbnail of the post edit using [canva.com ](https://www.canva.com/)and maded with [Bing ai](https://sl.bing.net/sEgQUFbSSa)\n\n\n![sepmanclarciudad.jpg](https://images.hive.blog/0x0/https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/manclar/23u5SwkDMqTct4Kgqsv3RVeNxduJ3R3FDChujBLRHKcxWWPmnvnMa18nuuKjHxhFkJSK3.gif)\n<sub>This is my black cat \"manclar\", this hive name account is to honor his dead (it happened years ago).</sub>\n\n![](https://images.hive.blog/0x0/https://cdn.rcimg.net/MicroReylatos/eea03629/39af3c9a0e98248e06b4b9e61ceb136d.png)\n\n\nThe divisor is made by @albiro2050, if you want one made in your style, visit him and he will gladly take care of your commission.\n</center>\n\n---\n\n\n\nPosted Using [INLEO](https://inleo.io/@manclar/how-i-survived-decades-of-emotional-trauma-engspa-jff)",

        "body": "<center>\n![minithehiddenmeaning.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/manclar/23xyQaiuksKVhbcWpCQHbau23M4NJhyF9jQxWqC5siJDeeyh2DqLypenmjSv89jx1HsWy.png)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<div class=\"text-justify\">\n\n#\n\n<center><img src=\"https://images.hive.blog/0x0/https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/manclar/23tv8niTgDV9Nw5p2hSfnLTmaDqahUiDosHNzKbH4s77bUKPEFiUG1UZtmL4FmapuSSh8.jpg\"></center>\n<center><sub>*This is a bilingual publication, you can go directly to the SPANISH version by clicking [HERE](#Español\")*\n</sub><hr>This is my post for #freewriters 2798 prompt \"an ugly truck\" hosted by @mariannewest </center>\n<hr>\n\n\n\n\n\n\nThinking about an ugly truck makes me reflect a few things. \n\nFirst of all, thinking about how this person who owns the truck does not have the possibility of repairing it or fixing it or leaving it as ugly as it is. \n\nPerhaps, imagining all the possibilities of what can happen, it occurs to me to think about the life of that person, of that owner, of the owner of the truck.  \n\nPerhaps he had a great disease that prevented him or prevents him from being able to take care of the maintenance of the truck. Perhaps he is very old and spent all his life driving that truck and now he does not have the necessary strength to dedicate himself to being able to clean and make the truck beautiful, beautify it, and that is why it is ugly.  \n\nPerhaps it is simply someone who, for all the number of problems he has in his life, suffered a great depression, and the truck is simply the reflection of how he is, of how he feels, of all the abandonment he has in himself, and that abandonment is reflected in his truck. \n\nOr it is simply someone who likes the appearance of things to be so ugly.  \n\nI have seen many cases of criminals and very intelligent people who are not criminals who have made the decision in their life to go unnoticed or that they do not take them into account, with the intention of not drawing attention. \n\nAnd what better way not to draw attention than having an ugly truck? No one is going to take care of looking at an ugly truck. \n\nPerhaps momentarily they draw their attention because they see that the truck is neglected or does not look good, but for sure, it is something that I think people will not remember. \n\nGenerally, the things that are not pleasant are the ones that are not remembered well—at least that's how I think. In my memory processes, all the things that are painful and unpleasant are erased, and I forget them over time. I learn from them, but I forget them.  \n\nAn ugly truck can be ugly in many ways too, and this is another point to address. \n\nIt can be ugly precisely because it has very scary and very worrying noises. Perhaps its engine valves are very worn out, and it smokes. Perhaps it is ugly because not only its appearance is worn out, but it emits an unpleasant smell. \n\nPerhaps it is ugly because it is simply not fashionable—it is a vintage truck, and with the new technologies that exist, the new paints, and the new accessories especially for vehicles, if this is an old-style truck, surely those of the Z generation will think it is an ugly truck.  \n\nPerhaps it is simply ugly because it is in an environment where everything is beautiful, and since the truck is vintage and does not fit with the whole scenario in which it is, then that makes it stand out and makes it look much uglier. \n\nBecause surely, if it were in an environment that was ugly like it, it would be a truck that was normal. \n\nIt could not be said that it is an ugly truck if it is in an ugly environment because it is fitting into what it is. Then surely that truck is not ugly, but it is in a beautiful environment.  \n\nI could start to philosophize and say many things about why the truck is ugly, but I think that with these few topics that I have touched for today's prompt, it is enough. \n\n\n\n<center>Translated with [Deepsek AI](https://deepseek.com) \n</p></center>\n\n# <center><div class=\"phishy\">Español<a id=\"Español\"></a></div></center>\n\n\nPensar en un camión feo me hace reflexionar sobre algunas cosas. \n\nEn primer lugar, pensar en cómo esta persona que es dueña del camión no tiene la posibilidad de repararlo o arreglarlo o dejarlo tan feo como está. Quizás, imaginando todas las posibilidades de lo que puede ocurrir, se me ocurre pensar en la vida de esa persona, de ese dueño, del propietario del camión.  \n\nQuizás tuvo una gran enfermedad que le impidió o le impide poder encargarse del mantenimiento del camión. Tal vez es muy mayor y pasó toda su vida conduciendo ese camión y ahora no tiene la fuerza necesaria para dedicarse a limpiarlo y hacerlo hermoso, embellecerlo, y por eso está feo.  \n\nPuede que simplemente sea alguien que, por todos los problemas que tiene en su vida, sufrió una gran depresión, y el camión es simplemente el reflejo de cómo es, de cómo se siente, de todo el abandono que tiene en sí mismo, y ese abandono se refleja en su camión. O es simplemente alguien a quien le gusta que el aspecto de las cosas sea así de feo.  \n\nHe visto muchos casos de criminales y personas muy inteligentes que no son criminales, que han tomado la decisión en su vida de pasar desapercibidos o de que no los tomen en cuenta, con la intención de no llamar la atención. \n\n¿Y qué mejor manera de no llamar la atención que tener un camión feo? Nadie se va a preocupar por mirar un camión feo; quizás momentáneamente les llame la atención porque ven que el camión está descuidado o no se ve bien, pero seguramente es algo que creo que la gente no recordará.\n\n Generalmente, las cosas que no son agradables son las que no se recuerdan bien; al menos así pienso en mis procesos de memoria. \n\nTodas las cosas que son dolorosas y desagradables se borran y las olvido con el tiempo; aprendo de ellas, pero las olvido.  \n\nUn camión feo puede ser feo de muchas maneras también, y este es otro punto a abordar. Puede ser feo precisamente porque tiene ruidos muy alarmantes y muy preocupantes; quizás sus válvulas del motor están muy gastadas y echa humo.\n\n Tal vez es feo porque no solo su apariencia está deteriorada, sino que emite un olor desagradable. \n\nPuede que sea feo porque simplemente no está de moda; es un camión vintage, y con las nuevas tecnologías que existen, las nuevas pinturas y los nuevos accesorios, especialmente para vehículos, si este es un camión de estilo antiguo, seguramente los de la generación Z pensarán que es un camión feo.  \n\nQuizás simplemente es feo porque está en un entorno donde todo es hermoso, y como el camión es vintage y no encaja con todo el escenario en el que está, eso hace que destaque y se vea mucho más feo, porque seguramente si estuviera en un entorno que fuera feo como él, sería un camión normal. \n\nNo se podría decir que es un camión feo si está en un entorno feo, porque estaría encajando en lo que es; entonces, seguramente ese camión no es feo, pero está en un entorno hermoso.  \n\nPodría empezar a filosofar y decir muchas cosas sobre por qué el camión es feo, pero creo que con estos pocos temas que he tocado para el prompt de hoy es suficiente. \n\n\n</div>\n\n<center>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nThumbnail of the post edit using [canva.com ](https://www.canva.com/)and maded with [Bing ai](https://sl.bing.net/iSj05NEM4Hs)\n\n\n![sepmanclarciudad.jpg](https://images.hive.blog/0x0/https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/manclar/23u5SwkDMqTct4Kgqsv3RVeNxduJ3R3FDChujBLRHKcxWWPmnvnMa18nuuKjHxhFkJSK3.gif)\n<sub>This is my black cat \"manclar\", this hive name account is to honor his dead (it happened years ago).</sub>\n\n![](https://images.hive.blog/0x0/https://cdn.rcimg.net/MicroReylatos/eea03629/39af3c9a0e98248e06b4b9e61ceb136d.png)\n\n\nThe divisor is made by @albiro2050, if you want one made in your style, visit him and he will gladly take care of your commission.\n</center>\n\n---\n\n\n\nPosted Using [INLEO](https://inleo.io/@manclar/the-hidden-meaning-behind-an-ugly-truck-engspa-xy)",
